response: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut each peach half into 3 wedges. Arrange wedges on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Drizzle with lemon juice. In a small bowl, mix together the butter, sugar, and vanilla extract until well blendedbrush the mixture over the peaches. Roast in the preheated oven until the peaches are tender and the liquid is syrupy, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Divide the ice cream between 4 dessert dishes or bowlstop each with a scoop of raspberries and 3 or 4 peach wedges.

Mix together the butter, cream cheese and sugar in a bowl. Add the egg yolk, flavoring and rind. Stir well. Add the sifted flour and salt, mix well. Roll out the dough between 2 sheets of wax paper to 1/4 inch thickness. Chill for 30 minutes or overnight if you prefer. Cut out the shapes with a cookie cutter of your choice and place on a cookie sheet. Decorate with colored sugar before placing in the oven. Bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or till the edges are firm. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack. These cookies are also delicious with a little bit of ground cinnamon added to the mixture or mixed into the icing after the cookies have been decorated. They would be a perfect addition to any christmas cookie tray.

Wash potato. Slice each in half. Mix herbs into butter. Spread evenly over cut side of each piece. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Roast in 350f oven for 30 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven. Drizzle with a few drops of olive oil. Serve warm.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add sherbet and stir until dissolved. Add the cool whip lite. Fold in fruit. Serve.

Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill.

Crack egg into bag, add milk, salt & pepper to taste. Add 1 tsp butter. Close bag and shake well to mix. Cook on camp stove using a large frying pan. While egg is cooking, cut bag open to make a pocket for the filling. Add ham or bacon or both, chopped onion & green pepper and shake to mix. Add diced tomatoes & cheese. Cook for 2 minutes more then place in foil cupcake tray. Bake in 350F oven for 10 minutes.

Cook ham according to package directions. Meanwhile, thaw frozen hash brown potatoes according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook onion and ham until onion is tender. Stir in potatoes and cook for 30 seconds. Add the eggs to the pan, stirring gently with a spoon until the eggs are almost set. Sprinkle with the cheese. Serve immediately.

Place all spices in cheesecloth and tie in knot to form tea bag. Pour juice into saucepan and bring to a boil. Add tea bag and simmer 5 minutes. Remove tea bag. Cool to room temperature and serve chilled with ice. Serves 8.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Line baking sheet with foilset aside. Toss together first 5 ingredients in large bowl. Toss mixture gently. Add beanstoss to coat. Spread mixture evenly on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until crisp-tender and browned. Sprinkle with almonds. Makes 4 servings.

Cut each chicken breast in half widthwise. Pound each piece between 2 sheets of wax paper until 1/4 inch thick. Spread each piece of chicken with a thin layer of mustard. Top each piece of chicken with 1 sun-dried tomato slice and a few thyme leaves. Wrap each piece in prosciutto. Secure with toothpicks. Grill over medium heat until done. Top each piece of prosciutto-wrapped chicken with 1 piece of cheese and grill for 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Soak okra for 20 minutes in a bowl of cold water. Drain okra and squeeze out excess water. Combine flour, cornmeal, salt and cayenne pepper in shallow dish. Combine egg mixture with milk. Combine egg mixture with milk. Heat vegetable oil in deep skillet over medium heat. Batter okra pieces and fry in oil for 3 minutes on each side. Serve hot.

In a 5-quart clay pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add shallots and garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add pork, and stir-fry until no longer pink. Add sugar and fish sauce. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium and simmer until pork is tender. Stirring occasionally. Add egg and stir until fully scrambled. Serve with rice.

Mix together first 3 ingredientsstirring constantly. Let mixture cook over medium-low heat until boilingthen turn heat down to low. Let simmer about 4 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Add half-and-halfstir well. Serve with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, if desired.

In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil. Add lentils. Reduce heat to simmer & cook for 20 minutes. Remove from heat & let lentils sit in water. Meanwhile, saute onions & garlic in 2 Tablespoons olive oil until soft. Add carrots & celery & saute for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes & cook for 10 more minutes. Season with salt & pepper. Drain lentils & add to vegetables. Cook for 10 minutes. Add oregano. Serve over pasta.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Stir in flour. Cook over low heat until flour is browned. Add fish stock. Whisk until smooth. Cook until thickened. Add cream. Whisk until smooth. Add dill. Add lemon juice. Season with salt to taste. Serve with fish.

In a large bowl combine whole wheat and all-purpose flour, baking soda and ground nutmeg. Mix together. In another bowl, combine eggs, banana and applesauce. Stir together. Add honey to mixture and mix well. Stir mixture into dry ingredients and mix just until moistened. Spoon batter into 12 greased or paper lined muffin cups. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, salt and pepper until thoroughly combined. Add the tomatoes and onion. Toss to combine. Divide the tomato mixture among 4 plates. Top each with a few slices of the avocados. Sprinkle with the fresh thyme. Serve immediately.

Cream the butter and sugar together. Beat in the egg yolk, then add vanilla. In a separate bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Add to the creamed mixture alternately with milk until you have a soft dough. Chill dough until it is easy to handle. Roll out dough on a lightly floured board to about 1/4 inch thickness and cut into shapes with cookie cutters. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 8 to 10 minutes at 375f until lightly browned. Decorate as desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss garlic and cauliflower in a bowl with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and parsley. Serve hot.
name: broccoli cauliflower roastingredients: broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, garlic, extra virgin olive oil, salt, fresh ground black pepper, parmesan cheesepreparation:Toss the broccoli, cauliflower and optional garlic with olive oil. Spread on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated 450-degree oven for 20 minutes, or until browned and tender-crunchy. Stir once or twice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.
name: garlic breadingredients: mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic, dried basil, dried oregano, dried

Cook green beans in boiling water 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Saute olive oil in skillet. Add green beans and saute for 3 minutes. Stir in italian salad dressing. Top with parmesan cheese.

Place beans on baking sheet. Combine onions and oil in saucepan over medium heat. Cook 8-10 minutes or until onions are golden. Drain onions through wire sieve and set aside to cool slightly. Cook bacon over medium heat in frying pan until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add onions to bean mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, bacon bits and garlic. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until beans are crisp-tender.

Brown the bratwursts in the oil. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add apple and garlic. Continue to cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in the balsamic vinegar and pepper. Simmer until reduced to your desired consistency. Serve on the brats with some of the sauce drizzled over the top.

Boil hot dog for about 10 min. Drain. Cut into 1/2 inch slices. Brown bacon. Crumble into small pieces. Combine hot dog with relish, stuffed olives, pepper, crackers and mayonnaise. Spread onto crackers. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve on lettuce leafs.
This recipe is not my own but it's one I've made often and my family loves it!
Cut up the chicken into 1 inch chunks and cook until no longer pink inside.
Add the soup to the chicken in the crockpot and stir.
Serve on buns or with crackers.

Boil fresh beans in salted water until tender. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add beans and toss with butter to coat. Add garlic and sesame seeds. Stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
I just love Green Bean Recipes!

Mix together potato, onion, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place mixture in center of foil, fold ends and seal. Grill on med-high heat for 40-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cut open foil packet and add sour cream. Stir well, and sprinkle with bacon bits. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saute till golden. Add roma tomatoes. Add canned tomatoes. Add basil. Stir. Cook 5 minutes. Add oregano. Stir. Add tapenade. Cook for 1 minute more. Add cream. Stir. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with basil.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Mix flour and baking sodaset aside. In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add brown sugar and stir until melted. Add flour mixture all at once and stir quickly. Cook and stir 1 minute or until mixture bubbles and pulls away from sides of pan. Remove from heat. Stir in chips and nuts. Spread into greased 15x10x1-inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Spread ice cream topping over top of bars. Store bars in the refrigerator.
name: oaties
ingredients: sugar, butter, milk, vanilla, cocoa, rolled oatmeal, coconut
preparation:Melt together sugar, butter and milk. Take off heat and mix in vanilla and cocoa until smooth. Stir in oatmeal and coconut. Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper or foil. Chill.

Cook egg and let cool. Drain the tuna. Chop garlic. Cut into quarters. Add garlic and paprika to egg. Beat well. Add mayonnaise. Cut tomatoes, olives, parsley. Add to egg mixture. Taste. Add more seasoning if necessary. Serve on a lettuce leaf on top of the egg mixture. Serve with bread.

Pre heat oven to 350F. Mix sugar and vegetable oil together with the bananas. Beat egg and add to mixture. Then add flour, breadcrumbs and baking powder. Pour into greased pan. Bake for 35 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cut into squares while warm.

Saute chicken in a large saucepan until browned. Add 2 cups water or chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcover, simmer 30 minutes. Stir in beanscook 5 minutes. Add tomatoescook 5 minutes longer or until beans are tender. Top with cheese.

Spread ranch dressing between two slices of whole wheat bread. Lay a slice of bacon and an egg over each slice of bread. Top with a slice of turkey breast and avocado. Place a slice of blue cheese and a slice of tomato over each sandwich. Top each with a slice of lettuce. Spread ranch dressing over each top slice of bread. Makes 2 sandwiches.
Dip chickens in water and drain. Mix together flour and water to make a thin batter. Dip each piece of chicken in batter. Fry in hot oil. Salt to taste.

Thaw corn and drain well. Cook bacon until crisp. Add onion and green bell pepper and saute until tender. Mix together frozen corn, bacon and seasonings. Stir in enough melted butter to moisten. Serve at once.

Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the sweet onions and cook for about 10 minutes stirring occasionally until soft and starting to brown. Add the chicken broth and simmer for a few minutes until most of the liquid has evaporated. Add the cream cheese and continue to stir until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Transfer to a food processor and process until smooth. Add the mayonnaise and pistachios and process until combined. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Serve with vegetables or crackers.

Boil water in a large saucepan. Add the vegetables and cook until tender. Drain and discard water. Melt butter in skillet. Add vegetables, lemon juice, dried basil and onion powder. Cook for about 2 minutes or until butter is bubbly. Salt and pepper to taste.

Combine sugar, corn syrup and water in a 2-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Boil until the mixture reaches 300 degrees fahrenheit on a candy thermometer (15 to 20 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in the butter and half-and-half until incorporated. Pour the mixture into a buttered 9 x 13 inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle the blanched almonds evenly over the top and press down to adhere to the mixture. Let cool completely at room temperature or in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours or until firm before cutting into squares.
In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, corn syrup and water. Stirring constantly, cook until the mixture comes to a boil (about 10 minutes). Remove from the heat and stir in the butter and half-and-half until smooth and glossy. Pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spraysprinkle with almonds and press down g

Beat eggs, heavy cream, mozzarella, bel paese and parmesan cheeses together in medium sized mixing bowl until smooth. Stir in chives. In non-stick pan melt butter over medium heat, pour in egg mixture and cook without stirring until firm at bottom, about 5 minutes. Transfer pan to oven and bake until puffed and golden brown on top, about 10 minutes. Cut into wedges to serve.

To prepare the dip: Place edamame in a microwave-safe bowl and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain and set aside. Cut the onion into a fine dice and place in a food processor. Add the garlic and pulse until coarsely chopped. Add the parsley and the lemon juice. Add the miso and the kosher salt and process until combined. Add the sweet chili sauce and black pepper and pulse until combined. Add the reserved cooked edamame and pulse until well-combined. To prepare the chili-garlic oil, heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat until it shimmers. Add the garlic and the chili flakes and cook for about 1 minute, until the garlic is fragrant and just starting to turn golden. Remove from heat and set aside. To assemble the sandwiches, spread the bottom of each toasted roll with the garlic-chili mayonnaise and top with a generous amount of the miso-edamame dip. Garnish with the cucumber and top with the other toasted roll half. Slice in

Sprinkle pork chops with garlic powder. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Place the rings in a shallow dish. Add the chops one at a time. Cover the dish. Refrigerate overnight. Grill the chops as directed. Place the rings around the chops. Drain off the liquid. Grill the rings for a few minutes. Serve the pork chops with the rings.
I have a 14 inch cast iron skillet that has been passed down through the family for the past 20 years. My mom bought it for a few dollars at a garage sale when my older brother was a baby. It has been used to cook all sorts of things from potatoes to cornbread to steak.

Dust both sides of each fish fillet with flour and place on a baking sheet. Drizzle fish with melted butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes or until fish is opaque and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle fish with dried herbs and drizzle with fresh lemon juice before serving. Serve with steamed broccoli and steamed white rice.

Cook bacon. Add onion and green pepper and cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook until lightly browned. Drain off fat. Add milk, cook until heated through. Stir in cheese. In a separate bowl beat egg. Add to mixture and cook over low heat until set. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Peel and cut butternut squash in half. Scoop out seeds and stringy matter. Sprinkle with cocoa powder and toss to coat. Place on baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven. Let cool and scoop out flesh. Cream with remaining ingredients. Return to squash skins. Top with almonds.

In a large bowl, mix cream cheese, miracle whip and cucumber until well blended. Spread 1/2 of mixture in the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch dish. Sprinkle with tomato and olives. Spread remaining mixture over top. Sprinkle with feta. Serve with pita bread.

Mix together the flour, paprika and bread crumbs. Beat egg and milk together. Add the cheese and mix well. Dip the pieces of cheese into the egg mixture and then into the bread crumbs. Heat oil in a skillet. Fry the pieces until golden brown. Remove and drain. Serve warm.

In a large bowl toss together beans and corn. Add vinegar and oil. Mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add parsley and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Boil chicken breasts in broth for 45 min or until cooked through. Remove from broth, cool slightlydice and set aside. Melt butter in broth in saucepan on medium-low heatcook onion in butter until light brown. Add celery ribscook 2 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add chickencook 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in bouillon cubecook 1 minute or until bouillon dissolves. Add parsleyseason with salt and peppercook 3 minutes or until heated through. In a separate bowl, whisk eggsadd creamed corn. Stir in 1 cup of cooked chicken mixture. Ladle hot broth into serving bowlstop with egg mixture and remaining chicken. Serve hot.

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan leaving 2 tablespoons bacon drippings in pan. Add onion and cook until tender. Add garlic cloves. Cook 1 minute. Add diced tomatoes. Cook over medium heat until tomatoes are soft. Stir in chicken base and sugar. Cook 1 minute. Add okra. Season with pepper to taste. Cook 2 minutes or until okra is tender. Serve immediately over hot rice.

Peel potatoes. Cut into cubes. Place into boiling salted water. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add onions. Cut up frying chicken into cubes. Add to potatoes. Heat to boiling. Add lemon juice. Season with oregano, salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large pot, bring chicken broth to boil. Add couscous. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Add cherries, carrots, cucumbers. Let cool. In a small bowl, combine olive oil, vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper. Add couscous mixture. Stir to blend. Fold in almonds. Serve chilled.

Combine dijon mustard, butter and honey in a cup. Brush mixture on each fish fillet. Combine breadcrumbs, parsley and pecans. Sprinkle mixture evenly on top of fish. Bake at 450f for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cook corn according to package directions and drain liquid. In medium saucepan melt butter and add the cream cheese. Stir in the corn and heat through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a shallow 9x13 inch baking pan with butter-flavored cooking spray. Combine asparagus, 1 cup water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, pepper. Place in baking pan. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake 15 minutes. Combine lemon juice with 1/8 teaspoon salt. Remove foil. Bake 10 minutes longer or until done. Add mushrooms. Bake 5 minutes longer. Combine lemon juice mixture with 1/2 cup hot water. Pour over asparagus mixture. Toss to coat.

Mix pasta, tomato sauce, shrimp and peas in a large bowl. Add salt. Stir well. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

Prepare caramel sauce. Combine milk and caramels in a medium saucepan. Stir until smooth. Set aside. Cut apples in half horizontally. Remove seeds. Place each apple half cut side up. Spoon 1 1/2 teaspoons of the caramel sauce into each cavity. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar. Top each apple half with one chocolate chip. Drizzle remaining caramel sauce over the chocolate chips. Place sticks in the cavities and freeze for 4 hours or overnight. Serve.

Melt butter over medium heat. Add celery and onion. Saute until onion is translucent. Add broth and cook until vegetables are tender. Add frozen noodles and cook until tender but firm (about 5 minutes). Add turkey and cook for 5 minutes more. Melt flour and cold water together and stir into mixture. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

Brown onions and celery in butter. Add mushrooms. Blend in bread stuffing mix, chicken broth and seasonings. Bake in casserole at 350 for 20 minutes.

Break up macintosh bars in a large mixing bowl. In a small saucepan over low heat, stir the condensed milk until it is smooth. Stir in the margarine until it is melted. Pour over the macintosh crumbs and stir until well coated. Add the marshmallows and stir until they are well coated. Add the rice krispies and stir until well coated. Roll into walnut-sized balls. Place on waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an air-tight container.
The recipe of Rice Krispie treats is a very famous one. It is not only easy to make but also very tasty and can be used in making several other recipes as well. It is made from crispy Rice Krispie cereal that is mixed with butter or margarine, sugar and flavored with vanilla essence. Once these ingredients are mixed well, they are pressed into a baking tin to make bars.

In a double boiler over hot water, melt together the chocolate and the butter until smooth. Cool slightly. In a large bowl combine the powdered sugar and the milk until smooth. Stir in the melted chocolate mixture. Fold in the vanilla. Spread on cake.

In a deep bowl mix together flour, salt and baking powder. Add 1/3 cup of milk and mix well. Knead to a stiff dough and add 1-2 tbsp milk as required. Keep aside. In a pan, heat oil and add chile and onion and saute till light brown and soft. Add the chutney and salt and cook till the chutney thickens. Cool and grind to a smooth paste. Divide the dough into 15 equal portions and roll out into 6 inch diameter circles with the help of a rolling pin. Brush the edges of the rolled circles with egg wash and place a teaspoon of chutney mixture in the center and bring the edges together to form a half moon shape. Flatten the edges with a fork and fry them till golden brown from both the sides. Serve hot with tomato ketchup or mint chutney.

Prepare Cajun seasoning according to package directions. Rinse and drain shrimp and let cool. Cut in half and set aside. In small bowl mix mayonnaise, soft goat cheese, and Cajun seasoning. Gently fold in shrimp. Place green onion on bottom of each plate. Sprinkle with goat cheese and paprika. Divide salad mixture among plates. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Mix soup with mayonnaise until creamy. Add eggs, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Add vegetables. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake for 25-35 minutes or until set. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cut cucumbers into thin slices lengthwise. Peel onion and cut into thin strips lengthwise. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Refrigerate overnight. Keeps well for 1 week in a covered jar.
The Cucumber is a member of the gourd family. It is a popular vegetable that is eaten raw or cooked in many different cuisines. There are three common types of Cucumber, including English (slicing), Pickling (sour) and Armenian (burpless). They grow best in warm, humid conditions. Cucumber seeds should be planted about 1 inch deep in soil that has been fertilized with organic matter. The plants will need to be watered regularly during their growth cycle to ensure good yields at harvest time. Cucumbers are a good source of vitamin C and dietary fiber. They can be eaten fresh or pickled. Cucumbers are also a good source of potassium and magnesium. They are low in calories and fat and contain no cholesterol. Cucumbers are a good source of
Cut the red onion into quarters. Melt the butter with the onion, jalapeno and sugar. Cook for 5 minutes. Add kahlua, broth, and heavy cream. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Butter one side of each slice of bread. Put buttered side down on pan and spread with cheese. Spread with avocado on other side. Place second slice of buttered bread on top of the first slice and press down on top slice. Cook 2 minutes on each side until cheese is melted. Slice in half and serve.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and stir for a minute. Add stock and bring to boil. Grate zucchini. Add salt to water. Let stand 15 minutes. Drain off excess water and add beaten egg. Add Bisquick, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Mix well. Fry as patties on hot greased griddle or skillet. Serve as a side dish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Lightly spray a baking pan with cooking spray. Place chicken in baking pan and drizzle with olive oil and paprika. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until no longer pink inside. Remove from oven and cover with banana slices. Return to oven for 5 minutes or until banana slices are soft and browned. Remove from oven and cover with sour cream and walnuts and sprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugar. Serve with basmati rice and green beans.

Fry bacon crumbles until crisp. Crumble bacon into a bowl. In a separate bowl combine mustard, pineapple juice and brown sugar. When ready to serve, place about 1/2 cup mustard mixture on top of each chicken breast half. Sprinkle each half with about 2 tablespoons crumbled bacon, then top with a small slice of fresh pineapple.

Cream together sugar and shortening. Beat in egg. Sift together dry ingredients, and add to mixture. Beat until well blended. Stir in apples and nuts. Drop in the shape of a ball on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375, for 12-15 minutes.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine broth, broccoli and carrot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered until vegetables are crisp-tender, 4 to 6 minutes. Drain and return to pan. Add rice. Stir until mixture is thoroughly heated. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice and pepper. Serves 4. Cooking time listed is for rice heating time.

Preheat oven to 400. On one half of each tortilla, spread half of the potatoes. Top with half of the onion and half of the black pepper. Sprinkle with half of the cheese and half of the jalapeno rings. Top with remaining tortilla half. Bake for 10 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Cut into wedges. Serve with hot salsa.

Blend sour cream and eggs until smooth. Add remaining ingredients. Pour into prepared unbaked pie shell. Bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 and bake for 1 hour or until knife comes out clean. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

In large saucepan saute the onions slowly until tender but not brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in ale and stock until mixture is smooth. Add potatoes, bring to boil, reduce heat to low and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in butter and season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide into 4 bowls. Sprinkle each with 1 oz of grated cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl combine mustards. On each of 6 rolls place 1 tomato slice, 1 1/2 teaspoon mustard mixture, 1/2 mozzarella slice, 1/2 artichoke heart, 1/2 mushroom. Spread each sandwich with 1 tablespoon dressing. Place in shallow baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until melted. Serve immediately.

Mix together corn flake crumbs, salt and pepper in a shallow bowl. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Combine egg whites with skim milk to make a thick paste. Dip each piece of chicken in egg paste. Dip chicken in corn flake crumbs. Place on baking sheet. Bake in oven at 450 degrees for 20 minutes. Baste once with melted margarine. Serve with sauce or dip.

Boil the egg noodles in boiling water with a pinch of salt for 3 minutes or until tender. Drain the water and put the noodles in the pot. Melt the butter and pour over the hot noodles. Stir to combine. Break the egg into the hot mixture and stir until cooked. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with shredded Parmesan cheese.

In a large saute pan over medium-high heat melt the butter. Add the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds. Add the red chili and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the seasonings and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the shrimp and saute for 3 minutes. Add the tomato halves and continue to saute for another 2-3 minutes. Toss the dish. Serve over pasta.

Cook the milk and sugar to a simmer. In the meanwhile beat the egg yolks with the salt and the extracts till they become creamy and pale yellow. Pour the milk back in the pan and cook it over medium heat while constantly stirring till it gets thick. Remove from the heat and pour the mixture into the container of an ice cream maker. Turn on the machine and let it process for at least 20 minutes. At the end of the cycle, pour the gelato into a freezer container and let it freeze for at least 2 hours. Serve immediately or freeze it for later.

Sift together 2 cups of flour, 1 tsp. of salt and 1 tsp of baking soda in a large bowl. Cut in 1 cup of butter and 1 cup of sugar until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add 1 cup of boiling water to mixture and stir until dough forms. Remove dough from bowl and shape into a round loaf on a well-greased cookie sheet or in a large cast iron skillet. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes until golden brown and crusty on top. Cool in pan on a rack for 5 minutes then turn out on a rack to cool completely. Beat 1/3 cup of boiling water, 1 tsp of vanilla and 1 1/2 cups of confectioners sugar together until smooth. Spread half the frosting on top of the cooled loaf and sprinkle with 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts or pecans and 1 cup of chopped dates or dried fruit of choice. Spread remaining frosting over top of loaf and spr

Preheat oven to gas mark 3 (170c/150c fan). In a large bowl, mix the flour with the cocoa and baking powder. In a saucepan, melt the butter and sugar together then stir in the weetabix, milk and vanilla extract. Allow to cool a little before adding to the flour mixture and stirring to form a soft dough. Put onto a lightly oiled tray and bake for 25 minutes. Allow to cool on the tray for five minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
I have not tried it yet, but it sounds delicious and I will certainly try it soon!

Thanks again for all the work you put into this site and for sharing the recipes with everyone for free!

Melt butter in saucepan, add the brown sugar and allow to cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the juice concentrate and the mandarin orange pieces and heat through. Add salt and pour over the baby carrots and mix well. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion in 1 teaspoon olive oil until just softened about 3 minutes. Add garlic and saute another 1 minute. Add peppers and saute another 2 minutes or until slightly softened. Add broth, Sazon Goya, oregano, and beansbring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes or until thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into serving bowls and top with cilantro and tomato.
Combine the spices in a plastic bag. Add the meat. Close the bag and shake well. Place the beef in the crockpot. Add the peppers and the liquid. Cook on low for 8 hours.

Bring broth to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in saffron and cook 1 minute. Add orzo. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently for 10 minutes or until tender. Add oil. Toss. Sprinkle parsley over. Season with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook shrimp in oil, 3 minutes on each side. Add broth, parsley, lemon slices, salt, pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Serve over orzo. Garnish with more parsley.

Boil water in a medium-size pot and add the carrots, cover and simmer for 10 minutes, until tender-crisp. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons of the cooking liquid. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat, add the reserved cooking liquid, the chicken broth, parsley and dill seed, bring to a boil and remove from the heat. Combine the hot liquid with the cooked carrots in a serving bowl. Sprinkle with lemon juice.

Combine ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, mustard and worcestershire in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Set aside to cool and thicken while preparing the rest of the meal. Trim fat from roast and cut in half lengthwise to make two thin roasts. Combine the remaining marinade ingredients in a large ziploc bag and add the roasts. Seal bag and marinate in refrigerator at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours. Remove roasts from marinade and add to slow cooker. Add the marinade to the slow cooker and cover with water. Cook roasts on low for 6 to 8 hours. Remove roasts and slice thinly across the grain. Serve on hot dog rolls with a dollop of barbecue sauce from the slow cooker and some shredded cabbage. Serve additional barbecue sauce for dipping. Serve with your favorite salad.
My husband loves this recipe! He is in the military and I sent it to him so he could make it for his friends at the barracks. Thank you!

Boil spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook stirring for about 1 minute. Add the spaghetti and toss to heat through. Mix in the soy sauce and season with pepper. Add the green onion and toss. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Melt butter in a double-boiler over hot water. Stir in chocolate until meltedremove from heat and cool slightly. Beat together eggs and sugar in a large bowl. Add cooled chocolate mixture and beat until well blended. In a small bowl, stir together flour, baking powder and saltset aside. Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk to egg mixture until smooth. Stir in Kahluapour into prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
Fry sliced potatoes in hot oil until golden brown. Sprinkle curds over top. Pour beef gravy over all. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheets. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat the butter until very creamy. Add the sugars and beat until very well blended. Beat in the eggs and the vanilla. Reduce the speed to low and add the flour and the baking powder. Beat just until the dough comes together. Stir in the chocolate chunks. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoons 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake 12 to 15 minutes until the edges are just set. Let cool for 1 minute on the pan then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours before serving. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.

Soak the beans overnight. Cook the next morning in a large pot of boiling water. Drain the beans. Combine the beans with the lard. Add the water. Cook over medium heat. Add the salt. Cook until tender.

Combine margarine, brown sugar and flour in saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly until smooth and well blended. Add white sugar and light corn syrup, stirring constantly until well blended and smooth. Add peanut butter chips and chunky peanut buttercook and stir until mixture is bubbly and smooth. Add corn flakes and stir until blended. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Let cool completelyabout 1 hour. Store in airtight container. Makes 4 1/2 dozen.

In a large saucepan combine tomato sauce, paste, water and garlic salt. Stirring well. Heat over medium heat until it begins to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add sugar and salt. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in milk. Serve immediately.

Place tomatoes in large mixing bowl. Add vodka and celery salttoss to combine well. Place in glass bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve. Before serving sprinkle with lemon pepper seasoning to taste.

In a large pot, brown the ground beef with the onions. Add enough cold water to cover the meat. Add oil, tomatoes, green bananas, uncooked rice, and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 20-30 minutes or until the rice is cooked. Serve with cooked rice.

Preheat broiler. In large bowl mix together lime juice, chicken powder, cayenne pepper, and salt. Add chicken and marinate at least 30 minutes. On each of 12 skewers thread 2 pieces of chicken and 2 wedges of mango. Broil 3 inches from heat 3-5 minutes per side or until juices run clear. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut the loaf on a diagonal into 1 inch wide pieces. Spread 1/2 the cream cheese on each slice. Add the remaining cream cheese and stir well. Dip each piece of bread into the mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.
I'd like to make the cheesy jalapeno popper pull apart bread. I have a round loaf. What would be the best way to cut it?
Cut the loaf on a diagonal into 1 inch wide pieces.

Boil cauliflower until tender. Remove from water and add mushrooms. Saute with butter until browned. Add onions and green pepper. Cook until tender. Add heavy cream and continue cooking until thickened. Remove from heat. Add cheese and scotch. Season with nutmeg and salt and pepper. Stir in oatmeal. Divide into 4 buttered casserole dishes. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Garnish with mixed nuts.

Breadcrumbs: mix togehter in bowl. Shrimp: wash, pat dry. Cut tail off. Butterfly shrimp. Salt and pepper. Mix seasoning in. Melt olive oil in pan. Add butterflied shrimp. Sauté til pink. Add breadcrumb mixture. Stir til lightly browned. Add mozzarella cheese and parsley. Stir til melted. Remove from heat. Serve.

In a skillet or wok heat 2 teaspoons of oil. Cook beef until it is brown and crumbled. Add garlic and green onions. Cook until fragrant. Add kimchi and soy sauce. Stir thoroughly. Add cooked rice and eggs. Stir thoroughly. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine stock, cornstarch and soy sauce. In a skillet heat oil and saute green onions. Add garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add tenderloin and brown. Add stock mixture. Bring to a boil. Add broccoli and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with sesame seeds. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix meat, cracker crumbs, soup mix, eggs, ketchup, steak sauce until moistened. Shape into loaf or roll and place in shallow baking pan. Bake uncovered for 1 1/2 hours. Makes 6-8 servings.
Peel and dice all the vegetables. Bring to boil and cook until soft. Mash thoroughly. Season to taste.

Prepare the filling: In a large saucepan combine the peaches, sugar, cornstarch and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the Jell-O. Pour into a 9 inch pie plate. Prepare the crust: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the flour and salt in a large bowl. Cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add the water, tossing with a fork just until the dough holds together. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and roll out the dough to a 12 inch circle. Fit the dough into the prepared pie plate. Fold the edges under and flute. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking for another 25 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375. In medium skillet, cook sausage and onion until sausage is no longer pink. Drain. In large bowl, combine sausage and onion with other ingredients. Spread in shallow 2 quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered 20 to 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden. Serve with biscuits.

Preheat oven to 375. Prepare pie shell. Beat condensed milk and lemon juice. Add bananas. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 25 minutes or until center is set. Cool and refrigerate. Beat together sweetened whipped cream and cocoa. Spread over pie. Top with remaining whipped cream and cocoa. Garnish with toasted coconut.

Combine all ingredients in large bowl and mix well. Spray 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray. Spread crab mixture in pan and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with crackers or chips.
If you are using pre-cooked crabmeat, drain it thoroughly and discard the juices. If you are using fresh crabmeat, pick through it to remove any shells and place the crabmeat in a fine wire strainer set over a large bowl. Rinse the crabmeat under cool running water for a few minutes, then squeeze it gently to remove the last traces of shell and water.
In a large bowl, mix together the crabmeat, mayonnaise, mustard, hot pepper sauce and parsley. Spread the mixture in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dishtop with the cheeses.
Bake uncovered 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned on top.
Serve warm with crackers or

Butter one side of each slice of whole wheat bread and put down on a hot skillet or pan. Spread 1-2 tablespoons of fat-free mayo on one of the slices and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of shredded provolone. Add 1-2 slices of deli-roasted turkey to the other slice of bread. Spread 1-2 tablespoons of fat-free mayo on that slice and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of shredded provolone. Put both slices of bread together and let them cook for 1-2 minutes or until you get that crispy golden brown color. Serve and enjoy.

Soak the dried beans in enough cold water to cover them by 2 to 3 inches for 8 hours or overnight. Drain the beans and place them in the slow cooker along with the bacon, onion, liquid smoke, molasses and brown sugar. Cover the slow cooker with the lid and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours. Remove the bacon from the slow cooker with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the jalapeno to the slow cooker and mix well. Let the mixture cook on high for 1 to 2 more hours or until the liquid has reduced by half. Season the mixture with the bacon pieces and stir to combine well. Serve immediately with cornbread or toast.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the chile flakes and stir for 10 seconds. Add the parsley and cook for another 10 seconds. Add the mussels and the sherry and cook for 5 minutes. Add the parsley and the juice of half a lemon and cook for a further 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. Cut each peach into 4 wedges. Mix 2 tablespoons of honey and 2 teaspoons of balsamic vinegar in a small bowl and brush on both sides of each wedge. Place on an ungreased baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl combine 1 tablespoon of honey and 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar and brush on both sides of each wedge. Place on an ungreased baking sheet and broil for 30 seconds or until glazed. Sprinkle each wedge with 1 teaspoon of feta cheese. Serve warm or cold.

Cook celery and onions in butter until tender. Crumble cornbread and add to vegetables. Add beaten eggs and season with salt and pepper and sage. Add enough milk to moisten and form a ball that will hold its shape. Bake in a greased pan at 375f for 45 minutes or until light brown.

Preheat oven to 350F. Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, and eggs in large bowl. Beat 2 minutes with electric mixer at medium speed. Stir in fruit cocktail and milk. Pour into greased 9-inch square baking dish. Bake 35 minutes or until knife inserted 1 inch from edge comes out clean. Cool. Spread with coconut. Mix butter and vanilla extract in small bowl. Drizzle over coconut. Makes 12 servings.

Cut the fish open and remove any bones or organs. Fill with chopped garlic and parsley and some of the preserved lemon slices. Tie the fish closed and place on a baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil and add pepper and salt and bake at 160 c for 45 minutes. Serve with a salad and some rice or couscous.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease muffin cups. In bowl, cream brown sugar and molasses. Add butter. Beat until smooth. Add egg. Add pecans and mix. Stir in squash. In separate bowl sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Add to molasses mixture. Stir until just moistened. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake 18-20 minutes or until done. Makes 12 muffins.
name: potato-squash casseroleingredients: butter, onion, flour, milk, salt, black pepper, baking powder, parmesan cheese, mozzarella cheese, cooked potatoes, cooked yellow squashpreparation:Heat oven to 350. Melt butter in 2-quart casserole. Stir in onion and flourcook until browned. Add milk and stir until smooth. Stir in cheeses and seasonings. Add potatoes and squash. Mix lightly. Bake uncover

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Whisk in the worcestershire sauce, salt and cinnamon. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Add the garlic powder and cayenne and hot sauce and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and stir in the pecans. Spread on a greased baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Sprinkle with sea salt before serving.

In a medium bowl, combine the first 5 ingredientsbeat at medium speed of a mixer until smooth. Spoon into a 9-in. pie plate coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until set. Spread with chutneysprinkle with green onions. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and place them into a large baking dish with the lid on. Cook for 50-60 minutes or until the potatoes are fork tender. While the potatoes are cooking, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. In a medium bowl whisk together the brown sugar, maple syrup, honey, bourbon and cayenne pepper. Add the melted butter to the bowl with the liquid mixture and whisk to combine. Taste the glaze to make sure it is spicy enough for you and if not add more cayenne pepper. Drain the cooked potatoes from the cooking liquid into a large bowl. Add the glaze to the bowl of potatoes and toss to combine. Season the glazed potatoes with salt to taste. Spread the glazed potatoes into a 9″ x 13″ baking dish and spread evenly. Bake for 10 minutes to let the glaze harden on top of the potatoes. Serve warm.

Peel apples. Cut into halves or quarters. Add allspice and cinnamon. Add 1/2 cup of water per 1 pound of apples. Bring to a boil. Simmer until tender, 8-10 minutes for firm apples or 5-7 minutes for tender apples. Remove from heat and mash with potato masher or use food mill for a smoother consistency. Serve warm or at room temperature. Store leftovers in refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Lightly beat the onion, garlic, and butter together in a small saucepan over medium heat until butter melts. Cook for about 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the orange and lemon juices. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Add the cod. Simmer for 4-5 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve.
Prepare cake as directed on box. Cool. Cut into 4 layers. Top each layer with 3/4 cup pie filling. Top with 3rd layer. Drizzle with frosting. Sprinkle with nuts.

In large skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef and onion until the beef is browned. Drain off any excess fat. Add the flour and stir until blended. Add the water and stir until the mixture is smooth. Stir in the salt, pepper, and the ketchup. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the mustard. Serve on hamburger buns. Recipe.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs and add the cream and the milk. Set aside. In a small saucepan cook the scallions and butter until the scallions are softened and the butter is slightly brown and caramelized. Pour the eggs and cream mixture into the pie shell and add the scallions and butter. Bake at 375 for about an hour or until the pie is set. Let cool completely before slicing. Serve warm or cold.

Combine juice and crushed pineapple in blender. Add banana slices and blend until smooth. Pour into molds, insert sticks and freeze until firm. To remove from molds, run hot water around bottom of molds.

Heat oven to 375. In large bowl combine butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla. Combine flour and salt and stir into the mixture. Stir in nuts and chocolate syrup. Spread into greased 11 x 7 inch pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into bars. Makes about 4 dozen.
In a skillet saute butter and garlic over medium heat until browned. Add flour and stir. Add chicken broth and stir until smooth. Add lemon juice and capers and simmer.

For the sauce, combine preserves and mustard in a small bowl. In another small bowl, combine curry powder and cashews. Dip each chicken breast into the sauce and then into the cashew mixture. Place the chicken in a lightly greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes.
Combine all ingredients except vegetables in a blender or food processor. Puree. Add vegetables and mix thoroughly. Marinate for at least 2 hours. Drain and serve.

Mix the lime juice and buttermilk in a large bowl. Add the razor clams and cover the bowl. Let stand for about 10 minutes. While the razor clams are marinating, heat the peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. While the oil is heating, prepare the bread crumb mixture. In a small bowl, combine the panko bread crumbs, salt, pepper, and butter. When the oil is hot, dip each razor clam in the bread crumb mixture and fry until golden brown. Remove the razor clams from the saucepan. Using a slotted spoon or skimmer, transfer the razor clams to a paper towel lined plate to drain. In a small bowl, mix the remaining lime juice and buttermilk from the marinating razor clams. Toss the razor clams in the remaining marinade until well coated. Serve the razor clams with the butter-lime dressing.

In a large saucepan, stir together the cocoa and sugar. Add water and bring to a boil. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens to a thick syrup. Add the coffee and heat to desired temperature. Stir in the frozen yogurt and whipped topping. Drop 10 cookies in the bottom of each glass and pour over the mixture. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine flour, butter and sugar. Add half and half and mix until the dough just comes together. Chill for 30 minutes. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a 12 in. round. Transfer to a 9 in. pie pan. Flute the edges and fill with bourbon infused blueberries. Brush the edges with the remaining egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 400f for 1 hour, or until the crust is golden. Cool on a wire rack. In a medium bowl, stir together the sour cream, sugar, cornstarch and salt. Whisk in the egg yolks and lime zest. In a small saucepan, combine the half and half and the lime juice. Stir constantly over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from the heat and slowly add the hot milk mixture to the egg yolk mixture. Stir constantly. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Pour the hot mixture through a fine

Make shortcrust pastry. Roll out and use to line a 20cm flan tin. Prick base and sides. Refrigerate. Meanwhile, heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Add garlic and onion and fry until soft. Add red and green peppers and cook until soft. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Preheat oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5. Beat egg with cream until light and fluffy. Add to cooled peppers. Spoon into tart case and bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Wash the cranberries. Drain the liquid and save it. Put the sugar and the drained liquid in a medium saucepan. Cook over low heat until sugar dissolves. Stir constantly until a firm ball forms. Remove from heat. Cool to room temperature. Pour the marshmallows into the cooled berry mixture. Add the drained fruit cocktail. Beat the heavy cream until stiff. Fold into the cranberry mixture. Refrigerate. Serve on lettuce leaves or on a bed of spinach.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until al dente, about 8 minutes. Drain, then set aside. Meanwhile, heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, season generously with kosher salt, then cook, stirring occasionally, until mushrooms are browned and tender, about 10 minutes. Add chicken and cook, stirring to break up the pieces, until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in cream. Add the mushroom mixture to the pasta and stir until sauce coats all the noodles. Add the frozen peas and Parmesan and cook 1 minute more. Toss in the parsley before serving.

Spread mayonnaise on both slices of bread. Layer on half of the onion. Sprinkle lightly with salt and black pepper. Layer on tomato slices and remaining onion. Top with remaining slice of bread. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and sour cream. Mix well. Cut each crescent roll in half lengthwise. Divide the cream cheese mixture among 24 pieces. Place 1 teaspoon of the mixture in the centre of each half. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the taco seasoning. Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the tomato mixture on each piece of cheesy dough. Sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon of the black olives and 1/8 teaspoon of the green onion. Top with 1/4 teaspoon of the cheddar cheese. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes or until heated through and golden. Cool for 1 minute. Serve warm. Makes 24.

Season pork chops with onion soup mix and brown them on each side. Cut potatoes into bite size pieces. Pour cans of soup into bottom of 9×13 pan. Lay the browned pork chops on top and cover them with potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle cheese on top. Return to oven until cheese melts. Serve hot.
