Heat oven to 400 degrees. On a baking sheet, toss onion rings with oil until evenly coated. Bake until charred. Turn frequently. Meanwhile, place vinegars in a small bowl and whisk together. Whisk in olive oil. Add crushed red pepper flakes. Stir in olives. Remove from oven when onion rings are well caramelized. Cool onions and olives slightly. Add black olives. Pour vinegar mixture over. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl, combine the flour and saltcut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stirring with a fork, add the egg and sour cream until dough just comes together. Press the dough into a ballwrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least one hour. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Fold the edges up over the filling. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Serves 6.

Prepare dressing by mixing lemon juice, olive oil and seasoning together. Slice daikon radish and fennel bulb into thin slices. Slice carrot and onion into thin strips. Combine all vegetables together with dressing and seasoning to taste. Serve as a salad.

In a small mixing bowl combine the mayonnaise and onion. Stir to blend. Stir in the chives and swiss cheese. Spread the mixture on the sourdough bread and top with another slice of the bread. Grill the sandwich in a panini press or oven-grill until the bread is lightly toasted.

Preheat oven to 350F. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with nonstick cooking spray or line with parchment paper with sides overhang. In medium bowl, mix flour and salt. Beat in cream cheese and sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs one at a time and pour into prepared baking dish and bake for 50 minutes or until center is set and crust is golden brown. Cool completely and then spread with frosting. Cut into squares.

Combine the first five ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Stir in the oil and vanilla. Add the milk and stir until well blended. Stir in the nuts. Pour batter into a greased and floured 8x4-in. loaf pan. Bake at 325 for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing. Cool completely on a wire rack before slicing.

In a medium bowl combine the cucumber, onion, lemon juice, and garlic. Let stand 15 minutes. Stir in dill. Blend in the yogurt. Spoon into a pretty serving bowl. Sprinkle with cheese and black pepper. Serve with pita bread.

In a large bowl, whisk together whipping cream and half and half until stiff peaks form. Fold in the chocolate chips. Serve immediately or store in the refrigerator until ready to use. To assemble the Chocolate Thunder, place 1/2 cup of the chocolate whipped cream in each of 4 small bowls. Top each portion with 1/2 of the toasted marshmallows and a pinch of the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Garnish with additional toasted marshmallows and serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine first four ingredients. Stir frequently until boiling. Cook until mixture thickens slightly, about five minutes. Remove from heat and stir in hot dogs. Serve hot dogs in buns with glazed apples.

Trim the woody ends from the asparagus. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the asparagus to the boiling water and cook until the spears are bright green but still crisp-tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain the asparagus and spread it out on a platter. Drizzle with the balsamic vinegar, sprinkle with the salt and pepper, and top with the butter and cheese. Toss to mix. Serve immediately.

Cook the onion in the butter until soft and translucent. Add the water and the fish and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sour cream and cook for a couple more minutes. Adjust seasoning. Serve with potatoes or noodles.
Saut the onion in butter until soft. Add the sage leaves. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until onion is transparent. Add the breadcrumbs. Mix well. Serve warm.

Melt half of the cheese on top of each corn tortilla. Top with scallions, pepper and cilantro. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Fold tortilla over and press edges firmly together with spatula. Cook until browned on both sides. Cut into wedges. Serve with lime wedges.

Place the tomato sauce in a 13X9-inch baking pan. Arrange the onion slices on top of the sauce. Arrange the tuna steaks on top of the tomato sauce. Sprinkle with the cumin, salt and black pepper. Drizzle with the olive oil. Arrange the black olives and sprinkle with the garlic powder. Top with the parsley. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes. Serve with the rice.

Pour boiling water over tea bags in a saucepan. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar and cranberry juice. Return to medium heat and stir until sugar is dissolved and mixture is heated through. Remove from heat. Stir in wine. Pour tea into cups. Garnish with fruit slices.

Peel the pineapple. Cut it into small pieces and place into a blender with the ice cubes. Add the sugar and the lemon juice. Blend until the fruit is smooth and the mixture is slushy. Serve in glasses.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic and ginger. Set aside. Rinse the green beans and cut off the ends. Trim the stems from the mushrooms. Chop the stems into small pieces. Drain the liquid from the mushroom caps and set the caps aside. Mix the stems and caps with the soy sauce mixture. Lay the green beans on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with the mushroom mixture. Bake for 12 minutes. Stir the mixture, and sprinkle with the red chili flakes. Bake for another 10 minutes, or until the beans are tender. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions, and cook until they are tender. Add the spinach, stirring constantly. Cook until it wilts. Add the rice. Add the water, cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the saucepan, remove from the heat and let the rice stand for 5 minutes.

Saute the onion in cooking oil in a pan until translucent. Add the beans and stir to mix. Add the lemon juice. Cook for 5 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Remove from heat and stir in the sour cream. Serve with toasted tortilla chips, chopped parsley and chopped radishes.

Sprinkle half the sultanas onto the base of the pastry case. Top with the apricots. Cover with the remaining sultanas. In a small bowl mix the honey with the lemon juice. Brush the top of the apricots with the honey mixture. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is lightly browned. Serve with the coconut sprinkled on top.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in curry powder and salt. In a separate bowl, combine pecans with mixed fruit. Toss with butter mixture and spread evenly on a baking sheet. Bake at 325f for 20 minutes or until nuts are golden brown. Allow to cool completely before serving.

Heat oven to 350F. Beat together butter, sugar and eggs. Stir in flour, baking powder, vanilla and almond extracts. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until set and lightly browned. Cool 1 minute before removing from sheet.
name: lemon drop cookiesingredients: shortening, unsalted butter, sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, saltpreparation:Cream together shortening and butter until fluffy. Beat in sugar, lemon zest and juice until well mixed. Beat in egg yolks one at a time until mixture is smooth. In another bowl combine cake flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk beginning and ending with flour mixture. Beat on high for 3 minutes until smooth. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 C

Thaw fruit in refrigerator overnight. To serve, layer each fruit in a glass bowl in the following order: orange juice, strawberries, pineapple, mandarin oranges, bananas. Drizzle with lemon juice. Serve immediately.

In a sauce pan, bring 1/2 cup of water to boil. Add 1 cup of sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the cranberries and 2 tablespoons of the chopped orange peel. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer uncovered for 5-6 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the chopped orange. Let cool. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. This can be prepared a day ahead and refrigerated. Before serving sprinkle with the chopped walnuts.

Spread 1 side of each slice of bread with mayonnaise. Arrange 1/2 of the cheese, cilantro, oregano and garlic on 1 slice of bread. Top with pepperoni and tomato slices. Top with remaining bread. Repeat with remaining filling. Cut in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Pour cornmeal into a 9x13 inch baking pan.Pour water over cornmeal and mix with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Stir and bake for another 20 minutes.Remove from the oven and add Gruyere, creme fraiche and salt and pepper. Stir and bake for 15 minutes more.Allow mixture to cool before serving.

Brown lard in pan over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, tomatoes, taco seasoning, cayenne. Add water. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in rice. Simmer until rice is tender. Add chicken broth and tomato sauce. Simmer until heated through. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add brussels sprouts, vinegar, sugar and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until tender. Uncover and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Line a jelly roll pan with waxed paper. Place half of the grahams in the pan. Melt the wafers according to package directions. Pour over the grahams and spread to cover. Top with the remaining grahams and press down. Let stand until cool. Crumble the nuts and sprinkle over the top. Melt the butter in the microwave for about 30 seconds. Stir in the vanilla. Pour over the top. Spread to evenly coat. Let stand until firm. Cut into squares. Store in airtight container.

Mix together caramels and water in microwave-safe bowl. Heat for about one minute. Stir well. Pour over the cereal and stir well. Spread on wax paper. Cool and break apart.
The above recipes are reprinted with permission from www.fitness.com.
These recipes look delicious. I love rice krispy bars and I’m going to try the crispy snack recipe. I think it would be great with some mini-marshmallows mixed in too.
I know! I love the snack recipes and I’m sure the kids would too. I’ll definitely have to make them for my little ones. I’m sure I’ll have some left over for me too.

In a large bowl dissolve jello completely in boiling water. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Add sour cream and stir. Spread in crust. Chill several hours. Top with orange zest and lightly sweetened whipped topping.
Place all of the ingredients in a food processor. Process for 30 seconds until the ingredients are finely chopped. Serve with tortilla chips or as a condiment.

In a medium saucepan, saute rice and olive oil until lightly browned and aromatic. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Add lime juice and zest and stir to combine. Let rest for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve. Garnish with cilantro.

Beat egg and add milk, salt and cheddar cheese. Mix well and fold in bacon and onions. Blend until smooth. Divide into pie shells or custard cups and bake for about 12 minutes or until set. Serve hot with fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In a large bowl combine cereal, pretzel twists and pecans. In a saucepan combine butter, honey and corn syrup over medium heat until melted. Stir in vanilla. Remove from heat. Pour over dry ingredients. Stir until coated well. Spread on large cookie sheets. Bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Break apart. Store in an airtight container.

In a large bowl, cream the oil, maple syrup and orange juice together. Add the potato. Add the flour mixture. Add the remaining ingredients. Bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes. Cool. Makes about 60. Serve with apple butter.
I have been searching for a good vegan cookie recipe for a long time.
I was really surprised with how easy and delicious these are.
These are my favorite! They are wonderful with a cup of tea.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring the barley and 3 cups of the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer, covered for 35 minutes. Remove from heatlet stand for 5 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Combine the strained barley and the remaining 2 cups water in a pitcher or a large bowlstir in the honey and the lemon juice. Serve over ice. Makes 6 servings.

Cube roast and brown in a skillet or dutch oven until well browned. Drain off fat if necessary. Add tomatoes and chiles. Simmer 15 minutes. Add taco seasoning and water. Simmer 30 minutes longer or until roast is tender. Serve on warm flour or corn tortillas with toppings such as lettuce, shredded cheese and salsa.

Heat oven to 350. For sauce combine soup, mayonnaise, lemon juice, curry powder in a bowl. In bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish layer frozen broccoli, chicken and sauce. Sprinkle with grated cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Can be eaten plain or on top of rice.

Combine paprika, salt and pepper in small bowl. Rub evenly over both sides of the flank steaks. Let stand at room temperature for 10 minutes. Heat a gas grill to high heat. Grill flank steaks for 6-8 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Let rest 5 minutes before slicing across the grain.

Cream shortening and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until smooth. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix well. Stir in crushed pineapple and coconut. Drop by teaspoonful onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes. Transfer to wire rack. Yield: 3 1/2 dozen.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a bowl. Beat at low speed of a mixer until combinedbeat at medium speed 30 seconds. Combine applesauce, eggs, sour cream, and vanilla in another bowlbeat well. Stir into flour mixture just until combined. Pour batter into a 9 x 13 pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes on a wire rackcut into 8 squares. Sprinkle with powdered sugar just before serving.

In a large bowl, combine chocolate and butter. Heat in a double-boiler or in a microwave oven until melted. Add the whole milk, heavy whipping cream, granulated sugar, and vanilla extractmix well. Serve warm over ice cream or as a topping for cakes or pies.

Soften cream cheeseadd heavy cream and sour cream. Bring to boilingadd dried beef and onion flakescook for about 5 minutes until onions are tender. Add green pepperscook until peppers are tender. Add pecanscook for 2 minutes. Stir in butter until meltedadd salt to taste. Serve with crackers or chips.

Preheat oven to 400f. Beat egg and milk in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, paprika, salt and black pepper. In a third bowl combine the egg mixture and all-purpose mixture. Dip each piece of chicken into the egg mixture then the breading mixture. Place in baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Turn pieces of chicken over. Bake for another 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve over rice.

Spread Dijon mustard on one side of each slice of bread. Place a slice of goat cheese on one side of one slice of bread. Add a slice of tomato to one side of the other slice. Place a slice of goat cheese on top. Broil for 4 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm. Makes 2 sandwiches.
Combine cream cheese and mayonnaise until blended. Fold in olives and serve on bread.

Heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onion and cook over medium heat until tender. Add bacon. Cook until crisp. Drain fat from bacon and add vinegar. Cook until vinegar evaporates. Stir in pasta. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add shallots and saute until translucent. Add thyme leaves. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Place chicken in skillet and saute for 4 minutes. Add broth to pan. Add apple cut side down. Cover skillet. Simmer for 10 minutes or until chicken is done. Add apple cider. Simmer for another 3 minutes. Stir in thyme. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over hot rice.
I like this kind of food very much.

Preheat oven to 450. Wash each roasting chickens inside and out. Pat dry. Place each in an ovenproof pan or casserole dish with sides high enough to hold about 1/2 inch of liquid. Divide the fat-free italian dressing among the pans. Pour the citrus ponzu soy sauce over each. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon olive oil over each. Sprinkle each with 1/4 teaspoon each of fresh rosemary leaves. Place the pans on a rimmed cookie sheet. Cook at 450 for 35 minutes. Check for doneness by inserting an instant-read thermometer into the thickest part of the thigh. When the temperature reaches 165 degrees, remove each roast from oven. Turn over each roastbaste with the pan juices. Return to oven for 20 minutes to brown. While the roast is in the oven, prepare the potatoes. Peel potatoes. Cut them in half lengthwise. Place them cut side down on a cookie sheet. Bake for 2

Peel the scallops and cut them into halves. Sprinkle the scallops with pepper and chili flakes. Thread the scallops onto skewers alternating with onion. Pour the beer into a small bowl and add the remaining ingredients. Brush the scallops and onion with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Thread the scallops onto skewers and brush with the marinade. Grill the scallops for 2 minutes on each side or until firm to the touch.

Mix the first three ingredients in a large bowl and let set in fridge. Slice bananas and coat with lemon juice to prevent browning. Layer bowl starting with graham cracker crumbs and bananas and pudding mixture. Layer 3 times. Garnish with crumbs remaining from the nilla wafers. Refrigerate for several hours before serving.
This is an easy and delicious dessert.
This is an easy and delicious dessert. It's a great way to use up those over-ripe bananas.

Combine all dry ingredients together in a bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture and pour in oil and water. Mix together until all the ingredients are moistened and the dough is sticky. Knead for 2 minutes. Place in a greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap or a dish towel and let stand for 20 minutes. Divide the dough in half and roll each half out to an 8-inch circle with a floured rolling pin. Heat a lightly oiled skillet over medium-high heat and cook each tortilla for about 1 minute per side. Serve warm with any topping you desire.

In a mixing bowl cream together the butter, vanilla, and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well mixed. Stir in the flour, baking soda and salt until combined. Stir in the dried strawberries until well mixed. Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are slightly browned. Remove from oven and cool for 1 minute on the baking sheet then remove to a wire rack to cool completely. Melt the chocolate according to package directions then dip cooled cookies into the melted chocolate using a fork or spoon. Dip the top first then the bottom so the cookie is completely coated with chocolate. Allow to harden at room temperature or place in the refrigerator to speed up the hardening process. Store in an airtight container in a cool place.

Brown smoked sausage in a skillet. Remove meat. Add vegetables and saute for 3-4 minutes. Add water and bouillon cubes. Bring to boil. Add pasta and simmer until tender. Stir in beans and meat. Heat through. Serve with grated parmesan cheese.
The health benefits of dried beans is well-known to most of us. However, dried beans are not so well-known as the health food that they are. If you are like me, you probably eat beans all the time. But it’s the dried beans that are the best source of protein.

Heat olive oil in large sauté pan. Add onions & bell peppers. Cook until tender. Add bananas. Cook until soft. Add pineapple juice, oranges & lime juices. Cook 1 minute. Add cilantro & habanero peppers. Serve over cooked pasta. Serves 4.

Boil water. Add cauliflower. Cover and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Add peas and cook 1 minute. Drain and cool slightly. Combine yogurt, garlic, turmeric, cumin and pepper in a small bowl. Stir in cauliflower mixture. Garnish with chives if desired. Serve with baked chicken, pork chops or roast turkey. Makes 6 servings.
Place the coleslaw and cilantro in a large bowladd vinegar, oil, and salttoss well. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Yield: 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a 9x13 pan with butter or pam or line with a cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl mix together the yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar and seasoning salt. Cut in the butter until it is crumbly. Stir in the creamed corn and half and half until well combined. Stir in the egg and mix until smooth. Pour into the prepared pan and smooth out the top. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the bread. Serve warm with butter on top!

Preheat oven to 325 F. Score ham in a diamond pattern and stud with cloves. In a small bowl combine mustard, honey and orange juice to form a smooth paste. Spread paste evenly on ham. Place in shallow roasting pan. Cover tightly with foil and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until a meat thermometer inserted into center registers 160 F. Baste occasionally with pan juices. Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine honey, spicy brown mustard and orange juice in a small bowlstir until smooth. Carefully remove foil from hamdiscard cloves. Baste ham with glazelet stand 5 minutes longer. Cut into 1-inch slices. Yield: 8 servings

In a large skillet or saute pan, heat olive oil over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add mushrooms and saute until cooked down. Add the heavy cream and lemon zest. Toss together. Add the crab. Saute for 3 minutes or until heated through. Add the fresh spinach. Toss until the spinach is wilted. Stir in the fettuccine. Toss together until well combined. Garnish with the Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese. Serve immediately. Serves 2-3.
name: Spinach Salad with Mandarin Oranges and Walnutsingredients: fresh baby spinach, mandarin oranges, walnuts, raspberry vinegar, dried cranberries, honeydew melon balls, honey, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepperpreparation:Wash spinach well. Pat dry. Place in large salad bowl. Slice mandarin oranges. Chop walnuts. Add to salad. Combine raspberry vinegar, honey

Place the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden brown and fragrant, about 4 minutes. Add the rolls and cook until golden brown on all sides and crisp on the outside, about 30 minutes total. Transfer to a baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and herbs. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 12 rolls.

In a sauce pan combine eggs, sugar and flour. Beat with a electric mixer on high speed until smooth. Add jam to saucepan. Continue beating for 3-4 minutes or until mixture begins to thicken. Pour into serving dishes. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg if desired. Serve warm or chilled.

Boil the potatoes for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and put back into the pan. Add butter and mix until the butter is completely blended. Add the milk and salt and pepper. Blend well. Add the cheeses and bread crumbs. Spread into a casserole dish. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Unroll crescent rolls and separate dough into 16 triangles. Press perforations to seal. Sprinkle each triangle with 1/2 teaspoon sugar and 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Roll up each triangle starting from shortest side of triangle, roll to opposite point. Place rolls on ungreased baking sheet. Curve each roll into crescent shape. Beat milk and vanilla in small bowl. Drizzle rolls with milk mixture before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 16 rolls.
Wet the rim of four chilled glasses with lime. Sprinkle with the salt. Combine the tequila, fresh lime juice, triple sec, sugar, and ice in the shaker. Shake well. Pour into the prepared glasses.

In tall glass combine ice cream and liqueur. Top with hot coffee and hot chocolate. Garnish with cherries.
1. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine 1 cup sugar and cornstarch in a saucepan. Stir in water. Place over medium heat. Bring to a boilcook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in Amaretto and lemon juice. Heat just until mixture comes to a boilremove from heat. Stir in almonds and extract. Serve warm or cold.
2. Combine 1 cup sugar and cornstarch in a saucepan. Stir in water. Place over medium heat. Bring to a boilcook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in Amaretto and lemon juice. Heat just until mixture comes to a boilremove from heat. Stir in almonds and extract. Serve warm or cold.
3. Combine 1 cup sugar and cornstarch in a saucepan. Stir in water. Place over medium heat. Bring to a boilcook

Combine all of the above in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the chicken, bring to a boil again. Cover tightly and reduce heat to low again, simmering for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly before removing from saucepan. Remove from saucepan and serve over hot cooked rice.

Spray a non-stick pan with cooking spray. Saute the green onions and red bell peppers for 3-5 minutes. Add the eggs and egg substitute and cook until done. Remove from the heat and add the cheese and mushrooms. Fold in half and serve.
name: chicken breast with cucumber sauceingredients: chicken breasts, cucumber saucepreparation:Marinade chicken in cucumber sauce overnight. Broil on high for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve on toast with lettuce and sour cream. Cucumber Sauce: 2 cucumbers 1/2 cup sour cream 1 tbsp. lemon juice 1/4 tsp. dill weed Salt and pepper to taste Cut cucumbers in half lengthwisescrape seeds from each half with a spoon. Blend sour cream, lemon juice and dill weed until smooth. Add cucumbers and blend until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes 1 1/2 cu

In a bowl using an electric mixer, beat together the peanut butter, butter, crisco shortening, vanilla and salt until very smooth. Add in heavy whipping cream, a little at a time until spreadable. Beat on high until fluffy. Beat in powdered sugar to desired texture. Beat well until fluffy and creamy.

Mix together the cream and flour. Season with salt. Add the butter, then stir in the egg. Spread this mixture over the chicken pieces and roll. Dust with sesame seeds and bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve with basmati rice.

Cut the hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise. Remove the yolks and set the yolks aside. Mash the yolks with the ketchup and mayonnaise and mix well. Stuff the yolk mixture back into the egg whites. Add the ketchup and the pimientos. Garnish with the chopped onion.

Mix together all the ingredients except for the ketchup. Add ketchup after it is done baking and then sprinkle the top with paprika. Bake at 350F for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes and veggies of choice.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl. Toss gently to mix well. Spread the mixture in a single layer in a baking pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake the mixture in a preheated 400f oven for 10 minutesstir the mixture once during baking. Continue baking until the potatoes are tender, about 20-25 more minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

In blender or food processor combine yogurt with parsley, lemon juice and paprika. Blend to puree and refrigerate overnight or 10 to 12 hours. Prepare the beef by cutting into 1/4 to 1/2 inch cubes. Toss cubes with the yogurt mixture and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours or overnight. When ready to cook, heat grill and preheat broiler on high. Grill the steaks to desired doneness and broil 2 to 3 minutes until browned on each side. To serve, spread each steak with mayonnaise and top with sliced tomato and green onion.

Stack cream cheese with tomato & basil on one cracker. Spread garlic & herb spreadable cheese on another cracker. Spread swiss cheese on third cracker. Spread dill dip on fourth cracker. Top off with colby-monterey jack cheese on last cracker. Stack in any order desired.

Combine the walnut pieces, dijon and vinegar in a medium bowl. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Divide the mixture between two salad plates. Place the avocado slices and tomato slices on each plate. Top with the iceberg wedges. Arrange the cheese slices on the wedges. Drizzle the olive oil on top. Serve.

Place ribs in a plastic bag and add meat tenderizer. Let stand for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine remaining ingredients except ribs. Rinse ribs. Place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Pour 1/2 of marinade over ribs. Turn ribs to coat both sides. Pour remaining marinade over ribs. Cover tightly with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 3 hours. Remove foil. Bake an additional 30 minutes. Remove ribs from baking dish. Arrange in a shallow baking dish. Spoon remaining sauce over ribs. Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes more. Serves 4-6.

Slice or dice squash and onions. Mince garlic. Heat olive oil in heavy bottomed pan. Add butter if desired. Add garlic, onions and squash. Cook over medium heat. Add mushrooms. Saute for 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add spinach. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add tomatoes. Cook for another minute or two. Make 2 or 3 holes in your veggie mixture. Crack an egg into each hole. Cover pan. Cook until whites are set. Remove from pan and top with freshly ground pepper. Serve with bacon or sausage.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook rice with 1 1/2 cups water and 1 tsp. taco seasoning for 30 minutes. Spread 1/2 of the cooked rice in a 9x13 pan. Top with 1 1/2 cans of the enchilada sauce. Spread 1 1/2 cups of the cooked beans over the top. Sprinkle 1 cup of the cheese over the top and layer with 1 cup of the Fritos. Repeat with another layer of the cooked rice, enchilada sauce and beans. Top with 1 cup of cheese. Bake for 1 hour. Top with the remaining cheese and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Garnish with the remaining Fritos and the chopped green onions.

Wash green beans and trim ends. Cut into 1 inch lengths. Melt Smart Balance Butter Spread in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and saut until tender. Add shallot and saute until translucent. Add green beans and saute for 1 minute. Add wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook uncovered for 5 minutes or until liquid is evaporated. Season to taste with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
 green bean and potato casseroleingredients: cooked potatoes, frozen green beans, soup mix, milk, butter, sour creampreparation: Cook potatoes and green beans in separate pans. Add soup mix to potatoes and milk. Cook until heated. Add cooked potatoes and green beans. Mix well. Add butter and sour cream. Mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Rub spices into meat. Place in slow cooker. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over meat. Cook 4 to 6 hours on low. Slice and serve.

In a saute pan, heat butter and add onions. Stir until golden. Stir in brown sugar and balsamic vinegar and cook until bubbly. Remove from heat and cool. Spread onion mixture over the pizza crust. Top with garlic, blue cheese and sun-dried tomatoes. Bake as directed.

Bring broth and water to a boil. Stir in orzocook for about 8 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakescook for about 30 seconds. Add chickencook until done about 7 minutes. Stir in cooked orzo and cook for about 30 seconds. Stir in spinach and cook for about a minute. Add parmesan cheesestir until melted. Serve sprinkled with fresh parsley.

Combine granulated sugar, orange juice concentrate, and jam in a small saucepan over medium-low heatstir until smooth. Cook until thickened but not boiling, about 10 minutes. Remove from heatstir in brandy and triple seccool to room temperature. Divide mixture evenly among 6 to 8 dessert cupschill at least 1 hour or up to 2 days. To serve, arrange a fresh peach slice on each serving and spoon sauce over.

In a large bowl combine the potatoes, celery, red onion, hard cooked eggs, sweet pickles (drained), sweet pickle juice (1/4 cup) and mayonnaise (1 1/2 cups). Fold in mustard (1 teaspoon) and season with salt and ground black pepper. Cover and refrigerate overnight to blend flavors. Serve room temperature or chilled. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare lemon cake mix as directed on box. Prepare the lemon pudding according to the instructions on the box. Pour prepared cake batter into greased and floured 10 inch tube pan. Pour prepared pudding over batter. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool 20 minutes. Top with powdered sugar and drizzle with lemon juice.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine cheese, nuts, and oil in a bowl. Slice the potatoes about 1 1/2 inches thick, and lay them in a single layer in a baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes, or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife. Remove from oven. Transfer the potatoes to a serving platter, and top with the cheese-nut mixture. Sprinkle with arugula, and serve immediately.

Combine all of the sauce ingredients together in a small bowl. Mix thoroughly. Serve in small dipping bowls. Slice the fresh ahi tuna into 1/4-inch thick slices. Heat a heavy-bottomed skillet over high heat until very hot. Brush the tuna with sesame oil and sear for 30 seconds on each side until cooked but not quite done to your liking. Serve with the dipping sauce and garnish with pickled ginger, red pepper flakes and green onion.

Fry the bacon until brown. Add the garlic and fry for a minute more. Add the chili flakes. Pour in the white wine, stirring constantly. Cook until the wine has evaporated. Add the tomato puree, water, parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the pasta in boiling water. Drain and add to the sauce. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the ricotta cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chickensaut until browned on both sides. Remove from heat. Add stuffing mix to the skilletstir to combine. Add the chicken brothstir until well blended. Transfer the mixture to a 2 quart casserole dish. Pour the condensed cream of chicken soup evenly over the mixture. Arrange the mixed vegetables over the mixture. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the vegetables. Bake, uncovered for 40 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center. Serve warm.

In large bowl mix together butter, sugar, egg yolks and flour until blended. Add baking powder and mix well. Spread in a 13x9x2-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into nut mixture and spread into 13x9x2-inch pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Cut into bars. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.
i would love to have the recipes for the pistachio macadamia cookies with chocolate drizzle on top from the pampered chef party that i attended on 3/28/15 in plymouth minnesota.

Combine breadcrumbs with oregano, salt and pepper in a shallow dish. Beat eggs in another shallow dish. Dip chicken in egg. Coat with breadcrumbs. In a 12-in. Skillet, heat 1 Tbsp. Olive oil over medium heat. Add half the chicken to pan. Brown the chicken for 3 minutes per side. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining chicken. In the same skillet, saute bell peppers and onion in 2 Tbsp. Olive oil until tender. Stir in green chili peppers. Spoon vegetable mixture into each breast. Top with provolone cheese. Return to pan. Bake in 350 degree F oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve with salsa or hot cooked rice.

Peel eggplants and slice them lengthwise into ¼” slices. Put in colander to drain liquid for 20 minutes. Heat ½ cup of oil in large frying pan until hot but not smoking. Working in batches of 4 or 5 eggplant slices, add to hot oil, flat side down and cook until golden brown about 1 minute. Turn over and cook for another minute or until golden brown on other side. Drain on paper towels and reserve. In large bowl combine remaining ½ cup of oil, garlic clove, cumin, lemon juice, and ½ teaspoon of salt and black pepper to taste. In food processor combine eggplant, egg yolk, and lemon juice mixture. Process until smooth but not too fine. Place in a serving bowl and sprinkle with coriander leaves to serve.

Butter both sides of the slices of bread. Spread a layer of butter on the bottom slice of bread. Layer the remaining butter, a slice of american cheese, two slices of bacon and a tomato slice. Cover with the top slice of bread buttered side up. Grill on medium heat until the top slice of bread is golden brown. Serves two.

In a saucepan combine the olive oil, garlic and crushed red pepper. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste. Stir. Add the parsley. Cook 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Stir. Add the basil, oregano, sugar, salt and pepper. Add the beans. Cook 10 minutes. Cook the pasta. Drain. Add to the sauce.

Grind lemongrass and garlic with spring onions and lime juice. Add coriander leaves and mix well. Divide into four equal portions. Form each portion of mixture in to a ball and wrap each ball in plastic film. Bake in the oven at 180c for about 20 minutes or until done.

Combine shallot and sherry vinegar in a small bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes. Whisk in oil. Add salt, pepper, and herbs. In a large bowl, combine all remaining ingredients. Drizzle dressing over the top.

Boil russet potatoes in water until tender. Strain and mash with potato masher. In large pot, saute onions in butter. Add mashed potatoes. Add bay leaf and half-and-half. Bring to boil and simmer for 15 minutes. Add smoked sausage and cook 5 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Tear the kale into pieces and place them in a large bowl. Add the apple cider vinegar, salt and olive oil, and mix thoroughly. Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet, and place in a 350 degrees F oven. After about ten minutes, turn over the pieces with a spatula. Continue baking until the chips are crispy.
name: balsamic roasted vegetablesingredients: butter, onion, carrots, celery, zucchini, red bell pepper, balsamic vinegar, garlic cloves, thyme, olive oil, salt & pepperpreparation:Heat the butter in a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, celery, zucchini, bell pepper, garlic, thyme, vinegar, and cook until vegetables are softened, about 8 to 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. If making ahead, cool, then store in airtight container. Just before serving, reheat vegetable mixture, drizzle

Combine flour and cumin. Cut up a stick of butter into cubes. Toss with flour. Add a bit of water to make a paste. Add to flour and mix well. Add cheese and mix well. Place a little mound of dough on a wax paper lined baking sheet. Roll into a ball and flatten with your hand. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes. The dough will become crisp and will be golden brown. Serve with soups or salads.
Mash together avocadoes and remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a small skillet over medium heat, toast the whole cumin seeds until they start to pop (2 to 3 minutes). Add the mustard seeds and toast until they start to pop (about 30 seconds). Place the seeds into a mortar and pestle and crush. Set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the seeds and cook until fragrant (1 to 2 minutes). Add the sugar snap peas and cook until crisp-tender (3 to 4 minutes). Season with salt to taste. Remove from the heat and stir in the thyme, cayenne, lemon juice and ground black pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cut the white fish fillets into 2" chunks. Heat the oil and fry the fish for 2 minutes. Add the onions and fry for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for 1 minute. Add the lemon rind and fry for 30 seconds. Add the tamarind paste and the soy sauce and fry for 3 minutes. Serve with rice.

Cook rice. Melt velveeta. Stir cream of mushroom soup into the velveeta. Add rice to the mushroom velveeta. Add broccoli. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Put into casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1/2 hour. Serves 4.

soak the dry lentils in water for at least 12 hours. Drain the liquid. Rinse the lentils well. In a large pan, heat the oil and saut the shallots and garlic until fragrant. Add the lentils and saute until browned. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and cook until the liquid is absorbed. Add the white wine vinegar. Season to taste with thyme and feta cheese.

Preheat oven to 350F. Melt chips with butter in a double boiler or microwave. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and coffee. Add eggs and vanilla, stir until smooth. Add flour and baking soda, mix well. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until the center is set. Cool completely before cutting into squares.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add the bow tie pasta and cook according to the box directions. Meanwhile, prepare the veggies for the scampi. Cut the green bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and white pith. Cut into thin strips. Remove the stems from the asparagus. Cut the artichokes in half lengthwise and remove the leaves. Slice the shallots very thinly. Melt the butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and shallotssaute until translucent, about 2-3 minutes. Add the red bell pepperssaute until soft, about 4 minutes. Stir in the white wine. Add the artichokes, green bell peppers, asparagus, and asparagus watersaute until tender, 3-4 minutes. Stir in the asparagus water and season with the salt and peppercook until the liquid evaporates. Stir in the olive oil. Toss the cooked bow tie pasta with the veggie scampi mixture and serve immediately.

Mix cake mix according to package directions. Pour into a 9 inch spring form pan and bake for 25-35 minutes. While cake is baking melt the butter and condensed milk in a double boiler. Once cake is done remove from oven and poke holes in the top with a skewer or knife. Pour the melted milk mixture over the top and spread. Top with chopped candy bars. Chill for several hours. Slice and serve.

In a shallow bowl combine the first six ingredients. Place the flank steaks in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Grill to desired doneness.
Steaks are so easy to make and are perfect for any occasion. You can make them for your family or if you are trying to impress someone. They are a great main course to have at a party and are very quick to cook. If you are looking for something to cook that does not take much time then you need to give steaks a try.
If you are looking for the best way to make a great meal then you need to learn how to make the perfect steaks. There are many different ways to cook a steak and there are many different ways to marinate your steaks. There are many different recipes out there that will help you to find the perfect way to make the perfect steak.
Steaks are a great main course to have at a party. They are also a great meal to make for your family. There are so many different ways to make them that you will not get bored with them. You can make them for any occasion and you can make them for any type of party. If you

Cut the tuna steaks into 4 equal pieces. Combine the soy sauce, honey and ginger and mix well. Marinate the tuna steaks for 10 minutes. Heat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with foil and brush with vegetable oil. Place the tuna on the baking sheet and broil for 2-3 minutes on each side. Serve with rice.

To make the dressing, combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and mix well. Set aside. In a medium-sized bowl, combine the chicken with the dressing and toss well. Divide the chicken mixture evenly between 4 serving bowls. Garnish each portion with a sprig of cilantro. To make the wraps, place a wonton wrapper on a cutting board. Spoon a little bit of the chicken mixture into the middle of the wrapper. Fold the sides together and roll up. Serve immediately.

Cut each breast in half. In a shallow bowl, mix the oil, garlic and chili powder. Add the breasts and turn to coat. Grill over medium heat until no longer pink in the center. Turn once. Remove from heat and brush with the tequila. Add the lime juice and sprinkle the salt and pepper over.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, and saltset aside. In a large bowl combine soymilk, flax seed, and vanilla extractmix well. Gradually add the soymilk mixture to the dry ingredients, beating at low speed until just moistened. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes. Lightly grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto cookie sheetsflatten with a fork dipped in water. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until light golden brown around the edges. Remove from ovencool on wire racks. Makes 18 to 24 cookies.

Combine dressing, black beans, cumin, fresh corn kernels in large bowl. Gently stir in mozzarella cheese. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. In the meantime, wash cherry tomatoes and avocado. Cut cherry tomatoes in half. Slice avocado. Cut red onions in half. Add all of the toppings to the bowl. Stir gently.

Chop the shallots finely. Place in a bowl with the champagne vinegar. Season with the salt and pepper. Whisk the olive oil into the dressing. Place the corn in the bowl and toss well. Add the tomatoes and arugula. Toss to coat the greens.
Peel and dice the eggplants. Place in a bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve cold.

Combine the milk and dried lavender in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the chocolate and cook until melted and smooth. Stir in the cocoa powder and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the salt and vanilla. Stir in the whipping cream and serve immediately.

Soak croissants in heavy cream and milk. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and mix in sugar, cinnamon and orange zest. Dip each croissant into the egg mixture and then into the almonds. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes or until they are lightly golden brown. In the meantime, put the Grand Marnier and cherries in a small sauce pan and heat. Drizzle over the top of the French toast. Serve immediately.
Beat eggs well with oil, sugar, twix crushed up. Add bananas. Mix in flour with baking powder and salt. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes.

In a large saucepan, bring 1 quart of water to a boil. Add the salt and orzo and cook until the orzo is tender and has absorbed almost all of the cooking liquid, 8 to 9 minutes. Stir in the butter, parmesan cheese and lemon zest. Stir in the lemon juice and parsley. Serve immediately. Watch carefully because nuts will burn quickly.

Mix together all the dry ingredients. Cut butter into small pieces. Cook hot dog in pan with butter and dry ingredients. Add tomato soup to pan. Cook about 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cook 10-15 minutes. Serve on toasty bun.

Cream butter and sugar well with currants. Add the rest of the ingredients and knead into a dough. Roll into small balls and put on greased trays. Flatten with a fork or knife. Bake for about 20 minutes at 160 C/325 F/Gas 3 until golden brown. Let cool on the trays for a few minutes before putting on wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 325°F. In a mixing bowl, mix the cornstarch and salt until well blended. Add the coconut and mix well. Stir the egg and margarine into the mixture and mix well. Shape the mixture into 1 1/2-inch balls and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes, then remove to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 3 dozen.
I love the idea of all these recipes, but they look soooo nasty! They look like poo!
i made the chocolate and vanilla pudding cookies last night and they are good! the chocolate ones are more like a brownie...i can see why people wouldnt like them...but i liked them...they were good...and i made the vanilla ones and they were very good...i can see why they were everyone's favorite!
I tried the cow patty ones and they are awesome. I actually think they're better than the no bake recipe I was looking for.

Cream butter until light. Add sugar gradually. Beat until creamy. Add 3 eggs. Beat until fluffy. Sift flour and baking powder 3 times. Blend into creamed mixture. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour in 2 loaf pans or 1 9x13 pan or one round 9 inch pan or one 8 inch square pan. Bake 40-45 minutes depending on size of pan. Cool 10 minutes in pan then turn out on rack. Frost with your favorite frosting or use icing.

In a 2 qt. microwaveable bowl combine cornstarch, salt and the sugar. Stir in half-and-half and egg yolks until smooth. Cook 10 minutes on high or until thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Remove from microwave and stir in butter and lemon rind. Stir in fresh lemon juice and yellow food coloring until well combined. Spread into baked graham cracker crust and chill. Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in the sugar and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. Spread over filling and chill until serving time. To serve, remove pie from fridge and pour melted butter over the top of the pie crust. Place pie in preheated 350f oven and bake for 3-5 minutes until brown on the edges. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute until soft. Add asparagus and prosciutto. Cook until the prosciutto is crisp and the asparagus is tender. Stir in cream and heat through. Add pasta and toss gently. Sprinkle with parsley.

Toast bread. Spread with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with garlic. Sprinkle with parmesan and pine nuts. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Broil until browned.
Sounds like the food is too good to be true. Can't wait to try it.
I can't wait to try some of these recipes. I have been looking for some low calorie and low carb recipes.
I like the idea of these recipes, but I am wondering if you could provide some more information about the recipes. I know this is a food blog and not a cookbook but maybe you could include the number of calories and amount of fat and protein. Just a suggestion! Thanks!
Thank you for these recipes! I have been looking for some easy recipes to make at home.
I'm not a fan of the whole low calorie and low carb craze that is sweeping the nation. But these recipes do look good. I'll be trying the garlic bread one out this weekend.
I'm not really sure how to cook. I've always been more of an eater than a cook. But

Fry bacon in a skillet until crisp and remove from pan with slotted spoon and drain fat. Cook onion in the fat until tender, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes. Add potatoes and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes or until potatoes are just tender. Pour in cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in butter and spring onion. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 2 quart casserole. Combine soup, milk, and onion in a large bowl. Stir in sausage. Spread a layer of sauerkraut in bottom of casserole. Spread sausage mixture over sauerkraut. Top with noodles. Spread half of remaining mixture over noodles. Sprinkle with half of the bread crumbs. Repeat layers. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes.

In a medium bowl cream together the softened butter and the sugar until light and fluffy. Add the 4 egg yolks one at a time. Beat after each addition. Add the flavoring of your choice and beat again. Add the flour and the milk alternately until well blended. Beat well. Beat the egg whites until stiff. Fold into the batter. Pour into a greased Bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Makes one 10 cup Bundt pan.

Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add sweet onion and saut for 5-8 minutes or until soft and translucent. Add garlic and saut until golden brown. Add diced potatoes and saute for 2 minutes. Add the chopped cabbage and saute until almost soft. Add the diced ham and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the white wine and bring to boil over high heat for 10 minutes or until the wine is almost completely evaporated. Remove from heat and add the chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a 9x13 casserole dish and bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until potatoes are soft.

Heat oil in skillet. Brown pork chop on each side for 2-3 minutes. Add soups to skillet and cook until heated through. Place 1 slice of cheese on top of each chop. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Place in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Serve on top of rice or noodles.

Soak berries overnight in water. Add sugar and cook in saucepan over medium heat until thick and clear. Remove from heat and add pecans. Stir in bananas, fruit cocktail and whipping cream. Stir in vanilla and pour into serving dish. Chill before serving.

Heat oven to 375f degrees. In a large bowl, mix butter (or margarine), sugars, and vanilla until light and creamy. Add the Grand Marnier (or orange extract) and the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the butter mixture just until blended. Fold in the oats, then the chocolate chips. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown on the edges. Let cool on a wire rack.
Soak the bread in milk for 1 hour. Add the remaining ingredients, mix well. Form into balls, roll in flour. Brown in olive oil. Simmer in wine and/or spaghetti sauce.
Combine caramel topping and hot fudge topping and heat until melted. Fold in ice cream and spoon into pie shell. Chill until firm. Garnish with topping and pecans.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Saute the onion in the melted butter for about 10 minutes, until it is golden brown. Add paprika to the onions and saute for a few minutes. Peel and cube the potatoes and add to the saucepan with the paprika-onions. Cover the saucepan with water, cover the saucepan and cook over medium heat until the potatoes are tender (about 30 minutes). Remove from heat and add the green peppers, tomato, and a little salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a large pot, melt the butter over low heat. Add the leeks and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until they are soft. Add the frozen peas and cook for 2 minutes or until they are heated through. Add the spinach and cook for 2 minutes or until wilted. Stir in the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until the spinach is tender. Remove from the heat and stir in the savory. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Ladle into bowls and serve with the yogurt.

Place the strawberries in the pie shell. In a saucepan, combine the cornstarch, sugar and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture thickens and boils. Remove from the heat and stir in the food coloring. Pour the glaze over the fruit. Refrigerate until the glaze is firm. Spread the whipped cream over the top before serving.

Put water and 2 of the orange rinds in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add chocolate and salt and stir until melted. Remove from heat. In a separate bowl, whisk eggs. Add remaining orange rind and orange juice. Beat until smooth. Stir egg mixture into chocolate mixture and mix well. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes. Whisk egg whites in a clean bowl until soft peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate until serving. Top with chocolate curls and orange rind twists.
In a food processor puree the peas and the ricotta. Add the lemon juice, mint and spinach. Chill. Serve in sandwiches.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepan. Add honey and sugar and stir to melt. Add nuts and stir. Pour into a lined 8×8 baking dish and press down with a wet spatula or the bottom of a glass to flatten. Bake for about 20 minutes. Cool completely and cut into squares.

In a large saucepan, saute the onion in the oil. Add the dried thyme. Stir the mixture and cover. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add the red bell peppers. Season the mixture with the salt and black pepper. Add the broth to the mixture. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the couscous. Simmer the mixture for about 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Serve the mixture.

Slice baguette lengthwise. Spread one side with cream cheese. Layer on tomato, cheeses, pesto sauce and vegetables. Roll tightly, starting from the open end. Wrap in aluminum foil. Bake at 350 for 45 mins. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a small bowl combine 3 tablespoons hot sauce with 2 tablespoons butter. Stir well. Place 2 tablespoons of the hot sauce mixture in each pepper half and microwave for 20 seconds. Remove the pepper halves from the microwave and set aside. In another bowl combine remaining hot sauce with remaining butter. Cut each chicken breast into 8 strips. Place each strip of chicken in the bowl with butter and hot sauce and coat well with sauce. Arrange the chicken in the pepper halves, sprinkle with blue cheese and monterey jack cheese, and bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Serve with celery ribs and ranch dressing.

Cook artichoke hearts according to package directions until tender. Drain artichoke hearts in a colander over a bowl, reserving the cooking liquid. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in the garlic salt. Add the dill pickle relish and artichoke hearts. Stir well. Stir in the reserved cooking liquid. Stir in the mayonnaise. Increase heat to medium-high heat. Cook until bubbly and hot. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly. Spoon 1/3 cup of the artichoke mixture onto each muffin half. Sprinkle each muffin half with 1 1/2 teaspoons cheese. Bake muffins at 400 degrees until the cheese is melted. Serve the muffins immediately or let cool completely before storing.

Boil or steam the green beans until tender. Put beans in a large bowl. Cut up bacon. Drain off all fat and add bacon to the beans. Add mayo, vinegar and sugar. Mix together until coated. Add chopped onion.
Heat oil in skillet and saute bell peppers and onions. Add garlic and cayenne and saute until tender. Add shrimp and saute 1 minute. Add pasta and heat through. Serve immediately.

Cook the tortellini according to the package directions. After draining the pasta, place it back into the pot. Pour in the alfredo sauce to coat the pasta. Stir in the italian-style tomatoes with the chicken until the chicken is heated through. Serve hot.

In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of the canola oil. Add the chicken and cook over moderately high heat until browned and no longer pink in the center, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer the chicken to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of canola oil to the skillet. Add the rice and cook over moderately high heat until golden brown and crisp, about 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a bowl. In a small bowl, combine the broth and 1/4 cup of water and stir in the cornstarch until dissolved. Add the marmalade and stir until smooth. Add the broth mixture and the apricots to the skillet and bring to a boil. Cook over moderate heat until the rice is tender and the sauce is thickened and glossy. Return the chicken and the rice to the skillet and stir in the five-spice powder and the soy sauce. Stir until the rice is well coated. Serve with lime wedges.

Boil the pasta per the package instructions until al dente. In the meantime dice the tomatoes. Drain the pasta in a colander and rinse under cool water until the pasta is cold. Toss the pasta with the tomatoes, the feta, the green onions, the balsamic vinegar, the extra virgin olive oil and the seasonings until well mixed. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with bread sticks or crackers.

Cut chops into 1 inch pieces and trim off excess fat. Sprinkle both sides with salt, pepper and cayenne to taste. Heat oil in large skillet over med-high heat until hot. Add pork chops in single layer. Cook until browned, turning once. Drizzle with lime juice. Add sliced onions, cook for 2 to 3 minutes longer. Serve over rice or noodles.

Purée broccoli and cauliflower in food processor. Heat oil over medium heat in large skillet. Add garlic, onion, stock, potatoes, and marjoram. Cook until potatoes are tender, 15-20 minutes. Add purée and celery. Season to taste with salt. Transfer to a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Add milk. Season to taste with salt. Garnish with parsley.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl beat together butter, unsweetened chocolate squares and sugars until well mixed. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Add flour and salt and mix until blended. Stir in walnuts if desired. Spread in a greased 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven or until the edges are set and the centre is still very soft. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares to serve.

Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water by 1 inch. Add the kosher salt (this will make the water salty and help the potatoes cook quickly). Bring to boilingreduce heat, cover and simmer until the potatoes are very tender when pierced with the tip of a paring knife (about 20 minutes). Drain the potatoescool them under cold running water for about 5 minutes. Cut the potatoes in half or quarters (depending on the size) lengthwisethen slice them crosswise. Place the potatoes in a large bowladd the mayonnaise and toss gently to coat well. Add the dill relish and stir gently to combine. Add the eggstir gently to combine. Add the celery ribstoss gently to combine. Add the prepared mustardtoss gently to combine. Add the fresh ground black pepper and toss gently to combine. Refrigerate the potato salad for at least 1 hour or up to 1 day before serving.

Sift together soy flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking soda, vanilla and salt. Add 1 egg and oil to soy mixture. Beat well. Fold in sour cream and splenda. Pour into greased and floured 9 inch round pan. Bake 30-35 minutes at 350. Cool. Spread with strawberry filling. Decorate as desired.

Cook the millet in the vegetable stock with the lemon juice for about 25 minutes, adding more water if necessary. Cook the baby spinach leaves in the boiling water for about 5 minutes, drain, rinse with cold water and add to the millet mixture. Season with the salt & pepper. Serve warm topped with the pine nuts & dried apricots.

Preheat oven to 375. Combine egg, milk in large bowl. Dip chicken into egg mixture, then coat with bread crumb mixture. Place on baking sheet. Bake uncovered 20 minutes. Top with remaining bread crumbs. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until done. Serve with sauce or parmesan cheese.

Combine dressing ingredients. Stir together coleslaw mix & apples. Add blue cheese & walnuts. Toss. Chill.
name: broccoli slaw salad with apple brocco slawingredients: broccoli, granny smith apple, mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, pepperpreparation:Place brocco slaw and apple in a bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, vinegar, honey and salt and pepper. Pour over brocco slaw and apple. Mix well, with your hands. Serve.
name: crunchy sweet and sour saladingredients: walnuts, ramen noodles, unsalted butter, broccoli, romaine lettuce, green onion, vegetable oil, sugar, red wine vinegar, soy saucepreparation:Melt butter in skillet and brown walnuts & ramen noodles. Cool on paper towels. Combine browned noodles and walnuts with broccoli, lettuce, and onions in large serving

Combine berries in a bowl. Mix maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon in a bowl until smooth. Pour over berries and stir until coated. Pour into 1 quart or 2 quart casserole dish and cover with plastic wrap. Place in refrigerator to chill for about 4 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator, stir, add nuts and dates. Place back in fridge for about 1/2 hour before serving. Serve chilled.

Prepare Cinnamon Ice Cream recipe. In a 2-quart baking dish, combine 2 1/2 cups of the peaches, the sugar, flour, salt and egg. Stir with a fork until well blended. Sprinkle with the butter. Spread the remaining 2 1/2 cups peaches on top. Bake at 400 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with Cinnamon Ice Cream. Makes 6-8 servings.

Place meat and onion in slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on low heat for 6-7 hours or until meat is tender. Serve with tortillas or taco shells, shredded lettuce, grated cheese, and sour cream.

Cook rice according to package directions. Add chicken broth, chicken, ham and soup. Cook until heated through. In a small bowl mix evaporated milk, cheese and pepper. Pour over rice mixture. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Garnish with parmesan cheese.
In a skillet, saute kielbasa in butter until browned. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 20 minutes. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Serve over rice.

Combine the first five ingredients and milk and cook until thick. Add the butter and cinnamon and cook until butter is melted. Pour into a prepared pie crust and bake at 350f degrees for 50-55 minutes. Cool and serve.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden brown. Add the passata and cook for about 20 minutes. Add the anchovy fillets and cook for another few minutes. Add the black olives, capers and black pepper and cook for a further 20 minutes. Serve over pasta.

Cream together sugar and butter. Mix in flour and vanilla. Chill dough for about an hour. Roll dough into small balls. Roll balls in nuts or sprinkles. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until light brown.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add green beans and return to a boil. Cook until crisp tender. Drain. In a small bowl, combine shallot, garlic clove, parsley, red wine vinegar, olive oil, mustard, and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Mix well. Add to green beans. Toss well. Garnish with parsley. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add frozen corn and cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Drain and return to pot. Add vinegar and basil. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain and add oil and garlic. Let stand 10 minutes. Add onion and cherry tomatoes. Toss and serve.

Cut up fish into small chunks. Melt butter in large skillet, add onion and fish. Cook over low heat for approximately five minutes, stirring frequently until fish is opaque. Remove from heat. Blend with lemon juice and eggs until well mixed. Place into a buttered baking dish. Beat matzo meal with parsley until well mixed and pour over fish mixture. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for approximately 40 minutes or until top is golden brown. Serve with sour cream or your favorite salad dressing.

What is the best way to bake fish?

In a large heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook, stirring constantly, until they turn pink and are just done through. Remove from the heat and stir in the whipping cream. Add the garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the madeira. Bring the sauce to a boil. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately over rice or pasta. Makes 4 servings.
We have no reviews for this recipe yet.
Be the first to share your experiences with others!

Grease and line a 2lb loaf tin. Put the butter and sugar in a pan and heat until melted and amber in colour. Add the eggs and beat for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the muscovado sugar. Cool for 5 minutes. Add the bananas and pecans and mix well. Add the raisins and the buttermilk and mix well. Sieve the plain flour and the bicarbonate of soda into a bowl. Add to the mixture and mix well. Spoon into the tin and smooth the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 10 minutes until well risen and a skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean. Leave to cool in the tin for a couple of minutes before turning out onto a cooling rack. Mix the icing sugar and the water together and drizzle over the cooled cake. Leave until the icing has set before cutting.

Beat eggs with electric mixer until thick and white. Stir in condensed milk and beat until smooth. Add lemon juice, cream of tartar and sugar and beat until smooth and fluffy. Pour into prepared pie crust. Bake in 350 degree F oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before topping with the meringue. Beat egg whites with electric mixer until foamy. Add 1 tbsp of sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Add remaining sugar 1 tbsp at a time and continue beating until thick and shiny. Spread over pie and return to oven for another 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool before serving.
Name: Pink Lemonade Meringue PieIngredients: Unflavored Gelatin, Frozen Pink Lemonade Concentrate, Evaporated Milk, Pie Shell, Cold Water, Sugar, Red Food ColoringPreparation:Bake Pie Shell First, Then Cool. In A Small Saucepan, Soften Gelatin In Cold Water. Add Lemonade Concentrate To

Boil water and rhubarb until tender, about 10-15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add sugar, stir and bring to a boil again. Add pie filling, stir, boil 10 minutes. Turn off the heat. Stir in jello. Put in hot jars & seal.
In a large skillet saute chicken in a small amount of oil until no longer pink. Add dressing, vinegar, mustard, and cooked pasta. Season to taste. Add broccoli just before serving. Serve immediately.

In a medium skillet, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the onions and cook until soft and golden, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the flour, salt and pepper in a small bowl. In a large saucepan, combine the stock and the flour mixture and stir until smooth. Bring to a simmer. Turn heat to medium-low. In a small bowl, whisk together the heavy cream and the cornstarch until smooth. Add to the pan and stir until thickened. Taste for seasoning. Add more salt or pepper if necessary.

In a 3-quart saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the sugar, corn syrup, and milk. Bring to a boil and cook to 240f stirring frequently. Remove from heat and add chocolate, salt, and vanilla, stirring until melted. Let cool to 110f and stir until mixture loses its gloss. Add 2 tablespoons of the icing to 1 cup of powdered sugar and beat until smooth.

Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium high heat. Add the brisket and brown well on both sides. Cover the pan and cook for 15 minutes. Remove the cover and cook for another 15 minutes. Remove from the heat. Preheat the broiler. Cut the brisket into thin slices. Spread each slice of bread with the dressing. Lay the brisket slices onto the bottom slices. Sprinkle the sauerkraut over the brisket. Top with the cheese slices. Broil until the cheese is melted.

Microwave the condensed milk and butter on high for 1 minute, stirring after every 15 seconds. Microwave on high for another minute and then stir every 10 seconds until mixture becomes thick. Stir in the sugar and the vanilla essence.

In a large mixing bowl combine yeast, 2 cups of water, the all-purpose flour, and the baking sodastir well with a wooden spoon to form a soft dough. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of waterstir until dough comes away from the sides of the bowl. Add the baking powder, 2 teaspoons of the sugar, and the saltstir until well blended. Add the shorteningstir until shortening is distributed throughout the dough. Add the buttermilkstir until dough is smooth and elastic, about 30 minutes. Turn dough out onto a lightly greased surfaceknead until smooth and elastic, 5 to 10 minutes. Lightly grease a large mixing bowlplace dough in the bowl, turning the dough to grease the top of the dough with shortening. Cover the dough with a damp clothlet dough rise until doubled in bulk, about 30 minutes. Punch down doughknead lightly 2 or 3 times. Divide dough into 12 equal portionsroll

Lightly coat a large skillet with olive oil. Cook the chicken over medium heat until no longer pink. Sprinkle with italian seasoning and season with salt and black pepper. Add the broth and simmer until the sauce thickens. Add the red wine vinegar and the roasted red peppers. Cook for 1 minute. Divide the sauce between two plates. Top each serving with the parmesan cheese and parsley sprig. Serves 2.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, saut bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and set aside. Add celery and onion to pan and saut until tender. Add water, rice and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Simmer until rice is tender (about 25 minutes). Stir in bacon. Add parsley and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Combine the first four ingredients in a saucepan over low heat until melted and smooth. Cool to room temperature. Whisk together the next four ingredients until smooth. Whisk the cooled chocolate mixture into the egg mixture. Pour into the prepared pie pan. Bake for 50 minutes or until center is set. Cool to room temperature. Garnish with the pecans just before serving.
Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate. Serve over crisp lettuce and croutons.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with the cooking spray. Spread half of the cheese on one tortilla. Top with the remaining tortilla. Spray the top of the tortilla with the cooking spray. Bake until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is golden brown. Repeat with remaining 2 tortillas. Cut the quesadillas into wedges. Serve with sour cream and salsa.
