Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the brownie mix, eggs, oil and water until well mixed. Spread in a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and spread frosting on top. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and chopped pecans. Bake for another 15 minutes or until done. Cool completely before cutting into 24 squares.

Mix together cheese and heavy cream until smooth. Place in saucepan. Stir in butter until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Saute chicken in butter until browned. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Stir in cheese mixture and cook until heated through. Serves 4.

Pop the corn kernels. In a large saucepan or electric skillet melt the butter on low. Stir in the water, sugar and corn syrup and cook on medium heat until mixture reaches 250 degrees on a candy thermometer. Stir in the marshmallows until melted and smooth. Pour the mixture over the popcorn in a large bowl. Stir until the mixture is completely coated with the corn syrup mixture. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours or until completely cooled. Butter hands and roll mixture into 1-inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar and place on wax paper. Store in airtight containers.
Combine all ingredients except meat in a small bowl. Pour into a ziplock bag. Add meat, close bag. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Cook as desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat 1 egg in a small bowl. Place one bagel on each of four 6-inch round baking dishes. Top each bagel with 1 tablespoon Laughing Cow Cheese and 1 teaspoon of the egg mixture. Repeat with remaining bagels and cheese.In a large bowl combine the remaining 12 egg whites, milk, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Pour egg mixture evenly over the bagels and cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until set.Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1/4 cup pecans and 1 tablespoon cinnamon. Sprinkle over the top of the egg mixture. Bake for 5 minutes longer or until the custard is set. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with maple syrup.

In large saucepan saute onions in butter over medium heat 3 minutes or until tender. Add flour, stirring 2 minutes or until mixture is golden brown. Stir in broth and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Add potatoes, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in cheese and sausage. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with additional cheese and crackers if desired.

In a small bowl, combine the apricot nectar, cornflour and pepper. Heat the oil and butter over medium heat until the butter is melted and the foam subsides. Add the chicken and cook until browned. Add the french onion soup and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add the apricot halves. Pour the apricot mixture over the pasta. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.
Brown chicken. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer until done. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

Preheat grill to high heat. Season each chop with 1 teaspoon mustard and 1/2 teaspoon rosemary. Grill 4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Garnish with remaining rosemary and serve with your favorite vegetable and potato side dishes.

Cook hamburger and drain fat. Add green pepper and green onion. Cook 1 minute. Add macaroni and cheese mix. Bring to boil and stir occasionally until desired tenderness. Add tomato paste and water. In a large skillet cook beef and onion. Add taco seasoning. Add water and bring to a boil. Add corn. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Serve over egg noodles. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese.

Serve with the lemon myrtle mayonnaise and the gremolata.

Pour the stoli into a shaker with 2 cups ice cubes. Add the kahlua and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an old fashioned glass. Add whipped cream to the top and garnish with chocolate syrup and cherry.

In a 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven cook the rice and oil until tender. Drain and set aside. Add the remaining ingredients to the skillet and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer about 3 minutes. Add the cooked rice and stir until combined. Fluff with a fork. Serve with meat or fish.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 20 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 15 minutes.
Comments:Makes 6 cups. Cooks in 30 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 servings. Cooks in 30 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 1 hour.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 1 hour and 30 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks in 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Comments:Makes 4 cups. Cooks
Mix all ingredients together except raisins and peanuts. Mix well. Roll out into 1/4-inch rope and wrap with raisins and peanuts. Roll into rope and cut into 1-inch worms. Store in refrigerator.

Break cauliflower into florets and steam for 3 minutes. Drain and add to food processor. Pulse until the mixture is the consistency of mashed potatoes. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Fry bacon until crisp then remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Slice into small pieces. Fry mushrooms in same pan with bacon drippings until lightly browned. In another pan fry diced red onion in butter until tender and add sliced red bell pepper (I prefer it with a little heat so add a bit of cayenne). Saute until the veggies are tender crisp but not browned, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Mix together the veggies, bacon pieces, tomato slices, and eggs. Salt and pepper to taste. Layer a toasted slice of bread with a generous portion of the vegetable mixture, a slice of cheese if desired, and a sprinkling of paprika. Enjoy!

Combine tahini with water and beat until smooth. Add garlic, cumin, coriander and cayenne. Beat until well blended. Add lemon juice and salt to taste. Thinly slice cucumbers lengthwise. Toss with tahini dressing. Sprinkle with ground pepper.
i would love to see the recipe for that green bean salad you have in the photo with the cucumber salad.
Thanks for the recipe for the Cool Cucumber Salad. It looks great!
This recipe looks so yummy! I can't wait to try it.
I love any kind of salad with cucumbers. Thanks for the recipes!
The Cool Cucumber Salad looks so good. I'll have to make some.
Love to see recipes with cucumbers. Thanks for posting!
The Cool Cucumber Salad looks so good. I will definitely try this recipe!
I have never tried to make my own cucumber recipes. Thanks for the ideas!
I like the look of the crisp cucumber radish salad. I'll

In a small bowl combine all dressing ingredients. Stir until well mixed. Stir in dill. Set aside. Assemble crudits. Drain cucumbers well. Cut into 2" pieces. Cut radishes into 4" pieces. Cut celery into 3" pieces. Cut endive into 3" pieces. Cut chives into 2" pieces. Place all vegetables on serving tray. Top with crudits dressing. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Toss to coat well. Serve.
In blender or food processor, puree first 5 ingredients until smooth. Pour into serving bowl. Add remaining ingredients and toss until well coated. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

In a glass, blend together cool whip and milk until smooth. Add liquor of choice and blend well. Chill for 1 hour or more. In another glass, blend together chocolate pudding with milk until smooth. Fold in fresh raspberries. Chill for 1 hour or more. Layer cool whip mixture then the raspberry pudding mixture alternately in glasses. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a wide pan. Add onions. Saute until soft. Add cabbage and stir to mix. Add cumin seeds and red chillies. Add lemon juice. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add coconut. Mix well. Add salt. Serve warm.

Sift together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and sugar. Beat egg whites until stiff. Beat sour cream and coffee into egg whites. Fold dry ingredients into mixture. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes. Makes 1 dozen.

Preheat the oven to 200f (95c). Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside. Roll out the puff pastry sheet onto a lightly floured surface until it's about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into circles using a small cutter and place on the tray. Prick each pastry circle a few times using the tines of a fork and brush each circle with olive oil. Bake for about 20 minutes until golden brown and bubbling. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly. To assemble the crostini, cut the bocconcini into quarters and place a slice of tomato and a piece of bocconcini in the centre of each crostini. Drizzle with a little pesto and serve immediately.

Put the cider vinegar, lemon zest and juice, cinnamon stick, cloves, star anise and vanilla essence into a large pan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cherries and allow to stand for 20 minutes before removing the spices.

Mix together egg, milk, worcestershire sauce and onions. Combine with ground beef and next five ingredients. Press into loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 minutes. Unmold and serve.
name: pepperoni pasta bakeingredients: cooked pasta, pepperoni, canned spaghetti sauce, shredded mozzarella cheesepreparation:Mix pasta and pepperoni in shallow pan. Top with sauce. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Unmold and serve.
name: easy cheesy chicken pasta bakeingredients: cooked elbow macaroni, chicken thighs or breast (cut into cubes), mushrooms, canned cream of mushroom soup, diced green bell pepper, diced yellow bell pepper, cooked carrots, diced celery, shredded mozzarella cheesepreparation:In a baking dish, combine pasta, chicken and

Cook potatoes in water until tender, drain. Season meat with seasoning salt. Brown meat in small amount of fat, add potatoes and remaining liquid. Mix soup, onion soup mix and water in a small bowl. Add to potatoes and meat. Simmer until heated through.

Cook penne pasta until al dente in a large pot of boiling water. Drain. In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the pancetta and cook until crisp, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the broccoli. Stir to combine. Season with the chili flakes. Add the penne. Toss to combine. Top with the Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Brown the meat in a large skillet. Add the other vegetables. Pour in the water and cover. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to simmer for 20-30 minutes. Add the worcestershire sauce and the red pepper sauce. Cook another 5 minutes. Serve on hamburger buns. Recipe.

Cut the potato into sticks about 1/4 inch thick. Mix the onion with the bacon in a bowl. Set aside. Heat the oil in a skillet until it is very hot. Dip the sticks in the bacon onion mixture. Fry the sticks in the hot oil until they are golden. Drain on paper towel. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan combine stock, onion, pearl barley, beef, potatoes and celery ribs. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer until barley is tender. Add carrots and rosemary. Simmer 30 minutes longer. Stir often to prevent sticking. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley.
Makes 6 servings.

Combine flour, ginger and salt in a large bowl. Beat egg whites and egg yolk in another bowl. Dip shrimp into egg mixture and into flour mixture. Shake off excess coating and deep fry in hot vegetable oil until golden. Drain on paper towels. Combine coconut and cornstarch in a small bowl. Toss shrimp in coconut mixture. Serve immediately.

Combine milk and polenta in a medium pot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Turn off heat and add cheese and basil. Cut peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds and membranes. Stuff each half with about 1/4 cup of polenta. Place on a baking sheet and bake in a 350 degree oven until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges. Drizzle with olive oil.
Mix together all ingredients except for meat. Form into four patties. Cook in a skillet or frying pan. Serve in onion buns.
Combine all in a blender and mix well. Spoon into individual cups or paper liners and chill. Serve with an apple slice.
Process all ingredients together until smooth. Chill in refrigerator for at least one hour. Serve with fresh parsley and pita bread or crackers.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook until just tender but still a bit firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain. In a large bowl, toss the orzo with the red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, butter, basil, garlic and capers. Divide the salad among plates. Top each with some of the feta cheese. Serve.

In a large bowl combine the flour, brown sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl combine the buttermilk, butter and eggs. Stir the two mixtures together just enough to blend. Fold in the blueberries. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups filling them about half way. Sprinkle with a little sugar. Bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the muffins are golden. Makes 12 muffins.

In a sauce pan over medium heat, combine vinegar and sugar and bring to a boil. Pour over chopped cabbage and let stand for 1 hour. Meanwhile, saute the onion and garlic in a wok or fry pan until tender. Add soy sauce and salt and bring to a boil. Add cabbage and cayenne pepper and stir fry for 1 minute more. Serve hot.
thank you for the great recipes, i am always looking for new recipes to try and to use up the leftovers from dinner the night before!
i love all the recipes. i have a lot of leftovers and i always need recipes to use them up!

Combine coconut fat, eggs, salt, icing sugar, cocoa, coffee, rum, lemon peel in a bowl. Mix well. Put into fridge for 1 hour. Grease a baking tin. Pour mixture into tin. Cover with cookies. Cover with nuts. Bake at 175c for 20-25 minutes. Cool in tin. Cut into slices.

In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in broth, carrots, sugar and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add cumin. Simmer 10 minutes. Add peas. Cook until heated through. Remove from heat. Serve.

In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Slowly add the milk while stirring to make a smooth gravy. Add the potato slices, onion, salt and pepper. Cook for 15 minutes over medium heat or until the potato slices are fork-tender. Garnish with parsley flakes before serving.
These were wonderful. I didn't use enough milk (too much flour) so it was a little thick. Next time I will use 1/2 cup milk for sure. Also didn't use the parsley as I don't care for it much. This is a keeper for sure!
The skillet scalloped potatoes were absolutely delicious! I'm so glad I tried this recipe out! I also made the creamy cheddar potatoes as a side dish for the main meal I was serving that night and they were also very good! I will definitely be making both recipes again! Thanks so much for sharing them!
These scalloped potatoes were just what I needed for a quick side dish. I will make

Cook ground beef. Add taco seasoning and salsa. Cook till done. Drain fat. Spread half of the meat mixture over the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the cheese. Spread the cream cheese over the top. Spread the remaining meat mixture and cheese over top. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve in shells with lettuce and tomato.

Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until they are soft. Add the potatoes and cook until they are almost tender. Season with the cayenne and the salt. Taste for seasoning. Add the egg and stir it in. Cook for a few minutes. Serve immediately.

In a medium saucepan combine water and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add couscous. Remove from heat, cover and set aside. In a large skillet heat sesame oil over medium heat. Add onion, chicken bouillon powder and ginger. Stir until onions are softened. Add salmon and simmer for 5 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Remove from heat. In a separate bowl combine coconut extract and skim milk until smooth. Add to skillet and stir in scallions. Pour over couscous in serving dish. Serve immediately.

Rinse and soak the pinto beans. In a dutch oven, cook ham hock for about 15 minutes. Remove ham hock. Add onion and garlic cloves to ham hock drippings. Saute until onions are translucent. Add beans to pot. Add ham hock and bone. Add water. Cook until beans are tender. Add bell peppers. Stir in ham hock. Cook and stir until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve in bowls. Top with shredded cheese.

Heat canola oil in a wok or large frying pan over medium heat. Stir-fry carrot and mushrooms 1-2 minutes until carrot is tender-crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. Heat another tsp of oil in the pan and stir-fry the garlic until fragrant (10-15 seconds). Stir-fry the shrimp until opaque (2-3 minutes). Remove from pan and set aside with vegetables. Stir-fry the snap peas for 1 minute and then add the vegetables and shrimp back to the wok. Stir-fry until all the vegetables are hot through and the peas are still bright green (1-2 minutes). Toss with flour and hoisin sauce until well coated and then add soy sauce and mix well. Serve immediately with steamed rice or noodles.

In large bowl combine chips and milk. Stir until melted and well blended. Stir in cocoa until blended well. Beat egg whites in a medium bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold into milk mixture with a rubber spatula. Combine flour and baking powderstir into batter. Spray a 13x9 inch baking pan with cooking sprayspread batter into pan. Bake for 17 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f (160 degrees c). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk the flour and salt together. In a large bowl, combine the coconut and 1/2 cup of the almond extract. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites on medium speed until they form soft peaks. Add the remaining 1/4 cup almond extract and beat until stiff peaks form. Fold the whipped egg white mixture into the flour mixture gently but thoroughly until combined. Fold in the coconut mixture and mix well. Spoon heaping tablespoonfuls of the batter onto the prepared baking sheets, 2 inches apart. Sprinkle each cookie with 1/2 teaspoon of almonds. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until the cookies are golden. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

Combine brown sugar, butter and egg. Stir in flour and cinnamon. Press into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Mix toffee bits and chips. Spread over baked crust. Bake for 2 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container.

Make a double crust and bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees. Let cool and then cut into 6 inch strips. Mix apple slices with lemon juice and caramel candies and place in crusts and sprinkle with nuts. Heat ice cream topping and pour over apples. Refrigerate.

Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the milk. Sift the flour and spices together. Add to the mixture alternately with the milk. Fold in the lemon rind. Pour into a greased and lined 20cm x 20cm tin. Bake at 160 degrees celcius for about 45 minutes until firm to the touch. Leave in the tin to cool for about 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

In a large skillet add the oil. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the ham and cook until crumbled. Add the cooked hashbrowns and eggs. Stir well. Add the salt and pepper. Top with the cheese and chives. Serve immediately.
Combine lemon juice and honey in small bowl. Whisk in oil. Add pepper to taste. Combine greens, watermelon, blueberries and cucumber. Add dressing and toss well. Top with onion and feta.
Cook lentils in water with bay leaf. Drain. Heat oil in saucepan. Add carrot, pimientos, onion. Stir in vinegar. Add dried basil. Add lentils. Season. Serve.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add beans and cook for 10 minutes until crisp-tender. Drain and pat dry. Melt butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Add green beans and toss until coated evenly. Sprinkle almonds over the top. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a fry pan over medium-high heat. Saute chicken until cooked through stirring often. Remove from pan. Add broccoli to pansaute until tenderremove from pan and set aside. Add mayonnaise to panstir constantly until thickened. Add cheesestir until completely melted. Add chicken and broccoli back to pan. Coverheat to a simmerserve over hot rice.

Dip chicken in egg, then coat in bread crumb mixture. Brown on all sides. Place in baking dish. Mix 3/4 cup of salsa with 1/4 cup of water and 1/4 cup of melted butter. Pour over the browned chicken. Top with monterey jack. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes. Serve over rice.

In saucepan over low heat, melt butterscotch chips. Stir until smooth. Add vanilla. Remove from heat and stir in chow mein noodles. Press onto wax paper. Let harden. Sprinkle with nuts before serving.

Brown the ground beef and onions over medium heat. Drain the fat away. Place the ground beef mixture into large plastic bag or container. Add the lettuce and remaining ingredients. Mix well. Cover tightly and refrigerate at least 1 hour to let the flavors blend together. Serve with your favorite tortilla chips.
You can also use shredded Mexican blend cheese if you don't have Catalina.

You will need a large plastic or glass bowl or container to put the mixture into to store leftovers or to serve from.
Sprinkle with crushed Doritos, and serve with your favorite tortilla chips!
A very unusual taco salad with a delicious southwestern flavor.
Arrange the lettuce in the bottom of the glass serving bowl or on serving plate. Layer the beans, corn, salsa

In electric frying pan or large skillet saute onions and green peppers. Add hash browns. Cook until potatoes are hot. Remove from heat. Add eggs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir well. Add milk. Continue to stir until mixture sets. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook until cheese melts.

Pour white chocolate into a small bowl or plastic sandwich bag. Heat in the microwave for 45 seconds to 1 minute or until melted. Place the walnuts in a bowlset aside. Melt the milk chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in the cashews. Dip each walnut half into the white chocolateplace on a baking sheet with wax paper or parchment paper to set the white chocolate. Dip the walnuts in the cashew mixtureplace on the wax paper. Continue dipping the walnuts until all are done. Refrigerate until set. Store in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
How to make homemade Nut Clusters
Nuts have always been a popular snack food, particularly in the United States and Europe where they are readily available. But there are many different types of nuts that can be eaten as a snack or used in recipes. In this article, we will take a look at some of the most popular nuts and how to make hom

Slice mackerel into 1-inch slices and place in a bowl with the rest of the marinade ingredients. Leave to marinade for a day, or longer if possible. Remove the fish from the bowl and drain off the marinade into a saucepan. Bring the marinade to the boil and reduce until thick and syrupy. Cool and pour over the fish. Leave to marinade again for a few hours in the fridge.

Peach Cobbler 1. Heat oven to 375. Pour 1/2 can drained peaches into bottom of ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan. Set aside. In small bowl, combine 3/4 cup sugar, flour, and 1/4 tsp. vanillastir well. In medium bowl, beat egg with 1/2 cup sugar. Add margarinebeat till well blended. Add flour mixturebeat till smooth. Spread over peaches in pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Peach Bread 2. Place 1/3 cup peach preserves in bottom of ungreased 9-inch square pan. Lay 1/2 the bread out in pan in 1 layersprinkle 1/2 of the nutmeg over. Spread with 1/3 can peaches. Repeat layers. Pour remaining preserves over all. Sprinkle with remaining nutmeg. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve with Peach Cobbler. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Toss brussels sprouts, bacon, and onion together in a bowl. Place in a baking dish. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the top. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve on a bun with mozzarella.

In a large pot melt olive oil. Add onion, garlic and saute until soft. Add tomatoes to pot. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook 10 minutes. Stir in basil.

Peel and chop the garlic cloves into small pieces. Place the almonds and garlic into a skillet with the red bell pepper halves. Roast the mixture at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Turn the mixture over, sprinkle with honey, drizzle with sherry wine vinegar. Place the pan back into the oven for 10 minutes longer. Let cool. Arrange the mixture on a platter garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9x5 loaf pans. Cream together applesauce and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and egg. Combine dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Stir in the wet ingredients until just moistened. Fold in mashed banana and sour cream. Divide batter between the two loaf pans. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the middle comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes then remove from pan to cool completely on wire rack.

In a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat, saute the onion in butter until softened. Add beef broth, rice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer with cover ajar for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and add gorgonzola and heavy cream. Stir in walnuts and season with parsley and parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray pie crusts with cooking spray. Divide evenly between two pie crusts. Mix together brown sugar and cinnamon. Place about 1/4 of the mixture on each pie crust. Top with 2 banana slices. Wrap around the sides of the pie crust. Fold up the edges. Brush with egg. Bake 15 to 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Top with ice cream. Serve immediately.
Blend all ingredients except parmesan cheese and salt and pepper together until smooth. Add cheese and blend briefly. Pour over romaine lettuce and serve.

Melt butter in a heavy frying pan. Add the garlic and onion soup mix. Stir until the mixture is smooth and bubbling. Add the tomato puree and cook until it is reduced to a thick paste. Add the brown sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the soy sauce and vinegar. Stir well. Add the chili sauce. Stir well. Add the spareribs. Cover and bake for 2 hours. Turn ribs and baste with the marinade once during baking. Serve hot with a crisp green salad.
China's Changing Food Supply
The Food and Drug Administration has issued a warning to importers and distributors about a product labeled as Chinese food supplement that contains undeclared sibutramine, a controlled substance used for weight loss. Sibutramine is marketed in the U.S. as Meridia and is available only by prescription. It is not approved for marketing in the U.S. as a food supplement. The product is labeled as "Chinese food supplement," but the FDA is not

Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Combine the chopped chocolate, butter and cream in a large saucepan over low heat. Heat the mixture until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the brandy. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Refrigerate until firm. Using a sharp knife or a spatula dipped in hot water, cut the truffle mixture into 1-inch squares. Roll each square in your hands to form a ball. Return the truffles to the refrigerator to set. When ready to serve, roll the truffles in cocoa powder, unsweetened coconut flakes or finely chopped nuts. Keep the finished truffles refrigerated.

In a bowl combine quark with milk and oil. Add vanilla powder and sugar. Add salt, flour and baking powder. Beat well with a spatula. Add raisins and fold through with a spoon. Heat up a pan. Pour a spoonful of mixture onto the hot pan and spread evenly with a spatula. Bake for 2 minutes at 200 degrees Celsius. Remove from pan with a spatula. Place on a plate. Repeat with remaining mixture. Let cool down. Cut into pieces with a sharp knife.

In a large bowl combine the first four ingredients until well blended. Add the oats and mix well. Add the water and mix well. Roll the mixture into walnut size balls and place into a greased pan. In a small bowl combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the meatballs. Cover and bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Makes about 30 meatballs.
Place all the ingredients in the slow cooker. Mix well. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with rice or corn bread.
Mix the raspberry puree with the mascarpone. Mix until smooth. Add the sugar and vanilla essence and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to use.
Preheat oven to 400f. Coat a baking dish with butter. Place chicken in dish. Combine remaining ingredients. Brush mixture evenly over chicken. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat pasta in large pot of boiling water. Cook until al dente. Drain. In a small saute pan combine the butter, olive oil, garlic scapes and salt. Saute 3 minutes. Add the pasta. Stir in the baby spinach. Toss well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Boil carrots until crisp-tender. Drain well. In saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in honey, brown sugar and lemon juice. Heat until hot and bubbly. Stir in drained carrots and heat through. Serve hot. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Cut lemongrass in half, then cut in half again. Tie 2 or 3 pieces of lemongrass together with twine. Set aside. Combine garlic, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, black pepper and sea salt in a bowl. Add lemongrass. Marinate chickens in bowl for at least 2 hours. Thread 3 chickens on skewers. Grill over medium heat for 5-6 minutes per side.
In a saucepan over medium heat, melt margarine. Add syrup& water, stirring to mix well. Add the onions and cook over medium heat, covered, for 10 minutes. Uncover and cook 5 minutes more. Serve warm.
Fill a collins glass with ice. Pour in vodka, grand marnier, and orange juice. Stir gently. Garnish with an orange slice, if desired, and serve.

Place lamb chops in a heavy skillet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add olive oil and turn the heat to medium high. Brown well on both sides. Add apple juice and cook until evaporated. Add stock and continue to cook until evaporated. Add maple syrup and cook until evaporated. Add lemon juice and cook until evaporated. Add prunes and apple and cook until tender. Pour off the juice from the skillet and pour over the chops. Garnish with lemon wedges. Serve.

bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for about 8-10 minutes or until al dente. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the parmegiano and cook until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Once the pasta is done cooking, drain it and toss it in the saucepan with the cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool on wire racks.

In a large skillet saute the shrimp in the oil until they just begin to turn pink. Season with red pepper flakes and salt and add the wine and lemon juice. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the liquid is reduced by half. Stir in the parsley and the butter and serve immediately with pasta or rice.
name: appetizing shrimp scampi
ingredients: butter, olive oil, fresh parsley, salt, pepper, garlic cloves, lemon juice, fresh shrimp
preparation:Heat butter over low heat. Add olive oil, and next 5 ingredients. Cook about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add shrimp and let stand for 30 minutes. Serve on large platter with toothpicks.
name: easy lemon dijon shrimp scampi
ingredients: large shrimp, fresh garlic, butter, dried chili pepper flakes, dijon mustard, fresh lemon juice, fresh parsley, salt, black pepper, parmesan cheese
pre

Cut 1 lb turkey into 1/2 inch cubes. In a skillet, saute onion in butter until tender. Stir in green beans. In a bowl, combine soup and water. Stir into onion mixture. Add turkey and heat through. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole dish. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes or until heated through. Meanwhile, make mashed potatoes. Spread over top of turkey mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes more.

In a large heavy saucepot, melt the butter over medium heat. Cook the celery and onions until soft. Add the chunky peanut butter and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the corn and the cream. Heat for 5 minutes. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Mix first three ingredients. Pour into 9x13 baking dish, sprinkle with cornstarch. Bake 40 minutes 350. Cool 10 minutes. Mix remaining ingredientspour over baked mixture and bake 10 minutes at 350. Serve with whipped cream on top.

Put the ingredients into the bread machine per your bread machine instructions. Mine calls for adding the liquid ingredients first and then adding the flours on top. Save the tomatoes for later. Put the salt in one corner of the flour, the sugar in another. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the flour. Make a well for the yeast and add it. Set the bread machine for basic and medium crust and start the machine. After 5 minutes of kneading add the tomatoes or when the machine beeps. This makes a one pound loaf.

Spread the cream cheese over the inside of one of the pitas. Sprinkle with spinach. Add sliced turkey. Spread with ranch dressing. Cover with the top of the pita and cut in half. Serve the sandwiches at once.

Cook bacon and remove from pan. Add green onions to same pan, saute for 1 minute. In a separate bowl, beat eggs with a fork until they are slightly frothy, add sour cream, feta cheese, cracked black pepper and mix well. Pour into same pan that contains green onions. Add butter to pan and heat over medium-low heat until eggs are set. Remove from heat, sprinkle with more cracked black pepper. Serve with toast.
In a large pot place zucchini with enough water to cover them. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to medium low and simmer until tender. Drain. Mash with pesto sauce to taste. Salt and pepper to taste.

Place cucumbers in a colander. Sprinkle with salttoss well to coat. Let stand 30 minutes. Drainrinse cucumberspat dry. Combine soy sauce, vinegar, and 1 teaspoon sugar in a bowlwhisk until smooth. Add remaining 1/4 teaspoon sugarwhisk until blended. Add oil in a slow, steady streamwhisk until smooth. Add gingerrootstir well. Add scallionstoss well. Arrange cucumbers evenly in a serving bowlpour dressing over. Toss wellrefrigerate 1 hour before serving. Serves 4

Remove liquid from tofu by wrapping in paper towels for about 20 minutes. Slice into 4 pieces. Dust lightly with flour, then dip into egg and then into crumb mixture. Heat oil in skillet to 375 degrees f and fry tofu until brown. Drain on paper towel. In small bowl, combine soy sauce, white wine, sugar and green onion. Spoon sauce over fried tofu. Serve hot.

Cut chicken breasts into 1 inch cubes. In a skillet heat the oil. Add the chicken cubes. Fry until they are almost done. Remove from skillet. Cut the pepper into small pieces. Fry them in the remaining oil. Add garlic. Fry until the garlic turns brown. Add the yoghurt and the walnut. Mix well. Add the chicken cubes. Serve with the dried bread.

In a small bowl combine the refried beans, jalapenos, hot pepper sauce and garlic powder. Season to taste. Spread onto romaine lettuce leaves. Top with tomatoes. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and lime juice. Sprinkle with salt if desired. Serve with freshly made tortilla chips.

Drain salmon of excess oil and flake it with fork. In small saucepan cook onions in butter until softened. Add salmon to pan and cook for a minute or two until heated through. In small bowl combine egg, soup and bread crumbs. Add ketchup and black pepper, mix well. Spread mixture evenly over the salmon. Top with fresh mushrooms. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until lightly browned.
Combine first 3 ingredients in bowl until well blended. Stir in sun-dried tomato packed in oil. Stir in artichoke hearts and roasted red pepper. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, melt the butter with the onions and the garlic until the onions are lightly browned. Stir in the all-purpose flour, season with the nutmeg, salt, and ground black pepper. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in the half-and-half gradually while still stirring and cook for 2 minutes longer. Stir in the parmesan cheese and pour over pasta of choice. Serve immediately.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain fat and save. Saute bacon drippings in skillet over medium heat. Add Brussel sprouts and saute for 3 minutes. Add olive oil, salt and granulated garlic. Cover pan and cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Remove cover and add chervil. Cook for 2 minutes longer or until tender. Serve immediately.

In small bowl combine brown sugar, fresh gingerroot and garlic cloves. Add soy and vinegar. Let stand 10 minutes. Add sirloin or porterhouse steaks to small bowl and turn to coat with the marinade mixture. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours or overnight turning occasionally. Remove from the refrigerator about 1 hour before you plan to cook the meat. Cook on a gas or charcoal grill over medium heat 3 to 4 minutes per side until desired doneness. Cooking time will vary depending on the thickness of the meat. Remove from the heat and let rest 5 minutes before serving.
I love recipes like this! This is so easy and really makes a difference in the flavor of the food.
Thank you so much for sharing this recipe with Full Plate Thursday and have a great week.

Put 1 tsp honey, 1 tsp soy sauce, 1 tsp plum jam, 1/2 tsp garlic in a small bowl. Put the rest of the honey, soy sauce, jam in a large bowl. Mix the honey/soy sauce/plum jam mixture with the chicken in the large bowl. Marinate for at least 1 hour. Preheat grill. Grill for 5-8 minutes per side or until done. Serve hot.

Crush the vanilla wafers and put in the bottom of a pie dish. Mix together the raspberries and the bananas. Beat the cream cheese and the sweetened condensed milk together with a hand mixer until smooth. Pour the mixture over the top of the wafers. Layer the wafers on top. Chill in refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Mix the cold water and the instant white chocolate pudding and pie filling mix until smooth. Spoon the mixture over the top and sides. Chill in refrigerator until set. Top with a dollop of whipping cream and a fresh raspberry.

Cook spaghetti in plenty of salted boiling water according to package directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, herbs, salt and pepper. Add pasta and toss until sauce coats well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Mix 2 cups all-purpose flour with 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt in large bowl. Mash 1/2 cup oats with 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce in a small bowlstir into all-purpose flour mixture until blended. Beat 1 egg with 1/2 cup applesauce in a medium bowl with wire whiskstir into all-purpose flour mixture until blended. Stir in 1/2 cup mashed banana. Spoon batter into a greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake 50 minutes or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Cut into 12 slices. Makes 12 servings.

Bring hot water to a boil and dissolve the coffee. Cream the butter and sugar. Add the dissolved coffee. Combine the cake mix and the pudding together. Add the sour cream. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour into greased and floured bundt pan. Bake for 55 to 60 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Drizzle with whipping cream and garnish with a chocolate shavings.

Peel and slice pineapple and papaya. Cut grapes in halves. Peel and slice apples. Peel and cut bananas in slices. Combine fruits in large bowl. Stir in lime juice. Add nuts. Refridgerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat egg in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken in eggthen roll in breadcrumbs. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of the chickencook 2 minutes on each side. Remove from skillet. Add tomato sauce and remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Heat through. Spoon sauce over the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Top with mozzarella. Arrange remaining breaded chicken over mozzarella. Top with mozzarella. Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is tender and golden. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of parmesan before serving.

Dice chicken into bite sized pieces. In a medium bowl combine chicken, spinach dip, dressing and mix. Spread dressing mix evenly over dough. Place english cucumbers evenly over top. Sprinkle with red pepper slices. Arrange cherry tomatoes over top. Sprinkle with feta. Bake according to pizza dough directions.

Brown beef with onion in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add flour and broth to the meat mixture. Whisk until smooth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 10 minutes. Add pierogies and vegetablescook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heatstir in italian seasoning. Sprinkle with cheesecover until melted. Serve immediately.
Wash chicken parts with cold running waterrinse well to remove any traces of bloodpat dry with paper towel.
Make the marinade by mixing together the first 6 marinade ingredients in a large bowlstir to combineadd the chicken partstoss to coat wellcoverrefrigerate for 3 hours or overnight (or up to 24 hours).
Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heatadd the garliccook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes or until light golden in colouradd the onioncook for 5 minutes or until softenedadd
Cut crust off rye bread and soak in water for 30 minutes. Cook in broth. Add caraway seed and salt. Cook for another 20 minutes. Mash 1/2 of soup. Add beaten egg yolk. Reheat. Add sour cream.

In a large mixing bowl, beat mascarpone cheese at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth. Add whipping creambeat until mixture is smooth. Spread 1 cup in the bottom of a trifle bowl or other serving dish. Top with half of the pie slices. Spread with 1/3 of the caramel topping. Repeat layering once with remaining pie slices, caramel topping, fudge topping and pecans. Coverchill for 8 hours. Serve chilled.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a pot. Add the lobsters and cook for 4 minutes. Add the fennel bulbs and cook for 2 minutes. Remove the lobsters and set aside to cool. Slice the lobsters into bite-sized pieces. In a small saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add the tomatoes and cook for 4 minutes. Drain the water and allow the tomatoes to cool. In a bowl, mix together the arugula and the truffle oil. Season the salad with lemon juice, the white balsamic and the tarragon. Arrange the arugula salad on plates and top with the lobster and the tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 6 minutes or until al dentedrain. Toss pasta with spreadable cheese, milk, lemon peel and juice, zucchini and smoked salmon. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with chives. Serve hot.

In a large pot bring 2 cups water to a boil. Add the cranberries. Cook for 10 minutes or until berries pop. Drain and place in a large bowl. Stir in the honey and orange juice. Heat the remaining 4 cups water in a small pot over medium heat. When the water begins to simmer, stir in the cinnamon stick and cloves. Cook for 3-5 minutes. Remove the stick and cloves. Pour the hot water over the cranberries and stir. Let stand for 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Place sugar into shaker. Pour wine and nectar into shaker and stir until sugar is dissolved. Shake well and pour into glasses filled with ice cubes. Slice plums and place one in each glass. Garnish with mint sprigs and serve immediately.

Pound shrimp to 1/4 inch thickness. Heat vegetable oil in skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook 2 to 3 minutes per side until just pink. Remove from skillet. In small bowl combine marmalade and hoisin sauce until blended. In small bowl combine the cucumber and lettuce. In each tortilla spread 1/4 of the sauce mixture. Divide the shrimp among tortillas. Sprinkle with the crushed red pepper. Top with the cucumber and lettuce mixture. Roll tortillas. Slice into 6 pieces each. Serve immediately.

Unroll pastry sheet. Spread with cheese. Place the ham on top of the cheese. Fold the edges to cover the cheese and meat. Press the edges with the tines of a fork. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Garnish with almonds.

Butterfly the chops. These need to be big if one is to feed two people as they skrink. Toss lightly in flour. Fry gently in butter and oil. When browned put all the fillets into a large frying pan, add orange juice to half cover, some slivers of orange peel, the ginger and brown sugar. Combine all together and poach gently for about 20 minutes.

Cut pickled jalapenos crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Fry bacon strips until crisp. Place hamburger patty and cheese on bottom half of bun. Top with lettuce, tomatoes and jalapenos. Spread top half of bun with mayonnaise. Place bacon strips across top half of bun.
Corn Grits With Jalapeno Peppers.
Corn Grits With Jalapeno Peppers Recipe.

Place bread in stock pot with 1/4 cup of water and bring to boil. Cook until bread is very soft and mushy. Add black japonica, onion, celery and chicken broth. Cook 5 minutes. Season with celery top and rubbed sage. Add eggs and stir. Put into greased 9x9 pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Make the marinade by combining the olive oil and sesame seeds. Place the chicken breast fillets between two sheets of cling film and use the flat side of a rolling pin to flatten them slightly. Season with salt. Mix the marinade and pour it over the chicken. Leave to marinate for about 4 hours. Thread the chicken onto the wooden skewers and brush with a little of the marinade. Grill for about 4 minutes on each side. Serve with the lemon wedges and the salad.

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add butter and garlic and saut until fragrant. Add shrimp and cook 2-3 minutes or until pink. Add wine and lemon juice and cook until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with parsley and garnish with a sprig of parsley.

Combine tomatoes and cream cheese in blender until smooth. Add paprika, basil and tomato soup. Mix well. In a sauce pan over medium heat add butter. Add onions and cook until transparent. Add milk and mix well. Stir in paprika and basil. Stir in tomato mixture. Bring to boil. Serve hot.

Cut the top 1/2 inch off the cucumber. Using a vegetable peeler make the cucumber into long wide strips. Set aside. Thinly slice the smoked salmon. Mix the cream cheese with the cream cheese. Add the garlic, mint, and dill. Mix well. Season with lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Slice the bottom of the cucumber. Stuff the cream cheese mixture in the centre of the cucumber. Place a piece of smoked salmon on top. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients together. Pour over freshly cleaned raw shrimp. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Grill or bake. Serve with warm tortillas.

Divide dough in half. Roll out half dough on lightly floured surface with lightly floured rolling pin. Spread with 2/3 cup of chocolate hazelnut spreadsprinkle with 1/2 cup chocolate chips. Roll up tightly. Cut into 1-in. slices. Repeat with remaining dough. Bake at 350 degrees until lightly browned. Cool 10 minutes. Cut into 1/2-in. slices. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees until edges begin to brown, about 10 minutes. Cool completely on wire racks.

Peel and dice potatoes. Cook in water until tender. Cool in water to stop cooking. Drain and cool completely. Peel eggs, dice, and set aside. Finely chop celery and dice onion. Add celery, onion, prepared mustard, sugar, salt, vinegar, milk, and dressing to potatoes. Mix well. Stir in the egg cubes. Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serve with a side of pickles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl, mix the dry ingredients together. Add the milk and mix well. Spray an 8x8 pan with a nonstick cooking spray. Spread the batter out in the pan. Add the fruit on top of the batter. Sprinkle the sugar on top. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until the fruit is tender.

Slice strawberries into thin strips (about 1/4-inch thick). Place strawberries in a large glass or pitcher with ice and stir. Add fresh squeezed lime juice and Splenda Granular, stirring to mix. Slowly pour in sparkling water to fill glasses, stirring as you pour to mix in strawberries and dissolve Splenda Granular. Serve immediately over ice.

Place 1 cup of warm water and sugar into a bowl. Stir. Add yeast and wait for it to bubble. Add the oil and flour. Mix together and let sit for 10-20 minutes. You will be amazed how soft your dough will be. You will have to add more flour. Add a little at a time until you have the right consistency. Knead for a few minutes. Place in greased bread pans. Let rise for about 45 minutes or until double in size. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes. You can bake in a loaf pan or 2 round loaves. You will have the softest bread you have ever tasted.

Bring 6 cups water to a boil. Add spinach. Cook 2-3 minutes. Drain. In a 6-quart dutch oven over medium-low heat, combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, raisins, pine nuts, garlic, salt and pepper. Cook until just tender. Add the spinachtoss to coat. Serve hot.

In large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add mushrooms and saute 3 minutes, until mushrooms release juice. Add broccoli and rosemary and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until broccoli is crisp-tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Garlic is a bulb that is widely used as a flavouring in cooking. It is a species in the onion genus, Allium, closely related to onion, shallot and leek.
It is native to central Asia and northeastern Iran and has long been a common seasoning worldwide, with a history of several thousand years of human consumption and use. It was known to ancient Egyptians and has been used for both culinary and medicinal purposes since then.
The word 'garlic' is derived from the Old English word 'garleac' (or 'garleah' in the north) which is itself a derivation from the Old French word 'garle' (also 'garlic').
Garlic was well known to the ancient Egyptians. It was commonly used in both food and medicine

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Cook green peppers, garlic and salt for 4 minutes or until peppers are tender. Stir in salsa and olives. Cool. Cook chicken in skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes or until no longer pink in center. Add salsa mixture. Cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Stir in 1 cup of sour cream. Spread 1/3 cup of salsa mixture in bottom of 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Layer 6 tortillas, 1/3 of the chicken mixture and 1/2 of the cheese on top of salsa mixture in baking dish. Repeat layering once. Top with remaining salsa mixture and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining 1/3 cup of sour cream. Serve warm.

Make pizza dough and roll out on parchment lined baking sheet to about 1/4 inch thick. Spread pumpkin butter on top of dough using a rubber spatula or spoon. Top with dried cranberries and flax seeds. Roll dough tightly up and cut into 1 inch pieces. Place on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes until golden brown. While they are baking mix powdered sugar and orange juice until smooth and drizzle over the top of the rolls when they are done baking.

In a large saucepan combine the rice with the sour cream. Stir together. Heat over medium heat until boiling. Cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the chicken broth with the diced tomato with green chili peppers. Cook until heated through. Add the cooked rice. Heat until thoroughly combined. Stir in the jalapeno peppers. Sprinkle with the cheese.

Drain and rinse the chickpeas. Place in a large bowl and cover with boiling water. Leave to stand for 2 hours. Drain and rinse the chickpeas again and place in a large bowl. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan and saute the garlic and onions until golden brown. Remove the bay leaves and discard. Add the egg yolks and stir well. Add the red wine vinegar and water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 1 minute. Pour the mixture over the chickpeas and add the parsley and capers. Season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate for 4 hours before serving. Serve chilled with crusty bread.
Dice chicken into bite-sized pieces. Place in bowl with light italian dressing. Mix well. Spread mixture evenly on french bread. Layer with lettuce, tomato, parmesan cheese, then french bread.
Cook ramen in a large pot of boiling water according to package directionsdrain. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add the ramentoss to mix well. Serve at once.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Beat 4 eggs and 2 egg whites until frothy. Beat in 1/2 cup granulated sugar. In a small mixing bowl, combine 1 cup lemon juice and 1/2 cup orange juice. Beat the egg mixture and lemon juice mixture. Fold in 1/2 cup icing sugar. Beat until well blended. Pour into 3 pie crusts. Bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes or until puffed. Reduce heat to 325 degrees and bake for an additional 20 minutes. Cool on racks. Dust with icing sugar.

Boil potatoes in their skins until done, then peel. Mash potatoes with eggs, milk, onion, salt and pepper to taste. In a pan, fry the bacon until crisp, then add the potato mixture. Cook over low heat for about 5 minutes or until mixture sets. Serve with the bacon grease.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Remove seeds from chiles. Fill chiles with a mixture of cheeses and eggs, then place in a 9×13 inch baking dish. Pour half-and-half cream over top of chiles. Sprinkle with picante sauce if desired. Bake for 30 minutes.
Chicken is a very healthy meat for your kids as it is a source of lean protein. It is also rich with nutrients such as iron, calcium, potassium and zinc which are essential to growing kids. But if you are thinking of making a delicious and easy chicken meal for your kids, try this easy and delicious recipe for Chicken Stir Fry with Vegetables.
1/4 cup finely shredded carrot
2 teaspoon cornstarch dissolved in 2 tablespoons cold water
1/4 cup toasted sesame seeds for garnish
In a wok or large frying pan over high heat, stir fry chicken breast, carrot and onion for 3

Cook sausage in skillet. Break up sausage. Add green peppers. Add eggs. Cook until lightly set. Add milk. Add flour. Stir. Add hash browns. Add mustard. Stir. Add cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Pour into 8 inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

In saucepan combine chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, beef bouillon cubes, italian seasoning, minced garlic clove, olive oil and parmesan cheese. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in red pepper flakes. Serve over spaghetti.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. On a cutting board lay a flour tortilla. Sprinkle half of the cheese over the bottom third of the tortilla. Top with a layer of bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Add lettuce and top with remaining cheese. Fold in sides of tortilla and roll up. Wrap in foil and bake for 10 minutes. Unwrap and serve with salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9x13 pan with cooking spray or use wax paper to line pan. Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar, stirring until it dissolves. Add eggs and vanilla. Stir until well blended. Add flour, cocoa and baking powder. Beat until smooth. Fold in oats and nuts if using. Spread evenly in pan. Bake 25-30 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into squares.

In a large crockpot, combine cream of chicken soup, evaporated skim milk, hot water and dried parsley flakes. Whisk to mix well. Add black pepper, onion and frozen whole kernel corn. Cook for 2 hours. Add raw potatoes and cook for 1 hour. Add cooked chicken breasts and frozen peas. Cook for an additional 1 hour. Serve in warmed bowls.
Boil potatoes until tender, drain well. Add spreadable cheese, butter & herbs. Mash well & serve.

Toast nuts in a single layer in a shallow pan in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for about 8 minutes. Do not let burn. Turn off oven. Let cool for about 10 minutes. Drain water from cashew nuts. Using a blender, blend cashews with water until smooth. Add the toasted nuts. Blend again. Add lemon juice. Serve with crackers.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan. Saut onion until lightly browned. Add the carrots and celery ribs. Cook until tender. Add the chicken stock and cook for 20 minutes. Add the beans, broccoli florets. Add evaporated milk. Season with salt and pepper.

Place pineapple preserves and apricot preserves in a saucepan over low heat and combine well. Add dark brown sugar and water and cook until sugar dissolves. Add ham and simmer covered for 5 minutes or until glaze is thickened. Remove ham and pour glaze over top. Sprinkle with pecan halves and top with cherry.

Combine the sugar and flour in a medium size saucepan over low heat. Stir in the milk and cook until the mixture forms a soft ball. Remove from the heat and stir in the light corn syrup, butter and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Stir in the pecans and pour into a lightly buttered dish and cool. Cut into squares and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix paprika with salt. Dust each fillet in paprika salt mix. Coat each fillet in olive oil. Place in baking dish. Bake 20 minutes in preheated oven. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare the marinade by combining all ingredients in a large bowl. Cut the tenderloin into 1 inch pieces. Place tenderloin pieces in the marinade and allow to marinade 30 minutes or more. Place tenderloin in the crock pot and cover with the marinade. Cook in the crock pot 3 hours on low heat. Remove tenderloin pieces and place in the oven for 10 minutes. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and put into a gallon size baggie. Add the remaining ingredients and toss well. Bake for 45 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. Serve over rice or noodles.
In large mixing bowl combine all ingredients. Press into ungreased 13x9 pan. Refrigerate for one hour. Cut into 4 rows by 4 rows.

Melt butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and saute until no longer pink. Add hot sauce. Stir in dressing. Spread pizza crust with dressing mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 425 degrees F for 8 to 10 minutes or until heated through and crust is lightly browned. Garnish with bleu cheese and celery. Serve immediately.

Beat brown sugar, margarine, milk, and peanut butter in large bowl until blended. Beat in cocoa and icing sugar until smooth and creamy. Beat in vanilla until icing is light and fluffy. Use as desired.

In a large nonstick frying pan, heat oil on medium heat. Add scallops and cook on each side for 3-4 minutes or until firm. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with lime juice, cilantro & season with pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sour cream, Dijon mustard and garlic powder. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place the chicken in a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with bread crumb mixture. Bake for about 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Top with Parmesan cheese. Serve with potatoes.

Brown ground beef in a skillet. Add the chili sauce. Stir in the fine egg noodles, onion soup mix and enough water to cover the top of the noodles. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until the noodles are tender.
Low-carb eating doesn't have to mean boring! This collection of easy and delicious low-carb recipes is sure to satisfy any craving. Whether you're looking for a hearty meal to enjoy for dinner or a quick snack that won't leave you hungry again in an hour, these recipes have you covered!
From chicken parmesan to bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin, you'll love these easy low-carb recipes.
There are so many benefits to a low-carb diet!
Low-carb diets have been shown to help with weight loss, improve blood sugar levels, and reduce the risk of heart disease. Additionally, low-carb diets can help you feel more energized and have more sustained energy throughout the day.
Whether you're looking to lose weight, improve your

Cook couscous in boiling water for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in frozen green peas and cook for 1 minute. Drain well. Combine with sun dried tomatoes and feta cheese. Garnish with fresh mint. Serve hot or cold.
You can also check the recipes for Fresh Mushroom Pizza, Fresh Mint Ice Cream and Fresh Pasta Sauce.
This is a great salad. I have made it many times and love it!
The roasted red pepper and feta spread recipe is great. I used a little less jalapeno than the recipe calls for and added some garlic to the roasted peppers. I also used less salt. It was great!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Remove center of lettuce wedges. Fill with onion, bacon, sour cream and ranch mix. Cover with plastic wrap and bake for 10 minutes or until center is tender. Remove from oven. Garnish with basil leaves. Makes 2 servings. You may add chopped tomatoes and cucumbers. You can change the ranch mix to your favorites.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl mix together the eggs and half-and-half cream until well blended. Add the dried thyme and white pepper and blend in well. Layer in the pie shell the cooked bacon and the gruyere cheese. Pour in the egg mixture and bake for about 40 minutes until the quiche is set and the center is firm. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.

In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, combine milk and apple pie spice. Heat just until steaming and serve in a mug. Top with a drizzle of dark chocolate and a sprinkle of sugar. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a dollop of heavy cream.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place in a serving bowl. Add milk to sour cream in a small bowl. Whisk to combine. Add all remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour over the pasta. Stir to coat. Serve immediately.
Soften cheese and blend in cream cheese. Blend in pepper to taste. Spoon into tart shell or onto serving plate. Arrange apricots and parsley over top. Chill. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray 12 cupcake cups. In a large bowl combine flour, baking soda and spices. In a smaller bowl, combine brown and white sugars. Add salad oil to this mixture. Add in vanilla. Beat eggs and add to sugar and oil. Add in flour mixture and beat well. Fold in cranberries and crushed pineapple. Pour into cupcake cups and bake for 25 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Lay out 4 sheets of aluminum foil. Place 1 onion half on 1 piece of foil. Top with half the green peppers and half the chops. Repeat with remaining onion half, green peppers and chops. Top with remaining onion half, green peppers, remaining 4 chops, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup water and 1 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Tightly fold foil around packets, leaving room for steam to escape. Place on grill. Cook 20 minutes or until done to taste.
thank you for sharing these recipes..I'll have to try a few of these out..
Those all look great! I would love to try the spicy one!
These all look so good! I have never seen the rick's one before!
These are great! I'm going to make the one called Sweet and Sour Pork Chops for my family this week. Thanks for sharing!
Heat peanut butter and light brown sugar in a microwave for 30 seconds. Beat in egg and baking soda. Stir in chocolate chips. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on waxed paper. Refrigerate overnight.

In a blender container place strawberries, water and pineapple sherbet. Blend on medium speed for 30 seconds or just until slushy. Add the orange juice concentratecontinue to blend on medium speed for 10 seconds or just until the mixture is slushy. Pour into paper cups. Place sticks into center of each cup. Freeze for 4 hours or until solid.
 strawberry freeze-upingredients: fresh strawberries, ice cream, ice cubespreparation:Combine strawberries and ice cream in blender container. Blend on low speed just until mixed. Add ice cubes and ice cream. Blend on medium speed just until slushy. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Lightly coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Whisk together greek yogurt, mustard, parsley, dill, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl. Season fish with additional 1/4 teaspoon each pepper and salt. Place fish in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread yogurt mixture over fish. Bake for 4 minutes more. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Beat egg with milk, salt and pepper. Mix flour into batter with fork until smooth. Heat oil in heavy saucepan. Dip each clam into batter and lower into oil with slotted spoon. Fry until golden brown, turning once. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two loaf pans. Beat together honey, eggs, and mashed bananas. Stir in butter. In another bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir into honey mixture. Stir in pecans. Pour batter into pans. Bake for 1 hour.

Wash the sweet potatoes. Prick all over with a fork. Place in a pan with about 1/2 inch water. Cook on medium heat until tender. Cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out pulp. Stir in brown sugar. Add tangerine slices. Pour tangerine juice over. Add tangerine peel. Top with margarine. Bake at 350. F. for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Slice cucumber lengthwise into 1/4 inch slices. Toss with bell pepper and onion. Combine honey and vinegar and toss with vegetable mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Let stand 2 hours. Arrange vegetable mixture in single layer on paper towel lined plate. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Place 3 or 4 sprigs of dill and 1 t. Mustard seeds on each serving plate. Serve vegetable mixture with crisp lettuce leaves.
In a large bowl mix all the ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or longer. Makes 4 servings.
In a large bowl mix together the cucumbers, onions, and tomatoes. Add the lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Serves 4.
In a bowl, stir together the oil, vinegar and sugar. Add the celery and onions and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. Serves 4.
In a salad

Pound out breast. Season with crushed red pepper flakes. Dredge in cornstarch. Brown in butter. Add orange marmalade. Cook until sauce is thick. Add heinz 57 steak sauce. Pour over chicken. Garnish with slivered almonds. Serve on top of steamed rice. Garnish with orange zest.
Dissolve sugar in boiling water over low heat. Stir in cornstarch until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in butter, juice, and rind. Season with salt. Serve hot or chilled.

Bring the water to a boil in a large pot. Add the bean paste, garlic and dashi. Let simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the hot pepper paste, zucchini and potatoes. Stir to combine. Add the fresh mushrooms. Stir again. Cook for 5 more minutes. Add the onion. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve the tofu on the side and ladle the hot soup over it. Serve with steamed white rice.

Bake eggplant at 400f until tender. Cut into 1/4 inch slices. Cut 3 inches off one end of each slice, then open it like an envelope. Sprinkle basil leaves over the cut side. Put 1/2 teaspoon of crumbled feta into the bottom of each envelope. Fold over the open end. Drizzle the tops of the rolls with olive oil. Bake at 400f until rolls are golden brown.

In a zip lock type plastic bag add olive oil and garlic and seal. Let marinate 1 hour or more. Remove steak from bag and marinate 4 hours or overnight in refrigerator. In a small bowl add worcestershire sauce and dijon mustard. Melt butter in a saut pan over medium high heat. Add steak and sear to desired temperature. Remove from pan and set aside. In pan add rosemary and thyme and stir. Add 1 tsp of the mustard mixture and stir until blended. Add steaks back to the pan and pour the remaining mustard mixture over the steaks. Garnish with fresh thyme and serve.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Drain and rinse garbanzos. Combine beans, paprika, cayenne, salt and garlic salt in large bowl. Spread on baking sheet. Bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours until crisp and lightly browned. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 375-degrees f. Arrange onion slices in a single layer in the bottom of a greased baking pan. Place salmon on top of onions and sprinkle with sesame seeds. In a small bowl mix together ginger and soy sauce and drizzle over fish. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serves 6.

Rub salt and pepper onto pork loin and place in crock pot. Add all remaining ingredients except cornstarch and water. Cook on high for 1 hour and then cook on low for 4-5 hours. Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir into meat last 15 minutes of cooking time which will help make the gravy. Remove roast onto a serving plate. This recipe will go well with rice or noodles.

Combine first three ingredients in a saucepan and simmer. Whisk in remaining ingredients. Chill until ready to use. Slice each mango lengthwise into 2 pieces. Scoop out flesh and dice. Cut each avocado in half. Scoop out flesh and dice. Toss together mangoes and avocados. Place 1 tablespoon of mixture in center of each piece of mango. Wrap with a slice of mango and secure with toothpicks. Brush with dressing and grill until done.

Drain fish, rinse and pat dry. In medium bowl, mix together vegetable crumbs, parmesan and milk. Press firmly on fish. Place in shallow baking dish. In small bowl, combine butter and next 5 ingredients. Brush over top and sides of fish. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Steam cauliflower in microwave or on stovetop until just barely crisp-tender. Set aside. Melt margarine in medium skillet over medium heat. Add flour and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add milk and stir until thickened. Stir in chilies, salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Add cauliflower, red pepper and cheddar cheese. Mix well. Spoon mixture into 13x9 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve immediately.
Follow directions on box of kool-aid. Add sugar to regular. Add sugar substitute to sugar free. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add cold water to make the jello more liquid. Add kool-aid. Chill.

Heat oil and butter in large skillet over medium heat. Brown chicken in small batches. Add onion and cook 5 minutes. Stir in paprika and cook 2 minutes. Stir in stock and cook until almost evaporated. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add sour cream and heat through. Serve over hot rice or noodles. Garnish with green onion.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Spread butter on corn. Season with chili powder and hot pepper sauce to taste. Top with ice cubes. Center corn inside reynolds hot bag, large size. Double fold ends to form packet, leaving room for heat circulation inside. Grill 12-15 minutes, covered, turning packet over once halfway through cooking. Cut open top of foil bag, carefully, using a sharp knife. Allow steam to escape, fold back foil. Garnish with parmesan cheese. Serve.

Preheat grill. Marinate the chicken in wine, rind, lemon juice, tomato paste and paprika. Grill over medium heat until done. Brush with the sauce. Grill for a few minutes longer. Cut the chicken into serving pieces and serve.
name: crab and artichoke quicheingredients: shortening, all purpose flour, unbleached pastry flour, onion, canned artichoke hearts in water, large eggs, cream, dried dill weed, shredded cocktail crab meat, parsley flakespreparation:Combine flours. Cut in shortening with pastry blender. Add onion and water. Knead into a ball. Roll out to 1/8 inch thickness. Fold dough in half. Cut into 5 inch squares. Bake 10 minutes at 400f. Arrange artichokes on each square. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10 minutes. Sprinkle with dill. Bake until crust is golden brown. Cool slightly. Spread with

Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick pan. Add the onion, and cook for 1 minute. Add the couscous, stirring well to coat the grains. Add the chicken stock. Bring to the boil. Cover, remove from the heat and leave to stand for 5 minutes. Add the zucchini, basil leaves and feta cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Serve immediately.
name: fennel-zucchini soupingredients: water, onion, fennel bulb, tomato paste, zucchini, canned tomatoes, celery stalk, basil leaves, dried thyme, canola oil, salt & pepper, sour creampreparation:In a large saucepan, heat oil. Add onion, fennel bulb and tomato paste. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add celery stalk, tomatoes, zucchini and thyme. Pour in enough water to cover all vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 20 to 2

Season both sides of the steaks generously with coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat olive oil over medium high heat in large cast-iron skillet. When oil is hot add butter and steaks and cook for 3 minutes on each side. Remove to plate and tent with foil. Add onions and mushrooms to skillet and saute until onions are translucent and mushrooms have given off their moisture. Add garlic and saute for another minute. Add the balsamic vinegar and cook until it has thickened slightly. Remove the steaks from foil and place them over the mushrooms and onions. Pour the balsamic mixture over the steaks and top with parsley. Serve.
The flat-iron steak is the newest addition to the grilling menu. In fact, it was only in 2003 that this cut became commercially available. The Flat Iron Steak is taken from the shoulder of the beef animal and is also known as the top blade. The shoulder is not one of the more tender areas of the animal, but the flat-iron ste

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Transfer to a blender container. Add remaining ingredients in a blender container with the balsamic mixture. Puree until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl or jar with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 week before using.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook 1 minute. Add milk in a steady stream until sauce is smooth and thickened. Add dried beef and stir until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in pepper. Serve over toast.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook broccoli, onion and bell peppers 4-6 minutes or until onion is tender stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. In a small bowl mix together bisquick, milk, salt and pepper. Add to vegetables and stir gently until mixed well. Let cool slightly. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spoon mixture into a 9 inch pie plate or pie dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and cool slightly before cutting and serving.

Cut potatoes in halves or thirds. Place in baking pan. Combine margarine and garlic salt, spread over potatoes. Sprinkle with parsley flakes. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Saut the onions in the butter. Add the flour and stir constantly until it is browned. Slowly stir in the chicken broth and half-and-half. Bring to a boil and stir for 1 minute. Add the dungeness crab meat and cook 3 minutes. Stir in the parsley. Serve immediately.

In a large non-stick skillet, brown the ground beef and onions in the olive oil till the meat is cooked through. Drain excess fat. Return meat mixture to the pan and stir in the recaito, sazon goya with coriander and annatto and adobo seasoning. Stir until well blended. Turn off heat. Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls. Fill each discos with one ball. Wrap each discos with one piece of bacon and secure with toothpicks. In a bowl, combine the hot sauce and oil. Brush the sauce mixture over the bacon-wrapped discos and bake in a 375 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or until the bacon is browned and the meat is cooked through. Serve warm.
Prepare rice as directed on package. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread in greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish. Bake uncovered at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until heated through.

Combine all ingredients except ketchup and brown sugar. Mix well. Add enough ketchup to make mixture hold together. Shape into oval balls about one inch thick. Brown in a skillet. Pour off any excess fat. Mix brown sugar and vinegar and pour over meatballs. Cover and simmer for about one-half hour. Stir occasionally. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large skillet brown pork over medium heat with paprika and salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Stuff taco shells with meat and sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted. Remove from oven and top with corn and cilantro. Squeeze fresh lime juice over top. Serve with your favorite salsa.

Place tuna steaks between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound thinly with a mallet or rolling pin. Combine 2 teaspoons wasabi powder, 2 teaspoons water and 1 teaspoon rice vinegar in a small bowl and set aside. Combine the remaining 2 teaspoons wasabi powder, the mayonnaise, garlic and soy sauce in a small bowl and set aside. Heat a grill or broiler. Rub tuna steaks with vegetable oil and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Brush the wasabi mixture onto both sides of each steak. Broil or grill the steaks 3 minutes on each side until almost cooked through. Spread the wasabi mayonnaise mixture over the tops of the steaks. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place 2 tablespoons of butter in a large casserole dish. Place the breasts in the dish. Salt and pepper the breasts lightly. Mix the remaining butter with the rosemary and sprinkle it over the breasts. Bake for 10 minutes per pound or until a thermometer reads 170 degrees. In a saucepan, boil the orange juice concentrate until reduced to 1/2 cup. Add the dry white wine to the pan and reduce by half. Add the mint sauce and pour over the chicken breasts. Garnish with chopped mint or parsley. Serve with rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease bottoms and sides of 12 paper-lined muffin cups. In a medium bowl combine the oats, milk and honey. In a separate bowl combine the oil, wheat flour, baking powder and soda. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and stir just until moistened. Spoon into prepared tins and bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove from pans and cool on a rack.
