Place carrots in a large saucepan. Add water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally for 8-10 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar until melted. Stir in cranberry sauce. Cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes or until glazed. Place carrots on a serving dish and pour sauce over top. Sprinkle with pecans if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Brown ground turkey in skillet. Add water and taco seasoning mix to skillet. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. While meat is cooking, open can of refried beans and heat in microwave for 1 minute. Heat whole wheat tortillas in microwave for 1 minute. Top tortillas with lettuce, olives, cheese, meat mixture, refried beans, guacamole or salsa as desired.
I found this recipe on the internet.
name: black white and red all over vegetarian tacosingredients: black beans, white corn, rotel, tortilla, sour creampreparation:Drain and rinse black beans. Drain corn and tomatoes. Mix beans, corn and tomatoes in pan and heat until heated throughout. Serve on tortillas with any additional toppings desired. Mixture can also be heated in microwave.
name: couscous tacosingredients: mexican-style stewed tomatoes, water, onion, taco seasoning

Wash and rinse rice in a bowl of cold water. Drain. In a medium saucepan, bring 1-1/2 cups water to a boil. Add rice and salt and cook over medium heat 12 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed. Stir in remaining 1 cup cold water and cook 5 minutes or until rice is tender and fluffy. Meanwhile, in a blender combine 2 cups water and lemongrass. Cover and process until smooth. Add verbena leaf. Blend just until combined. Pour through a fine-mesh strainer into a saucepandiscard solids. Add to cooked rice and stir to combine. Cover and let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

Fry onion in butter until tender. Add paprika and fry until fragrant. Add chicken pieces to pan and brown well on all sides. Add water to cover chicken by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Add sour cream to soup. Blend well. Add salt to taste. Make dumplings by stirring together flour and eggs in a bowl until smooth. Add milk to batter slowly to form a thick batter. Drop spoonfuls of batter into soup and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Butter an 8-inch square baking pan. Combine chocolate and butter in a large saucepan and cook over low heat until melted and smooth. Stir in sugar and coffee and cook until it forms a smooth sauce. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature. In a mixing bowl beat eggs and cream together until smooth. Add to chocolate mixture and blend until smooth and thick. Pour into prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 30-35 minutes. When cool dust with confectioners sugar and cut into 18 bars.

Combine first four ingredients in a bowl and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes until foamy. Mix in molasses and 1/2 cup honey and stir in enough remaining honey to make a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl and turn to grease top. Cover with a clean kitchen towel and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Punch dough down and divide in half. Shape each half into a ball and place in two greased 8x4x2-inch loaf pans. Let rise in a warm place for 45 to 60 minutes until doubled in bulk. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes until golden brown and done in centre. Remove from the oven and turn out on wire racks to cool completely.
Mix sugar and cinnamon. Spread on buttered side of each slice of bread. Bake at 400 for 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender but not browned. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the chopped spinach. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until wilted. Remove from heatdrain well. Place in a large bowllet cool for 10 minutes. Beat in the eggs, cottage cheese, cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese. Season with parsley, salt and pepper to taste. Mix together the biscuit and cream. Put mixture into a 20cm tin and spread evenly. Chill in the freezer for 30 minutes. Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl. Spread the melted chocolate over the base. Chill in the freezer for 30 minutes. Cut into slices. Store in the freezer.

In a large bowl whisk together the ricotta cheese, egg yolk, butter, flour, parsley, and parmesan cheese. Season the mixture with fresh ground pepper. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot, then add oil to cover bottom of skillet. Working in batches, drop batter by the large spoonful into pan, flattening each pancake slightly with the back of a spoon. Cook for 2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned on both sides. Repeat procedure until all of the batter has been cooked. Serve immediately or keep in warm oven until ready to serve. Makes 6 servings.
Cream together margarine, sugar and vanilla. Add water and mix well. Add dry ingredients and mix. Fold in the chocolate chips and the mashed bananas. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.

Spray a large baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Lay fish in the dish and sprinkle with salt-free lemon pepper. Mix together the apples and onion. Place on top of the fish and top with the lemon slices and tomatoes. Bake at 375 for one hour or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Sprinkle yeast over 1/3 cup warm water in medium bowllet stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. Combine flours, basil, oregano, salt in processoradd yeast mixture and remaining 1 1/3 cup waterprocess until dough forms ball that clears sides of bowl. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth, about 6 minutes. Transfer dough to lightly oiled bowlturn to coat both sides with oil. Cover tightly with plastic wraplet rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. Divide dough in halfform each half into a round 1/2-inch thick. Cut each round into 6 triangles. Place triangles on lightly greased baking sheetcover loosely with plastic wraplet rise until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake bread on center rack of oven until golden brown, about 15 minutestransfer to wire rack. Makes 12 servings.

Stir boiling water into gelatin in large bowl at least 2 minutes, or until completely dissolved. Stir in cold orange juice. Stir in ice cream until nice and smooth. Pour into a 5 cup mold or any glass dish or decorative bowl. Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm. Unmold.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add scallions and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add ginger and cook for 30 seconds. Add red pepper flakes and lime juice. Cook for 1-2 minutes more. Add tamari, honey and chicken. Cook for 2-3 minutes more. Serve warm with napa cabbage.

Beat the cream cheese with a mixer. Add the onion and the cucumber and mix well. Add the green food coloring and mix well. Refrigerate overnight for best results. Serve with crackers or vegetable dippers.

Place the oats into a large bowl, add the rest of the cooking water and the honey and stir well. Store at room temperature for 10 days or refrigerate for 3 weeks.

Cook the steel cut oats in the milk with the butter and the turbinado sugar. Add the tangerine peel, the dried tart cherries, the ground nutmeg, and the ground cinnamon. Cook for 30 minutes. Add salt to taste. Garnish with hazelnuts.

In a medium saucepan, saute the vegetables and seasonings until tender. Stir in the remaining ingredients and heat through. Serve hot. Makes about 5 servings.

Use a small sharp knife to cut off the top of the lemon. Slice off the white pith with the knife or small spoon. Scoop out the seeds from the lemon center with the knife or spoon. Cut the lemon into small pieces and place in a blender with the orange juice and the remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into a jar with a lid and refrigerate up to 1 week.

Mix butter and seasonings together. Cut shrimp in half if they are extra long. Thread shrimp and veggies on skewers. Spray with nonstick cooking spray. Grill for 3 minutes on each side or until pink. Serve with creole butter.

In a small bowl combine the dried thyme, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, coarse salt and pepper to taste. Rub over both sides of each lamb chop and place in a plastic bag. Let marinate for 1 hour. Preheat a large skillet or sauté pan over medium-high heat and add 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil. Sear chops for 3 minutes per side and then transfer to a plate. Reduce heat to medium and add the remaining 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive oil to the pan along with the arugula and garlic. Cook until arugula is wilted and garlic is fragrant. Add the red wine vinegar and 1 teaspoon of water. Simmer over medium-low heat for 1 minute and then add back in the lamb chops and cook for another 1-2 minutes to finish cooking. Serve immediately.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add 4 cups of pasta to the boiling water and let cook for 8-10 minutes. In the meantime, mix the tomato sauce and the tomato paste. Add the basil, oregano and the garlic salt. Pour the mixture into the pasta. Cook on high heat. Then serve and enjoy.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain well. Turn into slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients. Stir. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours.
Cook the rice in the microwave. Dice the chicken and stir-fry it with the peas, almonds and sauce. Serve over the cooked rice.

In a 13x9 baking dish place chicken pieces. Sprinkle both sides of chicken with seasonings and pat to coat. Heat olive oil in a 10 inch skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion to skillet. Cook and stir until onion is tender. Drain off fat. Spread onion mixture over top of chicken. Drizzle with 1/2 of the melted butter. Cover dish with foil. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover dish. Bake for 20 more minutes. Drizzle with remaining butter. Sprinkle with parsley if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Place rice in a large pot. Cover with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower heat to medium-low and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until water has been absorbed. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and sugar. Serve warm.

In a shallow bowl mix together the dry sherry and egg white. Then dip each piece of chicken in the egg white mixture and roll in the cornflour. Heat the oil in a large wok or saute pan and stir-fry the chicken over a high heat for 5 minutes or until brown on the outside. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Add the spring onions and green pepper to the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Add the bamboo shoots and soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the cashews and return the chicken to the pan. Cook for a further 2 minutes and serve immediately.

Heat oven to 400°F. Butter a shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, toss carrots with butter, gorgonzola cheese, salt and pepper until evenly coated. Spread into prepared dish and bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until tender.

Thaw nibbles according to package directions. Place on baking sheet. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowl. Mix well. Pour mixture over nibbles. Bake for 20 minutes or until nibbles are golden brown and heated through. Serve warm. Makes about 2 dozen nibbles.

Brown meat and drain fat. Add cream of celery soup and milk. Add seasoning and vegetables and bring to a boil. Pour into casserole dish and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Topping-2 sticks of butter, 2 cups flour and 1/2 cup milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Spread over meat mixture and bake 15 minutes longer.

Blanche broccoli in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Drain and chop coarsely. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, then add broccoli and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add chili and cook for 30 seconds longer. Drain the pasta and return to pot. Add the remaining oil, anchovy fillets and butter and stir until butter is melted. Add broccoli mixture and toss to combine. Divide between 2 serving plates and sprinkle each portion with 2 teaspoons Parmigiano Reggiano and a drizzle more oil. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the ground red salmon with the oats, ricotta cheese, egg whites, chives, dill and cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the fish mixture into 12 equal portions, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Shape each portion into a ball and flatten into a 1/4 inch thick patty using your hands. Place the fish cakes in a baking dish and bake until they are firm to the touch and golden brown, about 15 to 20 minutes. Serve immediately with tartar sauce, if desired.

Melt butter in a saucepan. In a large bowl stir together tapioca starch, self-rising flour, baking powder, sugar, salt, milk, and egg until well blended. Pour butter into the mixture in the bowl and stir with a fork until well blended. Pour the mixture in the saucepan and stir constantly over medium-high heat for 3 to 4 minutes until it thickens. Add the grated cheese to the mixture in the saucepan and stir constantly for 1 minute until the mixture begins to bubble and thicken. Turn off the heat and add the parsley and 1 tablespoon of butter to the mixture in the saucepan and stir until well blended. Pour the mixture into 8 greased muffin cups or paper cupcake liners and bake at 375 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown on top. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove the bread from the muffin cups or paper cups with the paper liner on top. Serve warm with extra butter if desired

In a bowl combine the first six ingredientscut in the butteradd the sugar graduallybeat in the vanilla extractadd the eggmix welladd the applesmix wellspoon into a 9x5x3 loaf pansprinkle with the walnutsbake in a preheated oven at 325 for 1 hour or until the loaf tests done. Remove from the pan to coolwrap the loaf tightly to store it.

Preheat oven to 425f. Lightly oil 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. Combine the flour, sugar, salt and cinnamonset aside. Beat egg with oil and vanilla until smooth. Stir into the dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in the peaches. Fill each cup to 2/3 full. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until tops are golden and spring back when lightly pressed with a finger. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt butter and garlic in a small skillet or sauce pan over medium heat until fragrant. Add heavy cream and bring to a boil. Slowly add flour and stir constantly until thickened. Stir in Parmesan and fontina cheese and cook until melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with favorite pasta.
Beat eggs and milk with sugar. Add all other ingredients. Beat until fluffy. Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees until well-browned. Serve hot.

Peel ginger and grind to a fine powder. Place the ginger in a bowl. Grate the onion and add to the bowl. Add the chilli-garlic sauce, fish sauce, lime zest, lime juice, brown sugar, ground coriander and cumin. Mix well. Store in a glass jar with a tight lid. This will last for 3-4 months.

Prepare 11-inch graham cracker crust. In large mixing bowl, combine milk and marshmallows. Beat until well blended. Add cream and mix well. Fold in chocolate and nuts. Spread in crust. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Store leftover pie in refrigerator.

Toss lettuce in a large bowl. Combine next 6 ingredients in a small bowl with a wire whiskadd to lettuce mixture and toss gently. Top with chives. Serve immediately.

Brush both sides with olive oil and place in oven until slightly toasted. Remove and spread with the artichoke mixture. Top with grated parmesan cheese and bake until melted. Makes about 10 slices.

In a small bowl, combine the peanut butter and golden syrup and mix well until combined. Pour into a small saucepan and place over a medium heat. Stir continuously until melted and well combined. Remove from heat and set aside to cool slightly.In a medium saucepan, bring the cream and milk to the boil over a medium heat. Remove from the heat and add the peanut butter mixture and the chopped toffee pieces. Stir well and return to the heat to warm through. Divide the ice cream between two bowls and top with the hot fudge sauce and sprinkle with the salted peanuts to serve.
Spread icing on inside of martini glass and sprinkle with candy sprinkles. In cocktail shaker add vanilla vodka, cranberry juice and champagne. Shake and pour into glass. Garnish glass with cherry.
Place first 4 ingredients in large bowl. Drain. Add rice vinegar, sugar, dill and salt. Mix well. Serve at room temperature. Yield is estimated.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain well. Melt 2Tbs butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour until blended. Gradually add milk to form a smooth sauce. Stir in mustard. Stir in lemon juice. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. Add tuna, macaroni, pepper, salt. Pour into 2-qt. Casseroles. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned.

Mix together almond oil with the almonds. Heat sugar and water to a boil. Add the almond oil/almond mixture to the boiling sugar mixture. When mixture reaches soft ball stage, pour onto a greased cookie sheet. Spread mixture out and let cool to room temperature. Break into pieces and store in airtight container.

Saute onion with thyme leaves in ham fat until tender. Stir in tomato paste to onion mixture. Mix together uncooked rice and pigeon peas in the watercook in cooking oil until pigeon peas are tender. Stir in thyme oil mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 425. Grease 12 muffin cups. In a medium bowl combine bran, sugar, cinnamon, and raisins. Stir in milk and apple juice concentrate. In a large bowl combine baking powder, flour, and oat bran. Stir in egg whites. Stir in liquid mixture. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Sprinkle with apple slices. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine the meatballs, soup, milk and nutmeg in a large skillet. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 15 minute. Stir in the sour cream, cover and heat for 2 or 3 minute more. Sprinkle with parsley if desired and serve warm.

Bring 4 cups water to boil. Stir in saffron threads and saltremove from heat. Stir in brown rice and brothcover tightly. Bring to boilreduce heat to low. Simmer 45 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in butter and parmesan cheese.

Slice the bread lengthwise, creating two halves. Spread each slice with butter. Add chopped parsley and fresh garlic. Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with romano cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Place on a baking sheet and place under broiler until lightly browned on top. Sprinkle with brie cheese. Add remaining slices of bread on top and place under broiler until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Sprinkle pork with jerk seasoning. Cook until browned. Stir in mango, red bell pepper and orange juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer until pork is tender. Stir in the corn starch to thicken. Pour over rice. Garnish with green onion.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine milk, flour, and butter in saucepan. Bring to boil. Add milk, flour and butter mixture to tomatoes. Add onions and cook until thickened. Add salt and pepper and mix well. Drop by spoonfuls into greased muffin tins. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with melted butter.

Cream together butter, crunchy peanut butter, sugars, and egg until smooth. Stir in flour and baking soda until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until light brown. Remove from baking sheets and cool on wire rack. Drizzle with chocolate frosting or top with a dollop of whipped cream. Yield 5 dozen

Combine dry ingredients in bowl. Cut lard into dry ingredients with pastry blender or fork. Add beaten egg. Add cold water a teaspoon at a time until it forms a dough. Roll out onto wax paper to a 12 inch circle. Place in pie pan. Fill with whatever filling you like. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Then lower to 325 degrees and bake for 30 more minutes.

Beat the margarine and mayonnaise together in a bowl until light and creamy. Add the sugar and beat until light and creamy. Add the egg and beat well. Sift together the flour and baking soda and stir into the mixture. Wrap the dough in plastic and chill overnight. Roll out and cut with a cookie cutter or spoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cut the chicken into cubes. Place in a foil lined baking pan. Add the onion soup mix and hot water. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool slightly. Combine the dressing and add to the hot chicken. Stir in the fruits and serve over rice.

Make the fudge brownie mix according to the package directions. In a small bowl combine the peanut butter with the powdered sugar until smooth. Cream together the butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Stir in the egg and vanilla extract until smooth. Beat until smooth and creamy. Stir in the creamy peanut butter mixture until smooth. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto parchment paper lined baking sheets. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until just set. Cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheets before moving to a wire rack to cool completely. Frost when completely cool.

Place grapes in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Measure puree into a small saucepan with 1/2 cup water. Bring to a boil, then cook over medium-low heat until thickened. Stir in 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Cool in refrigerator. Whip whipped cream to stiff peaks with 1 teaspoon lemon juice. Fold in black grape puree and the remaining 2 tablespoons lemon juice until just combined. Serve in dessert bowls or wine glasses. Top with whipped cream and a few grapes.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients together. Place in a sealed container in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 days. Keeps refrigerated for 1 week. Makes a great side dish with grilled meats.

Cut meat into 1/2" strips. Saute with vegetables and seasoning. Add tomato mixture and seasoning. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over rice.

Combine fat-free miracle whip with sugar in a large bowl. Mix well with electric beater until sugar is dissolved. Add cabbage, carrot and onion mixture and toss well. Cover and chill at least 2 hours, preferably over night, before serving.

In a saucepan over low heat, stir together the cheese and salsa. Cook and stir until thoroughly blended. Add the milk and stir until thoroughly combined. Stir in the cilantro and the rest of the seasoning. Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and bubbly. Serve immediately. Serve with tortilla chips.

Remove the beards from the oysters and discard the top shell. Spread the bottom shell with the melted butter. In a small bowl mix the crushed garlic with the salt and pepper. Sprinkle the oysters with the garlic mixture. Put the oysters on the broiler and cook until the edges curl about 30 to 45 seconds, turning once or twice to make sure both sides are cooked evenly. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley. Serve immediately.

Place the sweet potatoes in a large saucepan with cold water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook the sweet potatoes until tender. Drain the water. Add butter, salt, pepper, ginger, cinnamon, cayenne, brown sugar, and raisins. Mash with a fork. Serve hot.

Heat butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in broth, mustard, parsley, cumin and salt. Bring to a boil. Add cherry tomatoes. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in parsley. Serve warm.

Boil the potatoes and mash them. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the meat and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, or until the meat is no longer pink. Add the tomato paste and stir well. Add the broth, bring to a boil, then turn the heat down to low. Cover the skillet and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through. Remove from the heat and stir in the potato mixture. Stir well to combine. Season with pepper to taste. Transfer to a shallow serving dish. Sprinkle the top of the potatoes with the cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the cheese is golden. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut bread in half lengthwise and place cut side up. Spread half of the butter over the bread halves and sprinkle half the walnuts over the bread halves. Bake bread halves for 10 minutes or until golden brown and walnuts are toasted and fragrant. Remove bread from oven and sprinkle pear slices and brie cheese over bread halves. Return bread halves to oven for 5-7 more minutes or until cheese is melted and pears are softened. Serve immediately.

To make one, pour lemon juice and sugar in a cocktail shaker half-filled with cracked ice cubes. Shake vigorously until sugar is dissolved and liquid is frothy. Strain through a strainer into a cocktail glass. Top off with cognac and a splash of triple sec. Garnish with a cherry and serve.
Mix goat cheese and mayonnaise. Season with lemon zest. Form into patties. Cook on grill or skillet for 4-5 minutes per side. Top with roasted peppers and arugula. Serve on whole wheat buns.

Cook macaroni in water and drain. Melt butter in a pan and add cheese and stir until melted. In a large bowl, beat eggs and add milk and mustard and mix well. Add macaroni and cheese and stir well. Add tuna and stir well. Season with fine salt and paprika and capsicums. Place in a greased baking dish and bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes.
peel yams, cut into cubes. place yams into a large pan. add all remaining ingredients. stir well. cook on medium heat for 10 minutes or until done. serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and baking powder. Add the butter and mix well. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the peanut butter and grape jelly. Spread the mixture over the crust. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

Heat oven to 350. Butter 3 custard cups. Peel and dice yellow squash. Heat 2 tablespoons butter over moderate heat in heavy large skillet. Add diced yellow squash and saute until tender and lightly browned. Transfer to small bowl. Reserve. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in same skillet. Add flour and cook until lightly browned. Beat in sugar and cook until sugar is dissolved. Add eggs 1 at a time and stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Stir in squash and heat until just warm. Divide mixture among custard cups. Combine sugar and 2 tablespoons water in small saucepan and cook over moderate heat until sugar dissolves. Stir in evaporated milk and heat until hot. Divide among custard cups. Sprinkle with nutmeg.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease 8x8x2-inch baking pan. In large bowl combine bacon fat and cornbread mix. In medium bowl combine sour cream, milk, eggs and bacon bits. Add to cornbread mix. Add frozen corn. Stir until well blended. Pour into greased baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 30-40 minutes or until toothpick inserted 2 inches from edge comes out clean.

In a bowl combine pineapple chunks, orange juice and ginger. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Chop walnuts coarsely. Fold in blueberries and strawberries. Serve with coconut in small bowl on the side.

Fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon with slotted spoon and set aside. Discard all but 2 tablespoons bacon drippings. Saute the onion and garlic in hot drippings until the onion is tender. Stir in remaining bacon drippings. Stir in spaghetti sauce and cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in cooked pasta. Serve hot. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 400. Heat olive oil in a small saut pan. Add parsley, chives and basil and saute 1-2 minutes. Set aside. In another pan heat butter until melted. Add breadcrumbs and stir until golden brown. Stir in herbs. Sprinkle breadcrumb mixture over the pizza dough. Bake 8-10 minutes until lightly golden. Top with fresh herbs. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Mix together the sauce ingredients. Pound chops to 1/2 inch thickness. Place in shallow baking pan. Pour sauce over chops. Bake in 350 degree oven for 45 minutes. Garnish with peaches and serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and salt. In another bowl, mix together the whipping cream, vegetable oil and honey. Beat in the eggs one at a time until the mixture is smooth. Stir in the dry mixture and pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish that has been coated with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Mix together mayonnaise, honey and curry powder until smooth and blended. Add vinegar and mix until smooth. Arrange vegetables in a decorative manner on a serving dish. Drizzle or spoon the mixture over vegetables. Garnish with parsley if desired.

For the crust: combine the butter, sugar and salt in a food processor or blender and process until the mixture is pale and smooth. Add the flour and process until the mixture is coarse. Divide the mixture in two parts and press each part into a 9-inch pie pan and press the sides together. For the filling: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl, combine the peaches, brandy, heavy cream and eggs and beat until smooth. Add the light brown sugar and spices and beat until smooth. Pour into the unbaked crust and bake for about 50 minutes or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Heat oil in a saut pan over medium heat. Add potatoes and saut until golden brown. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped parsley. Season with salt if desired.

Combine 2 cups cold water and cornstarch in heavy saucepan. Beat until smooth and add sugar, stirring until dissolved. Add berries and bring to boil over medium heat. Cook and stir 1 minute or until thick and clear. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin. Chill until thick enough to spread over the top of the cheesecake.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f (190 degrees c). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl combine the first six ingredients. In a smaller bowl combine the last five ingredientsbeat well. Stir the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients just until moistened. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Place breast between two pieces of wax paper. Pound to 1/4-inch thickness. Combine flour, salt, pepper. Dip breast into eggthen into crumbs. Saute in hot butter over med heat until lightly browned on both sides. Serve with parsley. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Beat together cream cheese, sour cream and powdered sugar with mixer until smooth and fluffy. Add vanilla and milk and beat until smooth. Chill for 4 hours or overnight. Remove from fridge and gently mix in whipped topping. Spoon onto sliced strawberries. Gently roll each one in graham cracker crumbs and serve immediately.

Blend egg substitute, spinach, milk, and 1/2 the cheese in large bowl until smooth. Heat oil in 10-inch skillet over medium heatcook green pepper, onion, mushrooms, and hot pepper sauce, stirring occasionally until vegetables are tender. Stir in egg mixture until well blendedcook, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Stir in bacon bits and remaining cheese. Spoon mixture into 12 (1/2-cup) muffin cupstop with bacon bits, if desired. Cool completely.

Seperate dough into 8 rectangles. Press perforations together and roll out to make square. Fold up corners and twist at top sealing any open edges. Spoon 1 rounded tbsp. cream cheese mixture into center of each square. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden brown. Serve 2 per serving.

In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and the sugar. Set aside. In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, whisk together the vanilla extract and the heavy whipping cream. Bring to a simmer. Add the whole milk and the dry tapioca and cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the vanilla extract mixture and the lemon zest and whisk well. Add the egg mixture and whisk well. Pour into six 6-oz ramekins and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Garnish with a piece of lemon zest if desired.
I have been looking for the recipe for the banana split sundae from the kitchen tour in 2003. Does anyone have it?

Slice mushrooms and leeks. Add to frying pan with butter. Fry until mushrooms are golden. Add cauliflower florets. Fry until tender. Add stock. Bring to boil. Blend. Add blue cheese. Melt in microwave. Add crumbled bacon. Serve with a crusty bread.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat. Add scallops to skillet and saute 2 minutes per side or until cooked through. Transfer to plate. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to skillet. Add white wine and cook 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Add parsley and garlic to skillet. Stir until fragrant. Add capellini and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt. Toss until coated. Divide pasta evenly between four plates. Top with scallops. Serve with lemon wedges.
name: baked scallopsingredients: bay leaves, onion, butter, oil, dry vermouth, white wine, scallops, freshly ground black pepper, fresh parsleypreparation:In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion, bay leaves, butter, and oil until tender. Add vermouth, wine, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in scallops. Cook until tender. Remove skillet from heat. Stir in parsley. Serve with rice
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Chill in the refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Brine chicken or turkey for 12 hours. Rinse and pat dry. Broil or pan fry as desired.

Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet. Add the onion and cook until golden. Add the chops and cook until browned and nearly done. Add the rice and stewed tomatoes. Heat through and serve.
tomato onion pork chops
pork skillet supper
italian ized pork chops
mushroom pork chops
tangy fruit chops
dutch pork chops
t s sweet and sour pork chops
pork chops with tomatoes and rice
Name of the dish:

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Roll out puff pastry to a 1/4 inch thicknesscut into 3x3 inch squares. Place 1 teaspoon blue cheese on half of the pastry squaresplace 1 pear slice on each squaretop with remaining pastry squaresseal edges with tines of fork. Sprinkle with sugarplace on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes or until puffed and golden brownserve warm or cool with a glass of wine.

Moisten the rims of cocktail glasses with lemon and dip in sugar. In a cocktail shaker, combine lemon juice, lime juice, grand marnier and powdered sugar. Add ice cubes. Shake. Fill glasses with mixture and top with guanabana nectar. Garnish with lime wedges. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil in a small pot. Add phyllo. Cook 2 minutes or until golden. Drain. Add butter. Place 2 sheets in a pie plate. Spread with a thin layer of ricotta. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup feta. Top with 2 sheets. Repeat layers. Pour in egg mixture. Bake at 400 for 35-40 minutes or until crust is golden. Let stand 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 8-10.

Cut the potato in half lengthwise, remove the flesh from the peel and reserve for another use. Lightly butter the cut side of the potato halves and bake at 400 degrees until tender. In a small skillet heat the butter over medium heat until foaming, add the shallot and saute until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until the liquid they released has evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add the bacon, stirring until crisp. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the topping between the two halves and serve.
The mushrooms are cooked in butter, with thyme and rosemary, topped with cheese and baked until the cheese is golden brown.
These are delicious! I made them as an appetizer for Thanksgiving and everyone loved them.
The breadcrumbs should be combined with the chopped mushrooms and onion as the filling for the caps.
I am so glad you tried these! I will make the correction to the recipe!
I made this recipe for my family last night for dinner,

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain. In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine all remaining ingredients. Stir until mixture thickens. Pour over the drained pasta. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese.

Mix together the dry ingredients in a large bowl and rub the butter into the mixture using your fingertips until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir the macadamia nuts and crystallized ginger into the mixture and make a well in the center. Whisk together the egg and lemon juice and add to the well. Bring the mixture together gently with your hands until it just holds together. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead the dough until smooth. Roll out the dough between two sheets of baking parchment paper until it is 1-inch thick and cut out with a 2 1/2-inch cutter. Place the scones on an ungreased baking tray and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until well risen and golden brown. Serve warm.

Cut off the top of the pepper. Carefully remove seeds and white membranes. Chop pepper into small pieces. In a medium bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, celery, worcestershire sauce. Add egg and breadcrumbs. Mix well. Fill each pepper half with mixture. Top with more breadcrumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for about 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Cook and drain the noodles. Set aside to cool. Beat eggs until light & fluffy. Combine with creamed margarine & sugar. Add vanilla & spices to mixture & stir well. Stir in the fruit & the drained noodles. Pour into a 9x13 baking dish & sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until lightly browned on top.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Roll into a ball and place in fridge. Take out of fridge 15 min. before serving. Roll in chopped nuts. Serve with crackers.
Coat chicken with flour. Dip in egg. Roll in bread crumbs and cheese. Fry in deep fat at 375 for 20 to 30 minutes.

In a small bowl, stir together strawberries, cornstarch, and sugar. Set aside. In a small bowl, mix the eggs and egg yolks with the salt. Set aside. In a medium heavy-bottomed pot, over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and stir with a whisk for about 1 minute. Add the milk all at once and whisk constantly until the mixture is thickened and bubbly. Remove the pot from the heat. Stir in the strawberry mixture and the egg mixture until well combined. Pour the custard into the pie shell. Sprinkle the bread cubes over the custard. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the custard is set and the bread is golden brown. Cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 F. Butter an 8-inch square baking pan and set aside. Peel squash and cut into cubes about 1 inch by 1 1/2 inches by 1/2 inch deep. In a small bowl combine spices and honey and stir to blend well. Pour half the mixture over squash and stir gently to mix with squash cubes. Set aside. Melt butter in 8-inch square pan and add squash cubes to pan. Stir to mix with melted butter and turn squash cubes to coat all sides with butter and spice mixture. Sprinkle with remaining spice mixture and stir gently to mix evenly. Cover baking pan with foil and bake for 1 1/2 hours or until squash is tender when poked with fork. Serve warm or refrigerate and serve cold. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Cook the chicken in a skillet on medium high heat with the taco seasoning until cooked through. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese & mayonnaise until well mixed & fluffy. Stir in the mexican blend cheese & jalapeno pepper. Spread 1/2 of the cream cheese mixture on the bottom of the baking dish. Arrange half of the tortilla strips on top of the cream cheese mixture. Add half of the cooked chicken on top of the tortilla strips. Top with the remaining cream cheese mixture & tortilla strips & chicken. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until bubbly. Sprinkle with the green chili peppers & hot sauce before serving if desired. Serves 8-10.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the cumin and stir until blended. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice. Preheat a gas grill to high heat. Place the corn in the center of the grate. Brush both sides of each ear with some of the spice mixture. Grill until nicely browned on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat and brush with more of the spice mixture. Serve sprinkled with additional cumin and salt and pepper.

In a shallow bowl whisk together the eggs, milk and 1/3 cup of the sugar. Combine the jam and the remaining 2 teaspoons of sugar in a small bowl. Dip the bread slices in the egg mixture and cook in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain on paper towels. Place 1/3 of the slices in the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with half of the jam mixture. Repeat with 2 more layers. In a small bowl, combine the 2 egg yolks and the water. Brush the mixture over the top and bake at 350° for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 minutes more or until light golden brown. Garnish with fresh fruit if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 inch (2 liter) baking pan. In a medium bowl combine the cornmeal and flourstir in the baking powder and salt. In a small bowl combine the eggs and milkstir into the flour mixture just until moistened. Pour into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oventhe bread will be firm and not browned at this point. Bake an additional 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before cutting.

In a large nonstick frying pan, heat olive oil on high heat. Add onion and yellow peppers. Cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic and thyme. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Add whipping cream. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 5-10 minutes. Add sugar and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine scallops with yellow sauce. Serve with crusty bread.
Mix together the carrots, sugar, lemon juice and rind and stir well to combine. Serve immediately.

In a large saute pan, heat oil over med-high heat. Saute wild rice with onion 2 minutes. Stir in chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered about 30 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and set aside. In a separate pan, melt butter over med-high heat. Add long grain rice, salt and stir. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered about 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and set aside. In a third saute pan, heat oil over med-high heat. Sear artichoke hearts for about 3-4 minutes per side. Reduce to med-low heat and add sweet red peppers. Cover and saute about 4-5 minutes or until peppers are tender. Serve rice with vegetables and top with artichokes, peppers and parmesan cheese.

We love rice dishes here. Thanks for the recipes!
I've

Mix sugar and butter until creamy. Beat in egg yolk and lemon rind. Sift dry ingredients together. Combine with liquids. Beat until smooth. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites. Drop on greased baking sheet by tablespoonfuls. Bake for 15 minutes in a 375 degree oven.
Prepare cake mix according to instructions. Add pumpkin mix. Add chocolate chips & walnuts. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Cool. Spread with frosting.

To make the egg mixture, whisk together the egg, milk, basil, salt, and pepper. To assemble, layer the croutons, cheese and egg mixture in the muffin cups until the cups are filled to the top. Bake for 30 minutes or until the muffins are brown on top, or the cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, combine all dry ingredients except chips. Set aside. In a large bowl, cream together butter & sugars until light & fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until thoroughly blended. Stir in vanilla. Blend in milk. Stir in dry ingredients just until moistened. Stir in chips. Spoon into lightly greased muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to cool completely on wire rack. Makes about 18 muffins.
This is a list of my favorite recipes that use chocolate chips! I love chocolate chip cookies but there are so many other ways to enjoy chocolate chips!
These are my favorite cookie recipe! I've always had them turn out perfect!
These are my favorite cookie recipe! I've always had them turn out perfect! And I love to add pecans!
These are my favorite cookies! I love them with pec

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place pine nuts in a small dry skillet and toast for 3 to 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Set aside. Toss brussel sprouts in olive oil and 1 tablespoon salt. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. Remove from oven. Add pine nuts to pan. Return to oven for 1 to 2 minutes to heat pine nuts. Serve immediately. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

Mix together all-purpose flour and baking powder. Cut in margarine and add egg and milk. Work quickly and combine well. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness on a floured surface and cut out with cookie cutters. Bake at 400 degrees f for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 36 snowflake scones.

In a medium saucepan combine the sugar and cornstarch and slowly add the boiling water. Stir until smooth. Add the orange concentrate and the butter and cook until the mixture is smooth and slightly thickened. Remove from the heat and cool to room temperature before using.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer cream the butter and cream cheese. Add the milk and almond extract and mix well. Add the flour and salt and mix well. Roll into a ball and refrigerate overnight. Roll out the dough and cut into circles with cookie cutters. Put about 1/2 teaspoon of pie filling into each circle and fold over and seal the edges. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes and let cool on racks.

Combine first 5 ingredients in 1 quart jar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add ginger and garlic powderstir well. Pour over chicken piecesturn to coat. Cover and refrigerate 6 hours or overnight, turning occasionally. Discard any remaining marinadedo not use on chicken. Grill chicken, basting occasionally with remaining apple juice mixture.

In a small pot combine lime zest, lime juice, water, sugar, ginger and serrano pepper. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat until thickened. Remove from heat and allow mixture to cool. Place honeydew melon in a blender with lime mixture. Blend until smooth. Serve with sliced fruit or fresh mint and figs on top.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Add rice and stir. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add broccoli. Remove from heat. Stir in cashews. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

In large zip-lock bag, place chops, soy sauce, vegetable oil, sherry wine, ginger, garlic powder, molasses. Seal bag. Marinate overnight. Grill or broil over medium heat until meat is medium rare. Serve with brown rice or whole wheat pasta.

Combine all the ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Pour into a large bowl and arrange the fruit in the center of the bowl and cover it with the dressing. Cover and chill for 1 to 2 hours before serving. Sprinkle the pine nuts and the mint leaf on top of the fruit just before serving.

In a large pan place sugar and water. Heat until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is boiling. Stir constantly until the mixture is a light caramel color. Cool until lukewarm. Add milk and almond extract. Stir until mixture is blended. Add the vanilla ice cream. Stir until the ice cream has melted. Chill thoroughly. Add the soda. Serve immediately.
Mix cottage cheese with orange juice and sugar. Add raisins and almonds. Add cardamom and extracts. Beat until smooth. Chill for 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift together first five ingredients. Add oil and egg yolks and beat til smooth. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until foamy. Add sugar and beat till stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into batter. Pour into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes. Cool on rack. Ice with chocolate icing.

In large bowl combine corn with cream cheese, sour cream and garlic. Add green onions and jalapenos. Chill for at least 2 hours. In 10-inch pie pan spread cream cheese mixture evenly. Sprinkle cheese over. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions and jalapenos. Bake for an additional 5 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat the oven to 200 c / gas 6. Roll out the pastry thinly to a 12 x 30 cm / 5 x 12 inch rectangle. Score a 3 cm / 1½ inch border all around the edges of the pastry. Prick the centre of the pastry with a fork. Bake for 10-12 minutes until light golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely. Beat the egg with the thyme leaves then brush over the base of the tartlets. Chop the goats cheese into small pieces then mix with the cranberry sauce. Spoon the mix evenly over the base of the tartlets then drizzle with a little extra virgin olive oil. Scatter the rocket leaves over the top of the tartlets then drizzle with a little more olive oil. Bake for a further 10-12 minutes or until the rocket is just wilted. Remove from the oven then leave to cool.

Combine eggs, sugar, syrup, butter, vanilla and salt in saucepan. Mix well over low heat until thickened. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until set. Cool on rack. Top with whole pecans before serving.

Season chops with salt and pepper and fry in a little olive oil until browned. In a small bowl, combine all the other ingredients and simmer about 15 minutes over med heat. Pour over chops and simmer until thickened and heated through. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat broiler. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add salt and paprika. Coat both sides of the salmon steaks with the butter mixture and place in a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil for 3 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with more paprika if desired. Serve with potato chips, lemon wedges and parsley sprigs if desired.
Mash potatoes and mix in the pilchards and the other ingredients. Shape into patties. Dip in beaten egg and breadcrumb. Fry in a little oil until golden. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a large pot, combine 1 cup broth, the chipotle and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is reduced by half and the mixture is thick. Add the broth mixture to the potatoes in a blenderpuree until smooth. Return the puree to the pan. Add the roasted cauliflower and the remaining 1 cup brothcook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Stir in the cheese. Yields 6 (1-cup) servings.

Slice carrots and onions. Brown roast in dutch oven. Drain fat. Add soup, water, green chilies and garlic. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cover. Simmer 1 1/2 hours or until beef is tender. Stir in black eyed peas and carrots. Simmer 1 hour more. Stir in paprika. Serve hot.

Peel and seed eggplants and cut into 2cm cubes. Mash the cubes lightly with the back of a fork to flatten them a little. Heat a little oil in a frying pan and add the red onions and cook for a few minutes till they start to soften. Add the cubes and the soy yogurt and cook for another 4 minutes till soft but not mushy. Add a little more oil if the pan is drying out. Add the bread crumbs and season with salt and pepper and mix together well. Put the mixture in a large bowl and let it cool a little then add the flour and mix again till you have a smooth mixture. Heat a little oil in a large frying pan and shape the mixture into patties and fry for 2-3 minutes a side till golden brown and cooked through. Drain on kitchen paper and serve with salad or a side dish.

Cut the potatoes into cubes and place them into a medium saucepan. Add the water and bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside. Heat the olive oil and butter buds in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender. Stir in the drained potatoes and the tomato. Stir the potatoes until the tomato is well distributed. Add the beans and the paprika. Stir. Serve hot.
Preheat oven 350 degrees. Combine ingredients in mixing bowl. Drop by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes.

Trim the ends off the snap peas and brussels sprouts. Set aside. In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, add butter. When melted add the orange bell pepper. Sautee for 3-4 minutes or until the pepper is tender. Add the snap peas and brussels sprouts. Sautee for an additional 3-4 minutes. Salt to taste. Serve immediately.

Dip chicken in beaten egg and then in mixture of flour and onion soup mix. Brown in margarine in a skillet. Place in a greased 9x13 inch pan with water to cover bottom of pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until no longer pink in the center.

In a large bowl, combine the cherry gelatin and boiling water. Stir until the mixture is dissolved. Add the cherry pie filling and stir. Refrigerate. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and marshmallows until smooth. Fold in the Dream Whip topping and spread over the refrigerated mixture. Refrigerate for one hour or until set. Garnish with maraschino cherries.

Saute the onion in the butter until tender. Add the cauliflower. Add the chicken broth and bouillon. Cook until tender. Mash the mixture with a potato masher. Stir in the milk. Add the chicken bouillon granules. Cook over low heat for about 15 minutes. Add the cornstarch mixed with the water. Cook until thickened. Add the cheese. Add the curry powder.
In 2-quart casserole dish, combine soup, milk and broccoli. Add turkey. Top with cheese. Melt butterstir in bread crumbs. Spread over cheese. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

In a small bowl whisk together vinegar, shallot and olive oil. Season dressing to taste. Mix greens, goat cheese and nuts in a large bowl. Top with dried cranberries and drizzle dressing on top. Toss to blend. Serve immediately.

Toss asparagus with extra virgin olive oil and minced garlic. Place on hot grill. Liberally season asparagus with salt and pepper. Grill until lightly charred and tender-crisp. Remove from grill and squeeze lemon juice onto asparagus. Garnish with lemon thyme leaves.
Asparagus with Lemon-Mustard Sauce. This recipe for Asparagus with Lemon-Mustard Sauce is absolutely divine.
Asparagus with Lemon-Mustard Sauce. A delicious side dish to serve with any meal.

Brown ground sirloin. Add 1 tbs of prepared yellow mustard. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Remove from heat. Add 1 tbs of prepared yellow mustard. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add 1 tbs of prepared yellow mustard. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add 1 tbs of prepared yellow mustard. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Serve on toasted english muffins. Top with butter. Salt and pepper to taste.
Brush both sides of the meat with the mixture of herbs de provence, salt and pepper. Grill over high heat, about 4 minutes per side. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until desired doneness.
Boil the potatoes until very tender. Mash with the rest of the ingredients in a large mixing bowl.

Boil and peel 12 medium eggs. Remove the yolks from the shells and mash them with a fork in a small mixing bowl. Stir in the mayonnaise, horseradish sauce and garlic powder until smooth and creamy. Taste and correct for seasoning with salt and black pepper and add the ground mustard. Place the filling in a pastry bag or a plastic bag with a corner snipped off. Pipe the filling back into the shells and garnish with a sprinkling of paprika. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.

Mix ground beef, onion and seasonings. Place in bottom of 2-quart casserole. Top with shredded cabbage. Mix together cream of mushroom soup, milk and frozen dinner rolls. Spread over cabbage. Bake 20 to 25 min.

Heat oven to 350° F. Spray 8x8-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine onion and next 5 ingredientsspoon into dish. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over the top. Bake until hot and bubbly, about 20 minutes. Serve warm with crackers or vegetables. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a baking pan. Cut chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces. Spread chicken and bacon over baking pan. Add potatoes and green beans. Drizzle on olive oil and sprinkle on salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes. Take out of oven and toss vegetables around. Serve on mixed salad greens and drizzle over dressing.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Salt the water generously. Cook the pasta according to package directions. Reserve a large skillet for the sauce. Heat the oven to 375°F. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add pine nuts and toast until golden brown, about 1 minuteset aside in a small bowl. Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Blanch the grapes in the boiling water for 20 secondsdrain. Drain the pasta when it is al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water and drain the pasta in a colander. Return the pasta to the pot. In the saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil and crushed red pepper flakes until the pepper flakes are fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 1 minute more. Add the grape tomatoes, salt, pepper and 2 tablespoons of the reserved pasta water. Toss to combinetaste the sauce for seasoning and adjust with additional salt

In a large saucepan, combine beans and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cover. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, thyme, and pepper. Cook for another 5-10 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in green onion. Serve immediately.

Put the sugar and the water into a large pan. Bring to the boil over a medium heat, stirring until all the sugar has dissolved. Reduce the heat to low and add the lemon zest, rind and juice. Bring to the boil again, then remove from the heat. Cut open the vanilla pod lengthways, scrape out the seeds into the pan, then add the pod to the pan and stir well. Beat the eggs with the cornflour in a bowl until well blended. Pour over the pan and stir well. Return the pan to the heat over a medium heat and stir constantly with a wooden spoon or heatproof spatula until the mixture thickens to coat the back of the spoon. Remove from the heat, stir in the lemon juice from the vanilla pod and then strain through a fine sieve into a large bowl. Cool completely, then chill for 1 hour before spooning into sterilised jars and sealing.

Wash and cut the hot dogs into three inch lengths. Warm the buns. In the bottom of each bun, place the hot dogs. Top each bun with the red onion and oregano. Add the Tabasco sauce to taste. Serve.

Cut the lemons into quarters. Cut 4 thin strips of rosemary. Place 1 strip of rosemary and 1 quarter of a lemon inside each salmon fillet. Season with coarse salt. Heat the olive oil and cook the salmon over a medium flame for 4-5 minutes on each side. Serve with the remaining lemon wedges and garnish with the remaining rosemary strips.

Prepare cake mix according to the directions on the box. Pour in a greased baking dish. Beat eggs in a separate bowl and add the water, oil, lemon extract and lemon peel. Blend well. Pour over the cake mix. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let the cake cool for a few minutes. Add the crushed pineapple and stir. Blend in the lemon pudding mix according to the instructions on the box. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Add the dream whip and stir gently until mixed well. Top with fresh fruit if desired.

Cut steak into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in wok or large skillet. Add steak. Saut until no longer pinkremove and set aside. Heat remaining oil in wok or skillet. Add garlicsaut until garlic is golden brown. Add remaining ingredients except steak. Heat until mixture is thickened. Stir in steak. Serve over hot white or brown rice.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In 13x9-inch baking dish, layer hash browns and bacon alternating layers. Sprinkle with green onions. Combine velveeta and mayo and pour over all. Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees f until bubbly and browned.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add flour and stir for about 2 minutes until mixture is thick and starts to turn golden brown. Slowly add milk while stirring constantly. Continue to cook until mixture thickens and forms into a paste-like texture. Stir in eggs and cook until thickened again. Add corn and cook for another minute. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a medium bowl, combine corn mixture with sausage and eggs. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan and bake in preheated oven for 40 minutes or until lightly browned and crust is golden.

Mix together pie filling, sugar and butter. Add cake mix. Grease and lightly flour two loaf pans. Pour batter into pans. Bake in 350 degree preheated oven for one hour. Cool. Frost with cream cheese frosting. Top with toasted pecans.

In a small saucepan combine orange juice, brown sugar, orange rind and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture is clear. In a large skillet melt butter. Add peas and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in orange mixture. Cook until heated through.

I like them in a salad. I prefer them raw.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add the flour and stir over medium heat until well blended. Add the milk slowly and whisk until smooth. Add the nutmeg and season with salt and pepper.
Pinocchio (Italian: ) is an Italian children's novel written by Carlo Collodi. It is about the mischievous adventures of Pinocchio, an animated marionette. It was originally an unpublished serial that was later revised and expanded as a novel for children. It is a classic of Italian literature and one of the most translated non-religious books in the world. The first half was originally serialized in the magazine Giornale dei bambini (The Children's Magazine) from 1881 to 1882. The complete novel was published in book form in 1883. The story has had no end of adaptations in every medium, from a Walt Disney film to commonplace blue fairy tattoos.
Pinocchio is the most famous work by Collodi. However, his earlier novel, The Adventures of Master Rigolo and Other Stories, was very popular in its day and has

Preheat oven to 375. Rub the chicken breast fillets with the shallots and garlic. Place the chicken in a baking dish and bake 30 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a small frying pan over medium heat. Add the olives and the fresh thyme and saute until the olives are warmed through. Remove the chicken from the oven and sprinkle with the olives and thyme mixture. Drizzle with the vinegar and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400°f. Place the fillets in a 2-quart shallow baking dish. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowlspoon over fillets. Bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Yields 4 servings.

Boil potatoes for 15-20 minutes or until tender. Cut in half lengthwise then into cubes. Place in casserole with mushroom soup, milk, heavy cream and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Bake 30-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in cream and bacon just before serving. Sprinkle with chives to serve.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add cream and cheeses. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened. Stir in oregano and basil, season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately over favorite pasta.
Name: Fettuccine Alfredo
Name: Fettuccine Alfredo Ingredients: Fettuccine pasta, Flour, Parmesan cheese, Butter, Light cream, Milk, Salt, Parsley Preparation: Melt butter over low heat in large saucepan. Add flour, heat until bubbly. Add milk and light cream. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add cheese, salt and parsley. Toss with fettucine.
Name: Quick 'n Tasty Alfredo Sauce
Name: Quick 'n Tasty Alfredo Sauce Ingredients: Sour cream, Parmesan cheese, Butter, Cracked Pepper Preparation: Melt butter in saucepan and add sour cream slowly,

Melt chocolate and butter in saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat, add vanilla and beat well. Set aside to cool. Beat eggs, add sugar and beat well. Stir in melted chocolate mixture and vanilla. Sift together the flour and salt and add to the egg mixture and beat well. Spread batter into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for 25 minutes. Sprinkle the chocolate chips over top and bake an additional 5 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

The Best Chicken Stuffed Bread!

The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Two!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Three!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Four!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Five!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Six!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Seven!
The Best Meal You Will Ever Make! Part Eight!

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. In a bowl, mix oats with cinnamon and brown sugar. In a large skillet, melt butter and heat until bubbly and slightly browned, about 1 minute. Add oat mixture and stir until completely coated. Press half of mixture into bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake until golden and crispy, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool. Top with layer of frozen whipped topping and sliced peaches. Spread with remaining oat mixture and top with a scoop of vanilla ice cream if desired.

Finely chop savoy cabbage and carrot. Combine with dried fruit and toss in mayonnaise. Season with sugar and cider vinegar. Sprinkle with chopped red cabbage for garnish.
