Cook the pasta according to package directions. Cook the spinach according to package directions, but remove from heat after 3 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess liquid. In a 3-quart baking dish, layer 1 cup of the pasta sauce, half of the pasta and 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers and top with remaining sauce and remaining mozzarella. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until mozzarella is melted and pasta is heated through. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella and parmesan and bake 1 minute longer or until melted. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 6 to 8.

Boil milk in a pan till it becomes half. Add vermicelli to the milk in pan, keep stirring until the vermicelli becomes soft. Now add sugar, cardamom powder and raisins to the vermicelli in the pan. Take out the vermicelli into a bowl, add ghee and honey to the vermicelli, stir well. Pour it into a plate or bowl, sprinkle sliced almonds over the vermicelli. Garnish with rose petals if available.
Peel and slice potatoes. Boil them for 20 minutes or until softened. Mash with a potato masher or electric mixer. Add garlic, salt, cream and parmesan cheese to the mash and serve immediately.

Make a paste of the chiles, gingerroot and garlic. Place the shrimp in a large mixing bowl and add the paste. Add the basil leaves and toss. In a small saute pan melt the butter. Add the shrimp and toss to coat. Skewer and broil for 2 minutes per side or until pink. Serve with lemon wedge.

Place brisket in crockpot with barbecue sauce, onions and garlic. Cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Remove brisket from crockpot. Slice thinly against grain. Heat buns in oven. Serve brisket with topping of choice.

Combine all the above and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours. I put mine in plastic bags and lay them out flat on a cookie sheet. When ready to use heat 1/2 inch of vegetable oil in the bottom of a frying pan over med high heat. Place the pork strips in the pan and cook until golden brown.
Mix together all of the above ingredients for a perfect, delicious crumb crust. Press into a 9-inch pie plate or other baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 5 minutes or until lightly browned.
Combine milk, sugar and dates in heavy saucepan. Boil until reduced to 1/2. Add nuts and butter. Beat until creamy. Drop on wax paper lined cookie sheet. When cool store in airtight container.

Pat scallops dry. Season with a little salt and pepper. In a medium skillet with high sides over medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Add scallops. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size, until cooked through. Transfer to warm plates. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to pan. Add shallots. Cook for 2 minutes or until browned. Add lemon juice. Taste and add additional salt or pepper if needed. Drizzle over scallops. Garnish with parsley.
Pour the carbonated lemon-lime beverage and the liquor in a tall glass over ice cubes. Skewer a lime wedge and one or two raspberries on the toothpick and garnish with it.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, dissolve gelatin in water. Stir in honeydew, lemon juice, and half of the melon ball. Cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, beat cream until it forms soft peaks. Fold in gelatin mixture. Chill in refrigerator. Garnish with melon ball and whipped cream.

Cut loin into 1 inch cubes. Combine 1 tsp of the ginger and 1/4 tsp of the salt with 1/2 cup of the water and set aside for 15 minutes to make a marinade. Add the remaining ginger and the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons of the salt to the cubes and marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature. Rinse cubes, add the prunes to the cubes, and toss to coat the prunes. Sprinkle the cubes evenly onto a broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil 6 inches from the heat for 20 to 25 minutes, turning occasionally until browned on all sides and a meat thermometer reads 160 degrees. Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1/2 cup of the prune juice with the flour to make a smooth paste. Add the remaining 1 1/4 cups of the water and the red currant jelly and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 2 minutes or until thickened slightly. Pour the mixture over the prunes and serve over the pork

In a large bowl mix together water and seasoned bread crumbs. Add parsley. Drain lemon juice from lemons. Add lemon juice. Add melted butter. Mix well. Dip shrimp in the mixture. Place in a well oiled baking pan. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with romano cheese. Bake for 5 more minutes.

Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add leekscook 5 minutes or until tender. Add water and brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover, simmer 20 minutes or until polenta is tender. Remove bay leaf. Stir in polenta and cheese. Serve immediately. Serve with butter or a salad.

Cut into strips and remove bone from chicken breast fillet. In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add half of chicken strips. Cook until no longer pink in the center. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining strips. Add peanut butter, soy sauce and water. Cook over low heat until well combined. Serve with chicken strips and sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired.

Mix all ingredients together except bacon. Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat. Spread out bacon evenly on pan. Cook until bacon is almost crisp. Remove bacon to paper towel covered plate to drain. Pour egg mixture into frying pan. Let cook until cake has set in the middle. Serve with bacon, dill and chives on top.
name: rich pancakes and wafflesingredients: eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, salt, butter, vanilla, nutmegpreparation: Seperate eggs and beat whites till fluffy but not dry, set aside. Mix all dry ingredients together, set aside. Beat yolks and milk. Slowly add dry ingredients beat till smooth. Mix in melted butter. Do not overbeat. Fold in egg whites. Cook over medium heat till golden.
name: norwegian scrambled eggs with smoked salmon and potatoesingredients: eggs, potatoes, onion, white pepper, butter, smoked salmon, fresh dill, milk,

Drain the tuna from the water and place in a medium size mixing bowl. Stir in the pepper, lemon juice and mustard. Stir in the salt, if desired. Add the whipped cream cheese until well blended and spreadable. Toast the hamburger buns. Spread each bottom half with cream cheese, top with a generous amount of tuna mixture. Top each with a slice of cheddar cheese. Place sandwiches on a cookie sheet. Placing rack not too close to the broiler, broil sandwiches until the cheese is golden brown. Remove from oven and serve hot on top of the bun.
In a large bowl, combine tuna, celery, onion, cheese, olives, mayo and pepper. Divide tuna mixture evenly among 4 buns. Wrap sandwiches loosely in aluminum foil. Place on baking sheet. Bake 15-20 minutes or until heated through.
Drain the tuna from the water and place in a medium size mixing bowl. Stir in the pepper, lemon juice and
In a large bowl combine cooked beef, broccoli, green onion, artichoke hearts and mayonnaise. Mix together well. Add cherry tomatoes. Serve on a bed of chicken rice-a-roni.

Melt the chips and butter over a low heat in a heavy saucepan stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Add the rest of the ingredients and continue stirring over low heat until smooth. Serve hot over ice cream or cake.

Heat butter in skillet. Add onions and saute until tender. Add fish and season with lemon pepper seasoning, garlic salt and parsley flakes. Add lemon juice and orange juice and cook about 4-5 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve.

Follow directions on the box to prepare the gelatin. Stir in pineapple, pecans and cool whip. Spoon into a 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Chill until set. Carefully remove from the dish before cutting into squares.

In a large bowl, combine chicken, stuffing mix and cheese. Beat in the egg and ketchup until well blended. Form into a loaf shape and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight to let flavors meld. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Unwrap the chicken loaf and place in the pan. Brown for 20 minutes on each side. Serve hot with leftover stuffing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. To make the filling, beat yogurt, pumpkin puree, dark brown sugar, cinnamon, ground cloves and nutmeg in a large bowl with a hand mixer until smooth. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the salt. Pour filling into pastry shell. Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set in the center and the edges of the filling are lightly browned, about 1 hour and 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack to room temperature. To make the topping, stir together the granulated sugar and the ground ginger in a small bowl. Cut the pie into wedges, and serve each slice with a little of the ginger topping.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine apple juice, cornstarch and brown sugar. Bring to a boil. Add cinnamon. Stir until thickened. Remove from heat. Add applestoss to coat. Let cool & spoon over ice cream or pound cake.
Shake all ingredients in a blender until smooth and serve. Garnish with an orange slice.

In a large bowl, combine the lemon juice and salt. Add the oil slowly and whisk in. Add the parsley and cheese and mix well. Cover and chill for 1 hour. Recipe can be doubled or tripled. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Line 8 x 8 pan with wax paper. Combine chips and frosting. Spread evenly into pan. Sprinkle with marshmallows and nuts. Refrigerate.
Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Add remaining ingredients to a large bowl. Toss to coat. Serve with pecorino romano cheese.

Combine all the ingredients except the roast in a slow cooker. Turn slow cooker on high. Place roast into pressure cooker. Pressure cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Let pressure release naturally. Serve over rice.
 chicken a la kingingredients: chicken, chicken broth, diced green pepper, diced celery, diced onion, sliced mushrooms, milk, cornstarch, fresh parsleypreparation:Heat chicken broth over low heat. Add chicken, celery, green pepper, onions and mushrooms. Cook over low heat for about 45 minutes. Remove chicken to a plate. Add cornstarch and milk to the remaining chicken stock. Heat until thickened. Add to the chicken mixture. Top with fresh parsley. Serve over white rice.

Dissolve raspberry gelatin powder in hot water. Add cold water and stir until dissolved. Add cranberry sauce and stir well. Refrigerate until firm. Fold in crushed pineapple, cool whip and cream cheese. Refrigerate until set. Chill. Garnish with walnuts and celery.

Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Combine the sugar, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, peanut butter and shortening. Gradually add the dry ingredients until blended. Chill dough for 1 hour. Roll into balls and dip in the confectioners' sugar. Place on wax paper. Chill for 30 minutes or until firm. Remove from wax paper before baking. Bake at 375 degrees for 7-10 minutes or until light brown. Cool on wire rack. Makes about 12 dozen
Cook whole wheat pasta according to package directions. Drain. Toss pasta with remaining ingredients. Serve.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu and cook until browned on each side. Remove tofu from pan and set aside. Add green onions to pan. Saute until wilted. Add remaining ingredients to pan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until asparagus is tender but still crisp-tender. Add tofu and toss gently to coat with sauce. Serve on rice or noodles if desired.

Prepare noodles as directed on package. Cut cooked noodles into small pieces and set aside. In a large saucepan combine the milk and water. Add corn, noodles, curry powder, dried onion flakes, cheese, and cooked bacon (if desired). Simmer 15 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.
Prepare 2 cups of oats according to package directions. Add lemon curd and ginger snap cookies. Stir together. Serve with whole milk.

Slice the potatoes 3/8 inch thick. Coat both sides of the slices with olive oil. Sprinkle with parmesan and the remaining ingredients. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F. Remove from the oven and stir. Bake for an additional 30 minutes or until crisp and golden.

Heat oven to 450. Spray a 12-inch pizza pan with olive oil. Place tortillas in pan. Sprinkle with half of the mozzarella. Top with half the cheddar. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Spread with a quarter of the salsa. Top with remaining mozzarella, remaining cheddar and remaining salsa. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with lettuce and low-fat sour cream.
Sometimes there are only so many things you can do with the same old ingredients. The following are a few of my favorite recipes that I've found during my weight watchers journey.
I love Mexican food and I love finding ways to keep the flavors while staying under my point value. Here are some of my favorites.
Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Cook in a microwave at 80% power for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with tortilla chips.
Spray a 13x9 inch baking pan

Whip egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tarter and salt. Whip until stiff and dry. Add sugar, beating constantly until very stiff. Fold in crushed peppermints. Drop by spoonfuls onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 275 degrees for about one hour or until firm. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Juice the oranges into a shaker cup filled with ice cubes. Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Pour in the almond syrup, gin, grapefruit juice and bitters to taste. Garnish with an orange twist or a maraschino cherry.

Place the first six ingredients in a medium pot. Heat over medium heat until the butter and coconut oil are melted. Add the xanthan gum and cinnamon. Whisk until smooth. Let the syrup cool slightly. Transfer to an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator. Makes about 2 cups.

Soak the beans in water for 8 hours or overnight. Drain and place in a large pot with the stock and onion. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Add the bay leaf and continue to cook for another 1 to 2 hours or until the beans are tender.
Dried chickpeas are cooked in water to make a delicious side dish or salad.
Add the bay leaf and continue to cook for another 1 to 2 hours or until the beans are tender.
Drain the beans and discard the bay leaf. Serve hot.
Melt butter in a pan. Add garlic and cumin and saut for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and saut until heated through. Add peas. Season with black pepper and serve hot.
Add oil and onions to a medium saucepan and saute on low heat, stirring, until very well done. Add the carrot and chickpeas, and saute for 2 minutes, stirring continuously. Add stock and bring to boil. Add seasonings and simmer on low

Peel and dice sweet potatoesput in large skillet with 2 Tbsp olive oil and onions. Saute onions for 5 minutes or so till onions are tender, then add garlic, sweet potatoes, chili flakes, thyme, salt and pepper. Continue to saute 5-10 minutes more or till the sweet potatoes are tender. Drain off excess liquid and mix in diced zucchini. Mix well. Turn into oiled 2 quart baking dish. In separate bowl beat eggs. Pour over sweet potato mixture and bake uncovered for 30 minutes or till egg mixture is set and golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite topping.

Bake or steam the potatoes until they are soft and cooked. Peel them and then add them to a small pan with the garlic and a little water and boil until they are soft and mashable. Add the rest of the ingredients and the frozen spinach and mix until all is well incorporated. Add more milk if you want the mash to be lighter. Serve immediately.

In a large pot, add the beans and stock. Add the salsa, carrot and celery. Add the taco seasoning. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and cook for 20 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine the masa harina flour and salt. Stir well. Add 1/3 cup of the chicken stock to the masa harina flour and salt mixture. Stir until the flour is moistened and a soft dough forms. Add the remaining stock, a little at a time. Continue to stir until the dough is soft and holds together. Form the dough into 1-inch balls. Drop the balls into the pot. Cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Add the chicken to the pot. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes. Add the remaining salsa and stir well. Cover and cook for another 10 minutes. Top each serving with a generous amount of cheese.

Combine all of the dry ingredients in a plastic bag. Add the breasts and shake to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in skillet. Add the breasts and cook until no longer pink in the middle. Remove to a plate and cover to keep warm. Add the remaining oil to the pan. Add the garlic powder and cook for 30 seconds. Add the sauce and the remaining seasonings. Stir until the sauce is thickened. Add the chicken and the remaining cheeses. Stir until the cheeses are melted. Serve on a bed of pasta.

In saucepan, combine soy sauce, sugar, garlic and honey. Cook over medium heat until mixture is boiling. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20 minutes. Remove ribs and place in baking dish. Pour sauce over ribs. Bake uncovered for 2 hours at 325 degrees. Baste ribs occasionally. Yields about 16 servings.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water until tender but firm. Drain. Pour the yogurt over the hot pasta and toss until well coated. In a small bowl combine honey and concentrate. Pour over salad and toss to coat. Add mandarin oranges, grapes, and apples. Add celery and black walnuts. Toss to blend. Chill until serving time.
name: yogurt apple saladingredients: red delicious apple, golden delicious apples, seedless raisin, celery, cheddar cheese, macadamia nuts, orange, juice of, vanilla yogurt, ground cinnamonpreparation:In medium bowl, combine apples, raisins, celery, cheddar cheese, and nuts. In a small bowl, blend orange juice into yogurt. Pour over salad and toss well. Sprinkle cinnamon on top. May eat salad then or chill for an hour.
name: autumn fruit saladingredients: granny smith apples, red seedless grapes

In crockpot combine sauce, diced tomatoes, onion, garlic, dried italian seasoning. Add meatballs and stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or until meatballs are tender. Stir in spaghetti. Cover and cook for an additional 15 minutes or until spaghetti is heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with crusty italian bread.

In shallow bowl, beat egg and add mustard. Add garlic to breadcrumbs. Dip chops in egg mixture then roll in crumbs. In skillet, heat oil and fry chops until golden brown on both sides. Drain and keep warm. Make gravy by adding water to flour mixture and stirring until thick. Stir in mustard.

Cut the chicken breasts into small pieces. Saute the onion and garlic until soft in a large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle with the salt and cook 5 minutes longer. Add the cream cheese and cook 5 minutes longer until the mixture is melted. Add the milk and chipotle peppers and mix until well blended. Add the chicken pieces and mix until well coated with the sauce. Sprinkle with paprika before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet, saute garlic and chicken in butter until no longer pink. Add cream of chicken soup and cooked mixed vegetables. Heat thru. Spoon mixture into crusty or biscuit dough shells. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until bubbly and crust is browned.

Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil. When oil is hot, place a seared tuna steak in the hot oil and sear for 1-2 minutes per side. Remove and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine avocado. Mango. Jalapeno. Red onion. Fresh cilantro. Lime juice. And 2 tablespoons olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place seared tuna steak on top of mango-avocado mixture. Garnish with salsa.

Cook frozen broccoli according to directions. Combine with soup. Add 1/2 cup milk and 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese. Add the rest of the shredded cheese and stir until mixed. Spread into a 13x9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with crushed ritz crackers. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves 4.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain. Mash with milk and garlic salt to desired consistency. Gently toss with mozzarella cheese and oregano. Spread in a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a small bowl mix salami, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil and roasted red peppers together with sour cream. Spread over top of potatoes. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Garnish with green olives.

Spread 1 side of each bagel with mayonnaise. Top with sliced vegetables, dill weed and chives and set aside. Cut each cooked turkey breast into 4 thin slices and place in between bagel halves. Top with tomatoes and lettuce and serve immediately.

Peel and cut potato into chunks. Boil until tender. Drain and add cream of mushroom soup and milk. Stir and cook until thick. Add green pepper and onion. Stir in seasonings. Pour into 2 qt. casserole dish. Bake at 350 until heated through, about 20-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. Add flour and baking powder. Fold in coconut. Press mixture into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Melt chocolate in the top of a double boiler. Stir in lime peel and pour over the cooled crust. Let stand until set. Cut into 16 squares. Makes 16 servings.
Directions: Combine cocoa powder, sugar, salt, and hot water in a medium saucepan. Stirring frequently, cook over medium heat until mixture boils. Stir in the half and half and heat through, but do not boil. Remove from heat and add vanilla and almond extracts. Blend well.
Directions: Combine sugar, cocoa, butter and milk in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add vanilla. Remove from heat and stir in coconut and oats. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Chill.

Combine all the dry ingredients and whisk well. In another bowl or large measuring cup, beat the eggs and milk together until well combined. Stir the wet into the dry until just blended. Heat the waffle iron and lightly brush with vegetable oil. Pour in the batter and cook until the waffle is golden brown and crispy on the outside and tender in the inside.

In a large bowl combine dry ingredients. Cream butter and sugar together. Add vanilla and eggs one at a time beating well after each one. Fold in apples. Pour into greased and floured bundt pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted comes out clean. Cool 20 minutes in pan.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. In a large bowl combine the cream cheese, eggs, sugar and vanilla extract until smooth. Fold in frozen sweet corn. In a small bowl combine the cream-style corn, muffin mix, milk, margarine and nutmegstir well with a whisk. Fold the muffin mix into the cream cheese mixturestir until smooth. Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dishbake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven or until the top is golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Most people would rather have a root canal than listen to a sales pitch. But a sales pitch is just a way of communicating about a product or service. And if you get your facts straight and present them well, a sales pitch can be a useful tool for getting your message across.
You can also use sales pitches to build up your own confidence in your ideas or your business.
In this article I'll explain how
Preheat broiler. Butter loaf. Mix green onion, poppy seeds and garlic powder. Spread on top of loaf. Broil until crisp and golden-brown. Cut into wedges and serve.

Melt the chocolate and butter in a heavy saucepan, stirring constantly until smooth and well blended. Stir in the vanilla and the sugar until smooth. Stir in the beaten eggs. Beat well until the mixture is smooth and glossy. Sift together the flour and salt and add it gradually to the mixture, beating well after each addition until smooth. Stir in the walnuts. Pour the mixture into a well buttered and floured 9 x 13- inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, or until the top is shiny and dry to the touch. Cool on a rack and cut into squares.

Place figs in a bowl and cover with cold water to cover by 2 inches. Soak for 2 hours. Drain, cover with boiling water, return to a boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer for 15 minutes until tender. Remove from heat, let cool 10 minutes. Strain through cheesecloth over bowl. (Discard solids.) Add 1 cup water, sugar, wine, orange rind and thyme sprigs, if using. Bring mixture to boil, then reduce heat, cover and simmer until thickened about 10 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool, remove thyme sprigs if using.

In a large bowl combine salmon fillets with 1 tablespoon pepper, 1 teaspoon sea salt, and the mandarin oranges. Let stand for 5 minutes. Add the mayonnaise, pineapple chunk, celery and almonds. Stir gently to blend. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Heat oil in large skillet. Add potatoes and cook for about 20 minutes or until brown. Add beer and cook for another few minutes. Add the cream and stir until the sauce thickens. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with crackers.

Place lard in a deep skillet. Cook over low heat until crisp. Remove and drain on paper towels. Add flour and stir until light brown. Add garlic and cook for 3-4 minutes. Stir in paprika and cook for another minute or two. Stir in vinegar and cook for a minute or two. Add cucumbers, salt and pepper. Add sour cream and mix well. Serve immediately.

In a 12 inch skillet, brown meat and sausage together. Add sauce and cook until meat and sausage are no longer pink. Top with cheese and let melt. Slice french bread into 4 inch lengths and place in baking dish. Spoon meat and sauce over bread and bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes until hot and bubbly. Serve with a garden salad.
Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Mix in pumpkin pie mix and granulated sugar until smooth. Fold in coolwhip. Spoon into crust. Refrigerate at least 4 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt. In another bowl combine oil and eggs. Stir in the flour mixture alternately with the squash-zucchini mixture until just moist. Stir in cheese. Spread batter in muffin cups. Bake 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Cool muffins in pans 5 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool completely on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large skillet combine the squash and muffin crumbs. Cook until the squash is tender. In a large bowl mix together the squash mixture, eggs, milk and butter. Add the onion powder, sage and seasonings to taste. Mix well. Pour into a greased 9 inch by 13 inch baking dish and bake for 40 minutes or until the top is browned.

Preheat oven to 350. Remove marinade from artichokes. Reserve marinade in a separate bowl. Spread artichokes on a baking sheet. Roast until lightly browned, 30-35 minutes. Remove from oven. In a large pot, heat 2 tbsp. oil over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent, 5-7 minutes. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add thyme and saute until fragrant, 1-2 minutes. Stir in marinated artichokes. Add broth, reserved marinade and beans. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Ladle into bowls. Garnish each bowl of soup with 2 teaspoons parmesan. Season with pepper. Top each bowl of soup with croutons crostini.

Mix almonds, sunflower seeds, honey and salt together in large bowl. Stir constantly until mixed well. Spread onto large baking sheet or shallow baking pan. Bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Spread onto a second baking sheet or shallow baking pan and bake for another hour stirring every 15 minutes. Cool completely. Mix together dried tart cherries and apricots and stir into almond mixture. Spread onto baking sheet and bake for 1 hour stirring every 15 minutes. Cool completely and store in airtight container for several days or freeze for several weeks.

Mix dry ingredients. Beat eggs and oil together. Add milk. Stir in dry ingredients. Fold in sun-dried tomatoes and olives. Divide evenly into 12 greased muffin cups. Bake in moderatly hot oven 20 to 25 minutes.

In a large bowl combine the beer, brown sugar, grainy mustard, white vinegar and vegemite. Add the rosemary and mix well. Add the steaks to the bowl and turn to coat them with the marinade mixture. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it into the refrigerator to marinate overnight. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).Remove the beef from the marinade and discard the leftover marinade.Place the beef on the rack of a baking sheet, and bake it uncovered for 30 minutes. Turn the beef over and bake an additional 10 minutes, or until desired degree of doneness.Remove the beef from the oven and allow it to rest on the baking sheet for 10 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add lemon juice and basil. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Stir in Parmesan cheese and remove from heat. Place fish in shallow baking dish. Pour butter mixture over fish. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Sift together the dry ingredients. Beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Fold in the dry ingredients in a slurry. Mixture will be lumpy. Dip shrimp, chunky-cut chicken and vegetables into the batter and deep fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 9x13-inch baking dish. In small saucepan over medium heat, stir together the cornstarch, salt and 1 cup of the whole milk until smooth. Whisk in the sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. In medium bowl, beat egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored. Gradually whisk 1/2 cup of the hot milk mixture into the egg yolks until blended. Return all the mixture to the saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until mixture is thick, about 5 minutes. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake until center is set and top is golden brown, 20-25 minutes. Cool slightly. Sprinkle with raisins. Stir in butter and vanilla until melted. Stir in the remaining 1 cup of milk until smooth. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve warm or chilled.

In a large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Add chili powder. Stir in soup. Add chicken. Cook until heated through. Place in taco shells. Top with lettuce and tomato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Unroll one pie crust and press it into a 9-inch glass or ceramic pie pan. Spread the sugar on the bottom of the pastry and set aside. Combine the butter and chestnut puree and bring it to a boil. Stir in the flour and cocoa. Beat the egg yolks together in a separate bowl. Slowly pour in the hot chestnut mixture and mix well. Add the brandy and stir. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie pan. Roll out the other pie crust and place it on top of the filling. Seal the edges and cut slits in the top of the crust. Brush the top of the pastry with the beaten egg. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes.

Slice bread in half lengthwise. Squeeze garlic cloves into each half. Spread butter on both sides. Sprinkle with salt. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
french toast | RecipeZazz.com
French toast is an easy breakfast or dessert dish. Eggs and bread are dipped in a mixture of milk and seasonings and cooked in a pan. The flavor is similar to pancake. French Toast is also called as eggy bread and is often served with maple syrup and butter.
French Toast Recipes | Epicurious.com
Easy, quick French Toast made with brioche or challah or croissants. Perfect for weekend brunch or an easy weeknight breakfast.
Easy French Toast Recipe | Allrecipes
This is my favorite way of making French Toast. It is moist and delicious. It is even better with challah bread.
French Toast Recipe - Food.com
French Toast is easy and delicious! Perfect for breakfast or dessert. Serve with maple

Cut up the chicken into small pieces, season with salt and pepper. Mix the yoghurt with the breadcrumbs, season with salt and pepper. Dip the chicken pieces in the yoghurt then roll in the breadcrumbs. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and cook the chicken until golden brown. Serve with a wedge of lemon.

Thaw spinach and drain well. Add onions, cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, and cream cheese. Mix well and pour into a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Combine cracker crumbs with melted butter, sprinkle over mixture in baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Heat a small saucepan with olive oil over medium heat, sauté garlic until fragrant. Add scallions and sauté for 3 minutes until wilted, remove from heat. Blend red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper in a bowl until emulsified. Add the hot garlic-scallion mixture and blend until smooth. Store in refrigerator. Shake before using.
name: HONEY BERRY VINAIGRETTE
ingredients: VINEGAR, HONEY, Dijon MUSTARD, Onion, SALAD OIL, Salt and PEPPER
preparation:Whisk together VINEGAR, HONEY and MUSTARD. Add ONION. Whisk while adding OIL. Season with SALT and PEPPER. CHILL at least one hour. Store in refrigerator. Shake before using
name: CLASSIC RASPBERRY VINAIGRETTE
ingredients: raspberry vinegar, raspberries, honey,

In large pot over medium heat, saute onion and garlic until soft. Add coleslaw mix and saute 3 minutes. Add beans, broth, water and kielbasa. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until carrots are tender and kielbasa is cooked through. Add tomatoes and cook 3 minutes more. Season with pepper.

Combine pumpkin, milk, and spices. Add egg, butter, and sugar. Beat until well blended. Spread over 9x13 pan. Sprinkle cake mix over. Melt butter and pour over top. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake 45 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

To prepare fava beans, place 1/2 pound dry fava beans in a bowl of cold water overnight. In the morning drain the beans and set aside for later use. Place 1/2 cup of the fava beans in a food processor with the garlic, olive oil, lemon juice and tahini. Blend until smooth, adding the water slowly to obtain the desired consistency. Refrigerate until serving time.

In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water. Let stand 5 minutes. Add oil, honey and eggstir until blended. Gradually stir in 3 cups of the flour. Beat at medium speed of a mixer for 2 minutes, scraping bowl often. Stir in vital wheat gluten and remaining flourmix to form a soft dough. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, 8-10 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, 1 hour 30 minutes to 2 hours. Punch down doughdivide in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 12-in. square. Cut dough crosswise into 16 (4-in.) stripscut each strip lengthwise into 4 (2-in.) strips. Place 4 strips 2 in. apart on greased baking sheetscover and let rise until doubled in size, 30 minutes to 1 hour. Bake at 40

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook pretzels in a 13x9 inch baking dish in a 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. In a large bowl, mix pretzels with sugar and butter. Press into prepared baking pan and bake 10 minutes. Cool and set aside. In a large bowl, mix cream cheese and sugar. Blend in one package of Cool Whip. Spread on top of crumb crust and refrigerate. In a 1 1/2 quart saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Dissolve 1 package of Jello in boiling water. Pour over crust and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Cut into squares and garnish with pineapple and strawberries.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a medium bowl combine the first six ingredients. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Add the milk all at once and stir just until mixed. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Do not overbake.

Prepare graham cracker crust as directed on box. In a medium bowl combine pudding mix, pineapple, 1/4 cup of the water. Beat until smooth. Spoon into prepared graham cracker crust. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Top with frozen whipped topping before serving. Garnish with a few extra pineapple chunks if desired.
name: pineapple chiffon cakeingredients: 1 cup flour 1/2 teaspoon salt 3/4 cup shortening 1/2 cup sugar 2 eggs 1 teaspoon vanilla 1 1/2 cups pineapple tidbits 1/2 cup chopped pecans 1 can (20 ounce) pineapple tidbits, drained 2/3 cup water 1/2 cup sugar 1/4 teaspoon salt 2 cups boiling water 1 cup sugar 1/4 teaspoon salt 1/4 teaspoon vanilla 4 ounces (1 stick) margarine or butter 1/2 cup chopped

Mix cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of soy sauceset aside. Cut chicken into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute chicken and ginger 3 to 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Add pineapple juice. Bring to a boilcover, reduce heat, and simmer 5 minutes or until pineapple is tender. Place 1/2 cup of the sauce in a small bowlstir in cornstarch mixture and remaining 2 tablespoons of soy sauce. Heat to a boilstir constantly until thickened. Pour over the chicken mixturetoss to coat. Stir in the snow peastoss to mix. Sprinkle with almonds.

Heat a nonstick pan or griddle over medium-high heat. Brush one side of each bread slice with melted butter and sprinkle with garlic powder and dried parsley. Spread with honey ham and mozzarella cheese, then top with cheddar and red onions. Grill 3 minutes per side or until golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve with your favorite condiments and enjoy!

Wash tomatoes. Core the tomatoes and cut into small chunks. Place in large bowl. Add onion. Pour olive oil over top. Season with salt and pepper. Allow to stand for 15 minutes. Cook macaroni as directed. Drain well. Add tomato mixture and stir. Add feta cheese. Toss well. Serve.

Heat the oil in a large heavy bottomed pot. Add the leek and cook for 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes, carrot, bay leaves and red chile and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in the stock and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the beans and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Mix onions and dried cranberries together in a medium bowl. In a small bowl stir together balsamic and apple juice. Sprinkle with thyme. Toss well to combine. Let stand at least 1 hour. Heat olive oil in a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add onion mixture and cook until tender and the juices are mostly evaporated. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat. Add potatoes and seasoning salt and cook for 10 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown and crispy. Drain excess fat. Pour potatoes in casserole dish. In a medium bowl, whisk together cream, eggs and pepper. Pour mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle ham on top. Sprinkle with bell pepper, onion, and cheddar cheese. Bake for 40 minutes or until hot.

Pour the water and oil in the pan of your bread machine. Sprinkle the yeast over the top and set the machine on the dough cycle. When the cycle is completed add the honey, oat bran, whole wheat flour and the remaining ingredients. Set the machine on the basic white cycle. Let rise in the pan for 30 minutes or until doubled in size. Remove the dough from the pan and gently deflate it on a floured surface. Shape the dough into a loaf and place it in a greased loaf pan. Set the pan in a warm place and allow the bread to rise for 30 to 45 minutes or until doubled in size. Bake the loaf for 30 to 35 minutes in a 350 degree F oven or until it is browned and sounds hollow when tapped. Makes 2 loaves.

Combine water, margarine and salt. Bring to a boil. Slowly add flour, mixing well. Turn down heat and cook until mixture is thick and smooth. Remove from heat. Add eggs, one at a time beating well after each addition. Cool. Fill pastry bag or plastic bag with icing. Pipe on a cookie sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Cut with sharp knife. Fill with ice cream and fudge or caramel sauce. Roll in nuts if desired.

Bring lean ground beef to room temperature. In a large skillet, brown the beef over medium heat with the onion, until cooked through. Drain the fat. Add the tomatoes sauce, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Heat through. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream and the milk. Stir into the meat mixture. Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 300 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with the shredded Cheddar cheese and bake for 5 more minutes until the cheese is melted. Serve with pasta or over rice.

Remove any tough stems from spinach and coarsely chop leaves. In a small bowl combine spinach and jalapeno (if using), set aside. In a food processor or blender combine cilantro, scallions, garlic and mayonnaise. Pulse until blended. Add spinach mixture and pulse again until combined. Stir in goat cheese and lime juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with tortilla chips or vegetables for dipping.

Combine the milk and white chocolate in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook until melted stirring constantly. Cool for a few minutes, then whisk in the powdered sugar. Whisk in the vanilla extract until smooth. Spread between layers and on top of cake.
Combine 1 envelope of powdered drink mix with 1 cup of water. Stir until completely dissolved. Combine the remaining ingredients in a punch bowl. Stir in the powdered drink mix. Chill thoroughly.

Heat the oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat and cook the shallot for 30 seconds. Add the brussels sprouts and cook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with the pistachios and cook for another minute or so until the pistachios turn golden brown. Squeeze the lemon juice on top and serve immediately.
Heat oil and saute onions for 10 minutes until caramelized. Cool and mix into remaining ingredients in blender. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine cake mix, water and eggs. Beat until well blended. Spread evenly into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely. In small bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar. Beat until smooth. Spread over cooled cake. Refrigerate until firm. Makes 20 bars.
In the bowl of an electric mixer combine the butter, cocoa powder and cream cheese over low speed and mix until thoroughly combined. Increase speed to high and cream ingredients until light and fluffy. Reduce speed to low and slowly add the powdered sugar, buttermilk, and vanilla. Beat until mixture is smooth and thoroughly combined. Frost cake as usual.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine cake mix, water and eggs. Beat until well blended. Spread evenly into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake

In a medium saucepan combine gelatin, hot water and orange rind. Let stand until softened. Add juice and salt and mix well. Add ice cream and mix well. Pour into pie shell and chill overnight. Garnish with fruit cocktail and macaroons.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, mix sausage, baking mix, apples, craisins, raisins, pecans and eggs until well blended. Roll into 1 1/2-inch balls. Place balls on ungreased baking sheet and bake 15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve warm or cool. Makes about 4 dozen balls.

Combine bread crumbs and butter. Press into 4 patties. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Drain jalapenos and pimientos. Combine with onion flakes and garlic. Divide into 4 equal portions. Form each portion into a round. Press a cheese olive into the center of each round. Press a jalapeno and pimiento into the cheese olive. Place a burger patty on top of each olive. Spread remaining cheese over each patty. Makes 4 sandwiches.

In a heavy skillet cooked the chicken with the onions and garlic until the chicken is no longer pink. Add the chicken broth and seasonings and simmer 30 minutes. Add the hominy and cook another 15 minutes. Serve with sour cream, salsa and tortilla chips.

Brown bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove baconadd onion and cook until golden brown. Return bacon to skilletstir in crushed red pepper flakes and garlic. Continue to cook until mixture is fragrant but not browned. Add tomatoes, breaking them up with a wooden spoon as they cook. Season with salt and pepper. Heat sauce over low heat for 10 minutes. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pastatoss with sauce, parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut the garlic into small cloves. Finely chop the shallots. Heat the oil over medium-low heat until the oil starts to smoke a little. Add the garlic, shallots, and the greens. Stir to combine. Stir the white wine into the mixture. Cook until the greens are tender about 5-7 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Brown sausage. Add potato mix to pan. Add water. Cover. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add mixed veggies. Cook for 10 minutes. Top with cheese. Cook for 2 minutes.

Soak aubergines in water overnight to make them less bitter. Remove any stalks and slice off the tops. Stuff each aubergine with one or two walnuts. Place the nuts in a food processor or blender with garlic, chili flakes, salt & pepper to taste. Add some water and blend to a smooth puree. Spoon a tablespoon of this mixture into each stuffed aubergine. Wrap each one up in a slice of cauliflower and dip into boiling water for one or two minutes to steam. When ready to serve, put each wrapped stuffed aubergine in an ovenproof dish, pour over olive oil to cover, bake for about twenty minutes at 175 Celsius. Serve hot or cold.

Combine coconut with flour, salt and pepper. Beat egg. Dip chicken into egg and then into coconut mixture. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve with rice.

Drain and cut artichokes in half. In a large bowl, combine mayo and cheese and mix well. Stir in garlic and black pepper to taste and mix well. Fold in artichokes and mix well. Transfer to a 1 qt casserole dish and sprinkle with french fried onions. Bake for 25 minutes at 375 degrees or until heated through and onions are lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temp.

In a blender, combine first four ingredients and blend until smooth. Fill glasses with ice. Pour in vodka, cranberry juice and lime juice. Top with more ice if desired. Garnish each glass with a slice of cucumber. 1 serving = 160 calories

Cut the tomatoes into cubes. Finely chop the onion. Combine the tomato mixture with the onion. Add the olive oil, herbs, salt and pepper to taste. Preheat the broiler. Cut the bread in half lengthwise. Lay bread on a foil-covered baking sheet, cut side down, and broil until toasted, about 1 to 2 minutes. Top with the tomato mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and broil until melted, about 1 minute. Serves 6 as an appetizer.

Combine all of the ingredients except the peanut butter. Mix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Flatten slightly with the back of the spoon. Add the peanut butter on top. Let stand until the peanut butter is completely set. Cut into bites.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread pineapple evenly over bottom of greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Spread cake mix over pineapple and pat down gently. Spread pie filling over top of cake mix. Spread remaining cake mix over filling. Cut margarine into slices or bits and place evenly over top of cake mix. Bake for 50 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream, if desired.

Combine first 6 ingredients. Add steaks. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes. Cook in broiler 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Let stand 10 minutes. Slice thinly across grain. Place between french bread. Serve warm. Makes 6 sandwiches.
Combine ingredients in a bowl until thoroughly mixed. Roll into small balls and store in an airtight container. Refrigerate. Makes about 10 balls.

Slice banana and set aside. Combine egg, cloves, ginger, nutmeg, and cinnamon in small bowlwhisk. In 10-inch skillet or griddle over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add 1 tablespoon batter to skillet for each slice of bread. Cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove from skillet. Spread with desired amount of butter or margarine. Top with sliced banana and sprinkle with nutmeg. Drizzle with syrup if desired. Serve immediately. Serves 2.

Prepare pudding and pie filling as directed on box. Remove 1/4 cup of the pie filling and place in a medium bowl. Add the rest of the pie filling to the pudding. Gently fold in the cool whip. Add the reserved pie filling. Fold in the apple and pineapple. Refrigerate and serve.

Slice the onions into small pieces and add to a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter beans and cook for about 2 minutes. Add sauerkraut to skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes or until liquid from sauerkraut is gone. Add butter to pan and mix well. Add in sausage. Cook for 10 minutes or until sausage is browned. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Cut smoked ham hock into 2-inch cubes. Brown bacon in skillet. Drain fat. Add onions to bacon drippings. Cook until onions are tender. Add collard greens. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add smoked ham hock cubes, salt, black pepper, water, onions and bacon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Add hot pepper sauce. Cover and cook for another 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

Crumble tofu between hands and place in a bowl. Add tomato sauce, lime juice, onion and oregano. Mix well and transfer to a shallow baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until browned. Sprinkle with garlic powder and coconut and bake an additional 5-10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve on tortillas with shredded lettuce.

Cut the block of tofu into 3/4" cubes. In a large bowl mix together the sherry wine, soy sauce, orange zest, juice, sugar and cornstarch. Add the tofu cubes and stir until coated. Pour half of the mixture into a large saute pan and turn up the heat. Cook the tofu until golden brown. Pour the remaining mixture over the cooked tofu. Stir for a few seconds. Add the hot sauce, garlic, olive oil and toss until the sauce is smooth. Garnish with the orange slices.

Place all in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until it reaches soft ball stage or 240f on a candy thermometer, about 20 to 25 minutes stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and beat vigorously with a mixer until it is glossy and thick about 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and stir in vanilla. Cool to room temperature before serving. This makes about 4 cups. Store in the refrigerator.

Boil 1 qt water in saucepan. Cook green beans in boiling water 3-4 minutes. Drain. Toss with bacon grease and onions. Combine remaining ingredients and toss with green beans. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Add turmeric to boiling water and let steep for 10 minutes. Strain the tea into a saucepan and add the milk. Warm over low heat and serve immediately. Add lemon juice and stir. Pour into cups and garnish with almond oil and agave nectar.

Make a starter by mixing 1/4 cup of white wheat flour and 1/4 cup of water and setting it aside over night. The next day, add 1/2 cup of the starter to 2 cups of whole wheat flour and 1/4 cup of milk. Mix well and set aside. Add 1/4 cup of olive oil and 2 tsp. of sugar. Mix well. Add 2 tsp. of salt and knead until smooth. Place dough in a greased bowl and cover. Let rise overnight. The next day punch dough down and divide into 2 loaves. Place each loaf into a greased loaf pan and let rise again until doubled. Bake at 350 degrees F for 50 minutes.

Melt butter in casserole dish. Saute purple onions until tender. Add tomato slices. Season to taste. Pour in milk and mix well. Sprinkle onion mixture evenly over croutons in casserole dish. Sprinkle on monterey jack cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Remove from broiler and cool to room temperature. Sprinkle basil on top and serve.

In a large frying pan or skillet, add butter. Heat over medium heat. Once melted, add garlic. Add chestnut butter. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add lime juice, zest, and nutmeg. Cook until fragrant. Add the brussels sprouts. Cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat eggs until slightly frothy. Add cream and blend well. Add frozen orange juice concentrate and orange zest. Mix until blended. Add brown sugar and cinnamon. Blend well. Slice English muffins into 1/2-inch pieces. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add muffin pieces and brown on both sides. Place in baking dish. Pour egg mixture over muffin pieces. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve warm with syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine all seasonings in small bowl. Rub seasoning all over roast. Brown roast in large skillet. Add bacon and continue cooking until browned. Transfer to baking dish. Add veggies to skillet. Add olive oil and cook until veggies are tender. Pour veggies over roast. Bake uncovered for 1 hour. Serve over mashed potatoes.

In a 9×13 pan combine yogurt and lemon juice. Set aside. Prepare gelatin according to package directions. Pour into pan with yogurt. Let set for 5 minutes. Add 1 container of cool whip and blend well. Add lemon zest. Pour into prepared crust. Chill 1 hour. Just before serving top with remaining cool whip.

Brown ground beef and onion in skillet. Add green bell pepper and cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Spread in greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Peel and cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Bake in microwave on high for 5 minutes or until they begin to soften. Add chili and cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes. Top with sour cream. Makes 4 servings.

Pound the steak with the smooth side of a meat hammer or mallet to about 1/4 inch thickness. Cut the steak into 4-inch pieces. Place in a plastic bag with the soy sauce, pepper and cornstarchshake to coat well. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steak pieces to the hot oilbrown the meat on all sides. Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of the fat in the skillet. Add the mushrooms, onion and red wine to the skilletbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the soup and heat through. Serve the steak and sauce over pasta. Serve with a green salad if desired.

Bring speckled butterbeans, water, and seasoning to a boil in large stockpot. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes or until tender. While beans are simmering, brown sausage in large frying pan. Add onion and bell pepper. Cook until tender. Add tomatoes and tomato sauce. Cook until heated through. Stir into beans. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Serve with rice.
